Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to join an internship at a Coffee & Tea company that

values your future success and prioritizes your passion for positive change?

Check out this internship starting September 2024 and Unleash Your Possibility at JDE Peet's!




Company Details

At JDE Peet's (before: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS), we're not just about Coffee or Tea; we're all about the moments and connections they spark. With a history spanning 270 years, we've been shaping the daily rituals of people worldwide, driven by our dedication to quality products and sustainability.




We are action-driven and deliver our commitments. This means the freedom to challenge the status quo and to look for different perspectives. Our teams work by four fundamental values: We are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach. These values paint the best picture of the kind of fast-moving culture you'll join at JDE Peet's.




Job Description

Join us as Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you'll delve into our organization's dynamic Ecosystem to extract valuable insights. You will learn how to identify and emphasize high-impact data attributes, contributing to informed business decision-making.




Your Key Activities Will Be

Conduct a comprehensive inventory of data within our Ecosystem
Analyze the usage patterns of different data attributes, identifying high-impact data fields and underutilized areas, and providing recommendations for strategic enhancements.
Quantify the volume and significance of data points associated with each field, offering a comprehensive view of our data landscape
Analyze the relation of data usage with the user profile (optional)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather additional insights and context about data usage and dependencies
Document findings in clear and concise reports, presentations, and visualizations




Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning experience in our Data Management team. During your internship, you'll gain valuable insights into strategic data analysis and decision-making. You will collaborate with various teams, analyse different data points, and identify key areas for business improvement.




What's in it for you?

A monthly internship allowance of ‚Ç¨525 (full-time)
Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
Paid holidays for each internship term
Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
The chance to learn from the best Data Management professionals out there!




Qualifications

Are you bursting with fresh ideas and a hunger for learning? We want you!




Here's What We're Looking For

Academic Program: You are enrolled in a BSc or MSc program for the entirety of the internship, preferably in Data Analytics, Business, or a related field.
Skillset: You possess strong MS Office skills and fluent proficiency in speaking and written English ‚Äì Having some similar hands-on experience with food research activities is always a benefit.
Personal traits: You have a structured approach, a driven and energetic personality, excellent communication and people skills, and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 5 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to January.
Availability: You can join the internship for 3 - 4 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.




As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:

Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.




Additional Information

Are you ready to Unleash Your Possibility within JDE Peet's?




Here's How To Apply

Upload your resume (in English) using our LinkedIn or career site application form.
After applying, we'll reach out within three weeks to let you know what's next.
During the application process, you'll be asked to do an online assessment and at least one interview at our Utrecht office.




If you have questions, don't hesitate to contact our Campus team at IHQinternships@jdecoffee.com -- We're here to help!

Data Analyst, Utrecht




Job Description

For one of our clients we are looking for a Data Analyst in the Utrecht region. Our client is a major player in the food industry. If you are a Data Analyst with experience in the food industry and knowledge of the following areas that you see in this vacancy, please share your CV. This position is on a secondment basis.




Job Requirements:

2 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Completed Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree
Specialist in: Power BI, SAP, Excel
Experience with Data Modeling
Experience in the food industry is a plus
Proficiency in English, both spoken and written

Our client is an inspiring and forward-thinking organization. The culture is based on collaboration, personal development, and creating societal impact. Working here means participating in meaningful projects with a dedicated team committed to sustainability and innovation.

Contract duration: 4+ months (Option to extend)
Market-conform rate

Location: North Holland
Start date: ASAP

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)




As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:

Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.




The company:

Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.




Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.




The team:

You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.




The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.




The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.




Responsibilities:

Requirements gathering

Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans

Data Analysis

Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.

Data Visualization

Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users

Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation

Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency‚Äã

Data modelling and Transformation

Build data systems and pipelines‚Äã based on a medallion architecture

Structure sales processes

Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio




Ideal candidate profile:

The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).




Continue the conversation

Interested? We would love to hear from you!




Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst - Intern
Description:
Department

WDTech - R&D

We are Walker & Dunlop. We are one of the largest providers of capital to the commercial real estate industry, enabling real estate owners and operators to bring their visions of communities ‚Äî where people live, work, shop, and play ‚Äî to life. We are committed to creating meaningful social, environmental, and economic change in our communities. We believe seeking diverse talent and promoting the inclusion of all perspectives are more than moral imperatives ‚Äì they are critical to our success and ability to innovate and grow.

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Intern to work with our Data Science and Analytics organization, which develops and maintains our solutions for data reporting, visualization, and data cataloging.

You will be based in the Netherlands, and you will collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Data/Software Engineers to further your knowledge in analyzing, visualizing, and processing real estate data.

Our ideal timeframe for the internship is 6 months, beginning on the 1st of September 2024, with a minimum availability of 24 hours total or 3 working days, per week, with no more than eight (8) hours on any one day. The internship stipend is ‚Ç¨650 per month.

Learning objectives


Produce high-quality visualizations in Power BI
Acquire and demonstrate business-level understanding of Tableau and Power BI
Learn and apply geospatial and geohash querying abilities in SQL
Understand and support the Data Management and Governance initiatives in improving our data catalog
Experience and understand industry standards in Agile and Software Development Lifecycle processes


The impact you will have


Build visualizations in Power BI
Collaborate with Data Analysts to understand and catalogue new data sources
Work on the development of a clear and detailed data catalog


What we look for


Currently enrolled at HBO in Computer Science, Math, or related technical field
At least 1 year of SQL experience
Data visualization experience in Tableau or Power BI
Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English
Desire and eagerness to invest time to learn and grow as a contributor


Bonus points for


Programming knowledge in one or more of: Python, Julia, C++, SCILAB, GNU Octave, R


What We Offer‚ÄØ


You will have the opportunity to accelerate our rapidly growing organization.
We‚Äôre a lean team, so your impact will be felt immediately.
Agile working environment with flexible working hours and location, career advancement, and competitive compensation package.
We are a family friendly company.
We arrange social activities to help our employees and families become familiar with each other and our culture.
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.


EEO Statement

We are committed to equity in all steps of the recruitment and employment experience. We believe in equal access to opportunities in our workplace. We do not tolerate discrimination, including harassment, based on any characteristic protected by applicable law, such as race, color, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex, age, disability, veteran or military status, and genetic information. We strive to be a safe place to ask questions, build professional relationships, and develop careers.

SPAM

Please be wary of recruitment scams. An indication of a scam might be a request for sensitive or bank information at the time of application or emails coming from a non walkerdunlop.com email address. Please call us at 301.215.5500, if you have any concerns about information requested during or after the application process.

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Intern to work with our Data Science and Analytics organization, which develops and maintains our solutions for data reporting, visualization, and data cataloging.

You will be based in the Netherlands, and you will collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Data/Software Engineers to further your knowledge in analyzing, visualizing, and processing real estate data.

Our ideal timeframe for the internship is 6 months, beginning on the 1st of September 2024, with a minimum availability of 24 hours total or 3 working days, per week, with no more than eight (8) hours on any one day. The internship stipend is ‚Ç¨650 per month.

Learning objectives

  • Produce high-quality visualizations in Power BI
  • Acquire and demonstrate business-level understanding of Tableau and Power BI
  • Learn and apply geospatial and geohash querying abilities in SQL
  • Understand and support the Data Management and Governance initiatives in improving our data catalog
  • Experience and understand industry standards in Agile and Software Development Lifecycle processes

The impact you will have

  • Build visualizations in Power BI
  • Collaborate with Data Analysts to understand and catalogue new data sources
  • Work on the development of a clear and detailed data catalog

What we look for

  • Currently enrolled at HBO in Computer Science, Math, or related technical field
  • At least 1 year of SQL experience
  • Data visualization experience in Tableau or Power BI
  • Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Desire and eagerness to invest time to learn and grow as a contributor

Bonus points for

  • Programming knowledge in one or more of: Python, Julia, C++, SCILAB, GNU Octave, R

What We Offer‚ÄØ

  • You will have the opportunity to accelerate our rapidly growing organization.
  • We‚Äôre a lean team, so your impact will be felt immediately.
  • Agile working environment with flexible working hours and location, career advancement, and competitive compensation package.
  • We are a family friendly company.
  • We arrange social activities to help our employees and families become familiar with each other and our culture.
  • Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.

EEO Statement

We are committed to equity in all steps of the recruitment and employment experience. We believe in equal access to opportunities in our workplace. We do not tolerate discrimination, including harassment, based on any characteristic protected by applicable law, such as race, color, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex, age, disability, veteran or military status, and genetic information. We strive to be a safe place to ask questions, build professional relationships, and develop careers.

SPAM

Please be wary of recruitment scams. An indication of a scam might be a request for sensitive or bank information at the time of application or emails coming from a non walkerdunlop.com email address. Please call us at 301.215.5500, if you have any concerns about information requested during or after the application process.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data-analist




Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your further Analytics engineering career with our advanced training program while working for our partner organization. We fully pay this program as well as your salary.




‚úÖ Help a data driven team and their business by developing data-driven business solutions

‚úÖ Working on the data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboard

‚úÖ Build data pipelines to facilitate reporting

‚úÖ Improving and automating data flows and processes




The role itself

¬∑ 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you‚Äôll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, Analytics engineering & data engineering fundamentals

¬∑ Work 4 days a week as an Analytics engineer at one of our clients

¬∑ Join us every Wednesday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads

¬∑ At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly




As an Analytics engineer you will work together with Data engineer & BI developers, whereby you will contribute on developing data-driven business solutions. You will do this in the form of machine learning models, strategic analyses and a self-service data model.

A big focus of your role will be data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboards. You will also be the one that transforms raw data to structured data files. To achieve this, you will build data pipelines to fully automate the availability of data for reporting.




About Xccelerated

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same.




This is you

From a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality.

We are looking for a communicatively strong and enthusiastic colleague with a passion for data. Next to this, you have:

‚úÖ A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree

‚úÖ 1-4 years of work experience as an Analytics engineer/BI Developer/Data analyst

‚úÖ Experience with data modelling, dashboarding and visualization (PowerBI)

‚úÖ Experience with SQL; preferably also Python

‚úÖ Experience with Cloud components




What Xccelerated offers




üí∞ Good salary

üõ´ 25 vacation days

üìô Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training

üìä Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)

‚úÖ Challenging assignments

üíª Macbook and Iphone

üçé Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar

üéíFlexibility in working from home & at the office

Interested? We‚Äôd love to meet you!




Please get in touch! Contact Jessie Loogman at jloogman@xccelerated.io or by phone at +31650999663.




Application Process

¬∑ First interview with one of our recruitment consultants

¬∑ Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote)

**We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to ‚Ç¨60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: BI-Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a BI and data visualization specialist who is passionate about data, enjoys creating visualizations, and can't go a day without developing an awesome dashboard or data mart.




We need someone who is ready to take responsibility for a pool of dashboards for the finance department ‚Äî developing a roadmap for data marts and dashboards, creating new dashboards and data marts, improving existing ones, and finding ways to enhance our business processes. Our tech stack includes Oracle NetSuite as the primary source, a variety of SaaS services as auxiliary sources, Oracle and PostgreSQL databases, and Tableau. This role involves collaborating directly with stakeholders and managing small projects.




What You Will Do:




Develop user-friendly and valuable management dashboards as part of the finance team.
Manage the pool of dashboards as a product: gather requirements, maintain a backlog of enhancements and ideas, and keep your dashboards and data organized.
Create simple ETL pipelines and manage SQL code.
Assist employees in self-service and improve their data literacy skills.




We Expect You:




Enjoy data visualization and finding the best ways to present data for business decision-making.
Have experience with Tableau, understand the tool's strengths and limitations, or have worked with other BI systems and are willing to master Tableau quickly.
Be proficient in SQL and capable of preparing data sources for dashboards.
Know when to use Python instead of SQL and have basic knowledge of the language.
Be able to communicate with stakeholders and gather task requirements.
Have the ability to double-check your work before publishing in a production environment.




It's a Plus If You:




Are passionate about data visualization or interface design, and enjoy books by Tufte, Few, or Norman.
Have a portfolio on Tableau Public
Have extensive experience with Oracle Analytical Warehouse or dbt.
Can work without detailed specifications or know how to collect them for dashboards used by a large number of users without a single client.
Have knowledge of RPA automation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BI expert

Als BI expert help je bedrijven voor te bereiden op een data gedreven toekomst. Dit klinkt vast herkenbaar. Hieronder wat je gaat doen:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datamodellen, dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van bedrijfsdata om waardevolle inzichten te genereren.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om hun informatiebehoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar data-oplossingen.
Waarborgen van de integriteit, kwaliteit en veiligheid van data.
Optimaliseren van bestaande data-analyse processen en het implementeren van best practices.




Je hebt bij voorkeur meer dan 4 jaar ervaring als BI expert of data analist en weet daarom zelf wel welke tools en technieken belangrijk zijn om te beheersen. Wat wij belangrijker vinden, ben jij als persoon. Wij zoeken iemand die een fijne toevoeging is aan ons team. Dat betekent dat je op ten minste √©√©n van de onderstaande vragen ‚ÄòJA‚Äô kunt antwoorden.

Schud jij zo een grap uit je mouw?
Of lach jij snel om andermans flauwe grappen?
Houd je van intensief sporten of misschien nog beter; het drankje achteraf?
Vind jij eerlijkheid en transparantie belangrijk?
Zoek je betrokkenheid, maar wil je niet aan het lijntje gehouden worden?




Wat we je bieden

75% van jouw omzet (7 ‚Äì 11k per maand)
Een basissalaris van ‚Ç¨2750 per maand
Een vast contract na een twee maanden proeftijd
Vakantie wanneer jij wilt, een NS-Business Card en een persoonlijke pensioenregeling.
Een team waarin iedereen een data-expert is
Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng
Elke maand een leuke activiteit
Gelijkwaardigheid, vertrouwen en waardering

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.

You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.




what you will be doing

Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.




who will you work with

As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.

In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.




what you will bring

Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.

You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.

Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.




what‚Äôs in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team

Title: Data Analyst - INTERNSHIP
Description:
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We‚Äôre not just engineers. We‚Äôre a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet‚Äôs toughest issues. Climate change, the energy transition, digital transformation and how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com.

About Worley

Worley has made a firm commitment to support the energy transition, and central to this is ensuring Project Delivery adheres to cost, schedule and quality and meets appropriate legislation and standards. We are rapidly expanding our capabilities within the low carbon and Energy Transition sectors and our Project Delivery team will bring experience and track record from a range of industry sectors to ensure similar standards are maintained as we assist our clients, partners, and projects in transitioning to a more sustainable world.

Our commitment to People, Planet and Sustainability is demonstrated in Worley‚Äôs broader ambitions in the energy transition space, from early-stage concept and feasibility through to delivering full EPC and EPCM packages.

Project Controls / Data Analyst Internship

We‚Äôre looking for an ambitious and intellectually curious student to join our team on an internship to learn, grow and contribute to our goal of a better tomorrow.

This will be based within our Project Controls department.

In this position, you will be requested to analyse and compare data to come to general conclusions and establish benchmarks.

The internship will have to gather information from several sources & Worley systems, bring it together, analyse & review the data and derive benchmarks which we can use internally.

There are several project controls fields in which this needs to happen:


Estimating, both professional services and capital cost: comparison of estimates against one another and comparison of estimates against actuals
We want to gain knowledge of the level of consistency between estimates (in terms of hours and cost)
We want to understand final actuals against estimates to improve future estimates
Scheduling:
Knowledge of consistency across schedules (in terms of durations)
We want to understand final actuals against baselines to improve future schedules

Important to mention is that data is not necessarily organized in a consistent way. As part of data gathering, scrutinizing data to come to comparable data sets will be very important. Therefore, having a basic understanding of engineering, estimating and scheduling and having a technical background is considered as a plus.

You will

Be working directly with project controls management team (department managers cost, estimating and scheduling and Director, project controls)

Be Involved In


Extensive data analysis
Development of benchmarks to improve quality of future estimates & schedules


Be Exposed To


Different project controls aspects, tools & systems
Detailed project knowledge in terms of cost and schedule
International working environment
Diverse & high professional teams
Opportunities to demonstrate your skill set: technical, but also communication and presentation skills


We need you to





Demonstrate excellent knowledge of excel


Demonstrate data analysis skills
Database (management) knowledge is considered a plus
Demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and pick up different tool
Demonstrate the ability to convert complex data sets into useful and easy to understand outcomes
Technical background and basic knowledge of engineering is a plus ‚Äì as this will help to understand the data the need to be analysed and reviewed.
If you feel you do not meet the full criteria, we encourage you to still apply. When reviewing applications, we look at all experiences, whether that‚Äôs in-industry (paid work experience), at university (e.g. your course, society membership, events etc) or even in personal study (any experiences you have outside of university or paid employment)


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work in an international environment with very diverse teams
The opportunity to learn about the most important metrics of projects: cost & schedule
Hybrid Working (where the role allows for this)
& Much more!


Moving forward together

We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.

We‚Äôre building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.

And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

Company

Worley

Primary Location

NLD-SH-The Hague

Job

Data Analysts

Schedule

Employment Type

Employee

Job Level

Apprenticeship

Reporting Manager Title

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.
Show more

  • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.

What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:

  • A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
  • 24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
  • A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
  • Flexible working hours
  • 15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
  • A good pension scheme and collective health insurance

How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps

  • Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
  • We invite you for a first job interview.
  • We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
  • We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
  • Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!

At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Job description

Experience with SQL and SAP Datasphere.
Pragmatic with data, able to prioritize effectively under pressure and high demand.
Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to maintain a clear overview.

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Business, HR, Data Analytics, or a related field.

A team player with strong communication skills to deliver quality insights

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent French speaker (C1 and above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

ING is looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions

Who are we?

At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is responsible for achieving the digital sales objectives and for further development of all digital interactions with customers. With over 70 data analysts and scientists, We empower a data-driven focus for ING. We work in multi-disciplinary teams, while being allocated as data consultants both internally and to other departments.

Who are we looking for?

We Are Looking For a Passionate Data Analyst To Help Improve Our Service And Product Offerings. By Understanding Customer Actions, Behaviours And Product Usage, You Will Deliver High Impact And Tangible Insights. As a Data Analyst


You are passionate about using data to create impact
You generate personal and relevant customer interactions, by doing insightful analyses
You have a broad interest in data including: Collecting, analysing, experimenting and visualizing
You seize new opportunities to make impact with data and analytics. You contribute to the maintenance and continuous improvement of the fact-based culture within ING


Are you addicted to data and ready to make impact? Do you enjoy solving problems and are you eager to develop yourself? Then we are looking for you!

Your Competencies And Experience


A master‚Äôs degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics
You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)
You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact
You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way
You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques
You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions
You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts
You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback
Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role


What do we offer you?

We offer a full-time 36-hour position in a challenging environment. You will have a chance to work at a modern Agile organization with smart and fun colleagues and great opportunities to develop both your technical and personal competencies.

The Benefits Of Working At ING Include


An excellent salary that matches your qualities and experience
A 36-hour working week
24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
A 13th month and 8% holiday allowance
Contribution Individual Savings (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
Flexible working hours and working from home (hybrid mode)
The Mobility Card. You choose your mode of transport for commuting per day. Freedom and flexibility in mobility.
A pension plan
Personal growth opportunities and challenging work with endless possibilities
An informal working environment with a diverse group of innovative colleagues

Dat kan zowel binnen onze eigen tribe zijn, als binnen een van de andere tribes binnen ING Nederland. Elk jaar bepalen we samen met jou waar jouw talent het beste kan worden ingezet. ING is looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions

Who are we?

At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is responsible for achieving the digital sales objectives and for further development of all digital interactions with customers. With over 70 data analysts and scientists, We empower a data-driven focus for ING. We work in multi-disciplinary teams, while being allocated as data consultants both internally and to other departments.

Who are we looking for?

We Are Looking For a Passionate Data Analyst To Help Improve Our Service And Product Offerings. By Understanding Customer Actions, Behaviours And Product Usage, You Will Deliver High Impact And Tangible Insights. As a Data Analyst

  • You are passionate about using data to create impact
  • You generate personal and relevant customer interactions, by doing insightful analyses
  • You have a broad interest in data including: Collecting, analysing, experimenting and visualizing
  • You seize new opportunities to make impact with data and analytics. You contribute to the maintenance and continuous improvement of the fact-based culture within ING

Are you addicted to data and ready to make impact? Do you enjoy solving problems and are you eager to develop yourself? Then we are looking for you!

Your Competencies And Experience

  • A master‚Äôs degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics
  • You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)
  • You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact
  • You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way
  • You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques
  • You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions
  • You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts
  • You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback
  • Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role

What do we offer you?

We offer a full-time 36-hour position in a challenging environment. You will have a chance to work at a modern Agile organization with smart and fun colleagues and great opportunities to develop both your technical and personal competencies.

The Benefits Of Working At ING Include

  • An excellent salary that matches your qualities and experience
  • A 36-hour working week
  • 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
  • A 13th month and 8% holiday allowance
  • Contribution Individual Savings (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
  • Flexible working hours and working from home (hybrid mode)
  • The Mobility Card. You choose your mode of transport for commuting per day. Freedom and flexibility in mobility.
  • A pension plan
  • Personal growth opportunities and challenging work with endless possibilities
  • An informal working environment with a diverse group of innovative colleagues

Are you excited? Then click on the apply button

  • Let us know why you are who we are looking for: how will you use your experience to make ING even better? We would like to receive your CV and motivation letter.

More information?

Please contact Jeroen Maassen van den Brink‚ÄØ(jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com)‚ÄØfor your questions.

Title: Data Analist | Power BI | ‚Ç¨4.000 - ‚Ç¨4.500 p.m
Description:
Combineer jouw skills op het gebied van IT, data en Power BI! Ben jij een data gedreven medewerker, thuis in Power BI en bezit jij een winnaarsmentaliteit? Dan ben jij de Data Analist die wij zoeken voor Zekerheyd!




JOUW WERKGELUK:

Waar data is daar ben jij! Analyseren, bouwen, koppelen, adviseren, controleren en optimaliseren zijn activiteiten waar jij je werkgeluk uithaalt. Het zit allemaal in deze interessante functie van Data Analist bij de dienstverlenende organisatie Zekerheyd.




Jij voelt je als een vis in het water als je met data bezig bent. Je gaat je bezighouden met data in de breedste zin van het woord. Door jouw nauwkeurigheid is de datakwaliteit hoog. Tevens help je met jouw analytisch vermogen de organisatie verder door een gedegen advies over verbeteringen. Die verbeteringen bedenk je niet alleen, je implementeert en controleert ze ook. Je bent in de lead m.b.t. procesverbetering! Met jouw enthousiasme en communicatieve vaardigheden weet jij de benodigde informatie op te halen bij collega‚Äôs en stakeholders. Je brengt jouw idee√´n over en enthousiasmeer hen over de optimalisatie in de organisatie. Daarmee lever jij een belangrijke bijdrage in de professionalisering en groei van het Zekerhey

d!Jij bent niet alleen een sterke analist maar met je communicatieve vaardigheden weet je ook hoe je de organisatie en je collega‚Äôs enthousiast maakt over de kracht van data. Jouw interesse gaat verder dan data en analyse. De onderliggende technische aspecten vind jij minstens net zo leuk en uitdagend. Mocht het voorkomen dat je wellicht iets nog niet weet, dan ben jij het type welke zich hierin vastbijt totdat je alles hebt uitgezocht en weet. Jij krijgt energie van een goede en gezonde uitdaging binnen de ICT in een mooie organisatie als bijvoorbeeld Zekerheyd!




WAT GA JE DOEN EN WAT IS JE TOEGEVOEGDE WAARDE?

Je toegevoegde waarde is analyseren en optimaliseren van de bedrijfsprocessen. Vanuit de data kan Zekerheyd voor hun klanten toegevoegde waarde bieden om geld terug te halen. Naast de onderdelen zoals hierboven genoemd hebben ze een nieuwe collega nodig die echt in de business staat. Een collega die verbanden ziet tussen instroomlijsten, ziekmeldingen en ziektewet documenten, Wia documenten en verzamelspecificaties.




In deze rol van Data Analist ga je met de door jouw geanalyseerde data moderne business oplossingen processen verbeteren en bespreken. Dat leidt tot snellere, effici√´ntere onderbouwde besluiten. Die besluiten genereren meer winst, meer creativiteit, commercieel succes en meer betrokkenheid en samenwerking met je collega‚Äôs. Verder is het belangrijk om dashboards te ontwikkelen met de daarbij behorende KPI‚Äôs. Je collega‚Äôs dienen ‚Äòrealtime‚Äô inzicht te hebben in KPI‚Äôs die voor hen van essentieel belang zijn. De data wordt omgezet in bruikbare informatie. Het doel hiervan is dat Zekerheyd met deze data optimaal inzicht krijgt in de ontwikkelingen hierdoor zijn ze instaat om beslissingen te kunnen nemen op basis van de juiste gegevens.




Taken voor deze functie:

Opstellen van plan van aanpak om data te verkrijgen over of ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsprocessen.
Bouwen en ontwikkelen van dashboards in power BI.
Verzamelen en structureren van data.
Controleren van data en opschonen van data.
Verwerken van de verkregen data en deze omzetten tot begrijpbare informatie.
Opstellen van rapportages en presentaties waaronder KPI‚Äôs voor de verschillende disciplines.
Cre√´ren van datamodellen.
Geven van advies over de verkregen informatie.
Het gebruik van feiten.
Statistieken en data als leidraad voor strategische zakelijke besluiten (die overeenstemmen met de doelstellingen en initiatieven van Zekerheyd).




Kortom je hebt een breed en afwisselend takenpakket, goede ondersteuning vanuit je collega‚Äôs, een hoge mate van zelfstandigheid en je werkt op een hoog niveau. Ook ga je stralen van het feit dat in deze functie veel uitdaging en vrijheid zit. Dit is een functie binnen een hecht en groeiend team bij een professionele organisatie.




DE ORGANISATIE

Zekerheyd biedt bedrijven een eenvoudige manier om loonkosten volledig te beheersen en onterechte premies te voorkomen.Zekerheyd snapt dat bedrijven niet alle kennis, kunde en tijd in huis hebben om alle veranderende wetten en regels toe te passen op hun werknemers. Om niet de hele administratie door te hoeven spitten en te controleren op vele variabelen, gebruikt Zekerheyd een applicatie die zowel sneller als vollediger onbenutte kansen opspoort. Zekerheyd kan op deze manier snel voor inzichtelijk maken of bedrijven nog geld terug kunnen claimen of bezwaar aan kunnen tekenen tegen onterechte beslissingen.




Deze onrechtvaardigheid waarbij bedrijven niet krijgen waar ze recht op hebben, heeft ertoe geleid dat Zekerheyd is opgericht.De missie is om geen enkel voordeel te laten liggen voor hun klanten. Door geautomatiseerde werkprocessen in combinatie met hun kennis gaan ze door waar anderen stoppen. Zo gaan ze op elke afgewezen doelgroep verklaring standaard en geautomatiseerd in bezwaar bij het UWV. Ze gaan door tot ze zeker weten dat alles geclaimd is waar een werkgever recht op heeft.




Zekerheyd zorgt ervoor dat bedrijven aan de voorkant in control komen. Dit leidt tot grote besparingen in het verdere proces en schadelastbeheersing op de Ziektewet en de WGA. Betrouwbaarheid en veilig omgaan met gegevens vindt Zekerheyd zeer belangrijk. Samen met het team van experts en medewerkers zijn ze in staat om hun klanten te adviseren en zorgen ze ervoor dat alle mogelijke premiekortingen en loonkostenvoordelen benut worden. ‚ÄúZekerheid staat voorop‚Äù.




LOCATIE:

Locatie is Eindhoven Centrum en het station is op loopafstand (max. 5 minuten).




WAT BIEDEN ZIJ JOU?

Salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4.000 en ‚Ç¨4.500 per maand.
Je gaat werken bij een snelgroeiende professionele organisatie met een open en informele bedrijfscultuur.
30 vakantiedagen.
Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een marktconform salaris, laptop, vakantiegeld en hele gezellige personeelsuitjes.
Volop ruimte voor ontwikkelmogelijkheden.
Een ambitieus team met leuke collega‚Äôs van gemiddeld 30 jaar.
Zeer afwisselend werk op een hoog niveau.







JOUW CV:

Afgeronde hbo-/wo-opleiding in een IT, information management, (bedrijfs)economie, marketing (analytics) of data richting.
Je hebt bij voorkeur minimaal 2 a 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.
Een gedreven medewerker die gek is van data en data analyse.
32- 40 uur per week beschikbaar.
In bezit van een rijbewijs B.
Woonachtig in de regio Eindhoven.




JOUW TALENT:

Je bent een teamplayer en een sparringpartner.
Je hebt een hoge ‚Äúsnapsnelheid‚Äù.Je bent resultaatgericht, en je bent gek van data.
Analytisch en strategisch inzicht.
Grote mate van zelfstandigheid en verantwoordelijkheid.
Verder ben je initiatiefrijk en denk je in oplossingen.




Enthousiast over deze functie? Solliciteer dan direct en wij nemen spoedig contact met je op!

  • 30 vakantiedagen.
  • Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een marktconform salaris, laptop, vakantiegeld en hele gezellige personeelsuitjes.
  • Volop ruimte voor ontwikkelmogelijkheden.
  • Een ambitieus team met leuke collega‚Äôs van gemiddeld 30 jaar.
  • Zeer afwisselend werk op een hoog niveau.



JOUW CV:

  • Afgeronde hbo-/wo-opleiding in een IT, information management, (bedrijfs)economie, marketing (analytics) of data richting.
  • Je hebt bij voorkeur minimaal 2 a 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.
  • Een gedreven medewerker die gek is van data en data analyse.
  • 32- 40 uur per week beschikbaar.
  • In bezit van een rijbewijs B.
  • Woonachtig in de regio Eindhoven.


JOUW TALENT:

  • Je bent een teamplayer en een sparringpartner.
  • Je hebt een hoge ‚Äúsnapsnelheid‚Äù.Je bent resultaatgericht, en je bent gek van data.
  • Analytisch en strategisch inzicht.
  • Grote mate van zelfstandigheid en verantwoordelijkheid.
  • Verder ben je initiatiefrijk en denk je in oplossingen.


Enthousiast over deze functie? Solliciteer dan direct en wij nemen spoedig contact met je op!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities
In this role you will support the development of analysis tools in the Engineering & Estimating department with various tasks


Design, develop, and test analytics software using Python.
Design, develop, and test standardized analysis templates using Jupyter Notebook & Jupyter Hub.
Deployment of new product versions in test and production environments (Kubernetes).
Work in a scrum team together with the other developers and product owner.
Help your fellow analysts with any engineering or coding related questions or challenges they may face.
Assist in the embedding of the newly developed tools by explaining them to the end users and business stakeholders.



Qualifications
Job requirements

A master (or bachelor) degree in econometrics, computer science, offshore/hydraulic engineering or other relevant fields.
Preferably 2 years of experience with data analytics and development in Python using libraries such as Pandas & Plotly.
You have experience with Docker.
You know your way around software versioning (git), test suites, technical documentation, and continuous integration and deployment.
Familiar with an agile/scrum way of working.
Good command of the English language, spoken and written (Dutch optional).



Personal skills


Ability to explain (complicated) topics in an understandable way to various stakeholders.
Ability to create an understanding of the business process and translate this to new functionalities.
Ability to pro-active collect feedback from end users and improve the tools and way of working.
Developed analytical and problem solving skills.
You are passionate about data, to learn and master new data analysis techniques and data science methodologies.
You are eager to learn about new business (e.g. offshore, dredging, renewable energy, marine infrastructure) and analyse various types of equipment.
Objective, creative, flexible and a team player.
Ability to work independently.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to empathize with the needs of your internal customer.



We offer
Working in an international, high demanding and dynamic organisation, with the possibility to truly have impact on our business, people and environment. We offer a complete package with excellent secondary employment benefits. The package includes among other things


A salary that matches your responsibilities and experience;
32 leave days of which a max. of 7 days can be appointed as collective leave days;
Pension scheme;
Variable bonus;
Extensive learning and (personal) development possibilities;
An adequate travel allowance;
Collective health insurance (optional);
Flexible working hours;
Plenty of social activities like ski trips, project visits, corporate sporting activities and company drinks.



INTERESTED?

Interested? Then apply now using the application button!‚ÄØ

Do you like to know more about and want to stay informed of other vacancies within Van Oord? Climb aboard and follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Vimeo and Facebook!

Acquisition for this vacancy is not appreciated.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‚Äòop onderbuikgevoel‚Äô maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega‚Äôs van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega‚Äôs te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en m√©t je collega‚Äôs en help elkaar n√≥g beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- √©n online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen




De nodige ervaring

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken




What else?

Je vindt het leuk om bij verschillende opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan: van NGO's tot aan marketingbureaus en van banken tot aan overheidsinstanties
Ervaring met SQL is een pr√©
Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling
Je denkt na over wat de vraag √°chter de vraag is
Je vindt een goede sfeer op je werk n√©t zo belangrijk als je vak
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‚Äòwerken bij‚Äô pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van ‚Ç¨ 2800 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨ 6500 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.

Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en je eigen werktijden indelen: kijk hier wat we je nog meer allemaal bieden.
