Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Your role as a Power BI Consultant


As a Power BI Consultant, you advise our customers on data & analytics ambitions and challenges. During the exploratory discussions with our (potential) customers, you will recognise their goals, bottlenecks, and needs. You translate them into a tangible solution using Power BI. You do much more than just creating dashboards.


In your role as a Power BI Consultant, you develop data models and analytics solutions on which our customers can make intelligent data-driven decisions. Of course, your solutions are beautiful, they work intuitively, and they provide the correct information. In addition to your technical skills, you also have an eye for the business that enables you to operate as a true advisor. You do not simply create what your customers ask for, but what they need. After all, it is your profession!


Your most important tasks as a Power BI Consultant:


  • You analyse the ambitions and challenges of our customers;
  • You develop good management information for your customers based on your analysis;
  • You develop robust data models and create effective visual appealing dashboards in Power BI;
  • You work with Microsoft Azure Technology and Power BI.


What does Rockfeather have to offer?


Rockfeather gives you the complete freedom to continue your development as a Power BI specialist or become a more all-around Data & Analytics Consultant. You want to give your experience an extra boost by using the latest technologies and not getting stuck in existing technology and with the same customers. The variety of ambitious customers and the latest technology are more the rule than the exception for us. Together we are passionate about the possibilities of data-driven working and offering the best solution for our customers. Our teams with Data Analytics, Data Integration, Data Science, and Low-code colleagues share their knowledge and network so that together we can realise impactful projects and unique solutions. We understand that the quality of your life determines the quality of your work. That is why we offer a complete package to take good care of yourself and your loved ones.

Just like every other company, we think we are unique, and we are 'the place to be.' The truth is that we are not 'the place to be' for a lot of people. If you are looking for a place to build a career in our 'management' or if you like everything clean and crisp between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., then look somewhere else.


At Rockfeather, we put craftsmanship first. We are passionate about what we do; embracing technology to empower ambitious people. If you want all the freedom and support to develop your skills to become the next ‚Äòdata guru‚Äô, then Rockfeather is the place for you. We also offer the opportunity to buy shares of the team you work in, the ultimate way to bring your entrepreneurship to the next level!


Job requirements


What do you bring to the table?


  • You preferably have a completed Bachelor's degree. But in the end, your skills and attitude make the real difference.
  • You have a minimum of one year of experience with Power BI, and preferably also DAX and SQL;
  • You have proven experience with having helped to translate needs into robust data models;
  • You have knowledge of information analysis, KPI development and Data modelling;
  • Of course, you have good communication skills and a high level of customer and quality awareness;
  • You have the flexibility to work and maintain focus in an evolving environment;
  • You like to share knowledge with others, and you're a team player and networker;
  • You are result-driven and customer-oriented because you own the process and consistently deliver top-notch quality;
  • You like to roll up your sleeves, and you have a talent for spotting new opportunities.
  • You live in the Netherlands. We need you to be local. So NL Based only!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data analist

Als Data analist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten in een divers team van collega-data analisten. Sla je de brug tussen de business, informatie en techniek. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan. Iedereen draagt bij vanuit zijn eigen vakmanschap en technologie. Zo blijf je van elkaar leren en sta je er dus nooit alleen voor.




Werken als Data analist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je voert gesprekken als materie deskundige met stakeholders als beheerders, gebruikers en architecten.
Je brengt behoeften van stakeholders in kaart en vertaalt deze naar informatie oplossingen.
Je stelt gevalideerde requirements en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang en prioriteert deze met de business.
Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en de scrumteams voor de inhoud en je bent als geen andere in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat er gerealiseerd moet worden.




Waar jij komt te werken

Binnen de area Data cre√´ren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als ook de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief.




De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hun logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.




Dit ben jij

Jij bent een enthousiaste en ondernemende professional die initiatief neemt en graag bijdraagt aan een collegiale werkomgeving. Je waardeert kennisdeling en samenwerking, en bent in staat om jouw idee√´n en inzichten te delen met collega's. Met een proactieve houding ben je gemotiveerd om samen met anderen innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen. In onze organisatie krijg je de ruimte om je ondernemerschap te tonen en bij te dragen aan een cultuur waarin teamwork en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Verder neem je mee:

Afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding
Tenminste 2 jaar ervaring met data-analyses en data-ontwerp
Affiniteit met data, datastructuren en datamapping
Kennis en ervaring met datamodelleren, relationele algebra en SQL
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega‚Äôs, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4000 en ‚Ç¨6500 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste idee√´n en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carri√®re een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Data analist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LocationUtrecht , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23549Published7 days ago

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, generating reports, and providing data-driven recommendations to support our healthcare initiatives.

Responsibilities


Analyze healthcare data to generate insights that drive clinical and business decisions.
Create reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and clinicians to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Ensure compliance with healthcare data standards and regulations.
Contribute to continuous improvement of data processes and systems.



Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech sector.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience working with healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare data standards.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Position: Data Analyst

Contract: FT

Location: Utrecht

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

LocationUtrecht , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23549Published7 days ago

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, generating reports, and providing data-driven recommendations to support our healthcare initiatives.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze healthcare data to generate insights that drive clinical and business decisions.
  • Create reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and clinicians to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
  • Ensure compliance with healthcare data standards and regulations.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of data processes and systems.


Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech sector.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Experience working with healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare data standards.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to present data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Professional proficiency in English.


Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Position: Data Analyst

Contract: FT

Location: Utrecht

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over de functie

Do you want to make impact by logical thinking from a holistic view and support data driven decision making? Are you keen on analysing facts and figures to be able to understand challenges and find solutions by translating the context. Then this might be the right next step in your career!

The Data Analyst for the Integrated Management Systems team will be is responsible for analysing and interpreting data related to Vattenfall Business Area Wind Operational QHSSE Management System and . This includes, but is not limited to, data related to quality, environment, health and safety, security and resilience and other areas of the organisation's management systems and compliance to relevant standards and regulations.

The Data Analyst for the Integrated Management System plays a critical role in supporting the organisation's efforts to maintain and improve the IMS. They provide insights and recommendations that help the organisation meet its QHSSE obligations and business objectives. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualisation.

Additionally, this person should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-oriented reports that identify risks and opportunities to drive growth.

Place in the Organisation

As our new Data Analyst you will be reporting to the IMS Operations Lead and are part of the Integrated Management System & Process Governance team within People, Culture and Standards staff functions within Business Area Wind.

Your key responsibilities will be:


Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Collecting and analysing data related to the IMS using various tools and techniques.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports to monitor IMS performance.
Identifying trends and patterns in IMS data and recommending improvements.
Collaborating with stakeholders in QHSSE to improve IMS performance and work directly with managers and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
Conducting research and analysis to support the development of new IMS initiatives and implement automations to decrease the number of steps required for an outcome.
Participating in the development and implementation of IMS policies, procedures, and training programs in relation to data handling and analytics.
Providing guidance and support to IMS stakeholders on data analysis and interpretation.
Work closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Proactively analyse data to answer key questions for stakeholders or IMS team members, focussing on what drives business performance or presents risk.
Investigate and communicate which areas of data handling and analytics need improvements in efficiency and productivity.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources.
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution.
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources.
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data handling and analytics.


Location

The team is organised internationally; the colleagues are located across all our core operating countries in the Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, UK and Sweden. Therefore it is possible to join the team in our offices in Amsterdam, Kolding, Hamburg, Berlin, London or Stockholm.

Jouw profiel

Profile

You will feel comfortable quickly in this position when you bring:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as environmental science, quality management, or data analytics.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualisation tools such as Excel including VBA, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools. Some knowledge of Power Apps and Power Automate or Azure is a benefit.
Knowledge of applicable Management System standards, such as ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001 is a benefit.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders.
Fluent in both written and spoken English.


Extra informatie

Our offer

Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.

>> Important information

We welcome your application in English including a cover letter, before September 1. Before this date we are not likely to respond since we are in the holiday season. We only review application where a cover letter is attached, because we are keen to understand your motivation for this particular role, how is supports your personal ambition and goals, why you want to work for Vattenfall and what you have to bring to our team.

Furthermore, we would like to you to wrap your mind around some day to day challenges regarding this type of work. Please respond in your cover letter with the multiple choice answers on the 3 challenges below that you will face when you will be joining our team. These cases provide you more insights on the actual job and gives us opportunity to deepdive on these topics in our first interview rounds.

Question 1

You are required to create a dashboard in Power BI that integrates data from multiple sources, including an SQL database, an Excel spreadsheet, and an online API. Which of the following steps is crucial to ensure that your data model is optimized for performance and accuracy?


A) Loading all data sources directly into Power BI as they are received
B) Establishing relationships between the different tables after importing them into Power BI.
C) Using Power Query to clean and transform the data before loading it into Power BI.
D) Creating a single flat table in Excel that combines all data before importing into Power BI.


Question 2

Data Cleaning and Processing When developing protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data, which of the following practices is most important to ensure data accuracy?


A) Implementing validation rules to catch errors during data entry
B) Automating the data entry process
C) Removing duplicates and standardizing data formats
D) Using a single data source for analysis


Question 3

You are working on a data analysis project to develop KPI insights for multiple stakeholders in the Business. You need to ensure that the final report meets the expectations of the stakeholders with varying requirements. What is the best approach to ensure that your report is both comprehensive and understandable to all parties involved and meets expectations?


A) Use complex data visualisation to present the KPIs in the most appealing way
B) Engage with stakeholders throughout the project to gather their input and feedback, and provide a mix of high-level summaries and detailed data insights in the final report.
C) Engage with Stakeholders throughout the project and develop separate reports tailored to each stakeholder's level of data needs
D) Focus on creating a detailed report that includes all possible data, focusing on speed with minimal stakeholder engagement


We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.

For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Jurriaan Rang via email: jurriaan.rang@vattenfall.com..

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Over ons

Vattenfall is one of the largest energy companies in Europe. We make electricity and heat and supply energy to millions of customers. We do this in Sweden, Germany, the United Kingdom, France, Denmark, Finland and the Netherlands.

With around 21,000 employees, we are enabling a future in which we are less dependent on the use of fossil fuels for our energy. We are at the forefront of the transition to a sustainable energy system. To achieve this ambitious goal, we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have a strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful company mission.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.






Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.

What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.

Responsibilities include:

Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are

You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need

Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer

Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Show more

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Over de vacature


Over de functie

Als medior/senior data analist ben je samen met het team verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren en oppakken van complexe dataverzoeken vanuit de organisatie. Je draagt daarnaast bij aan de verdere ontwikkeling van de data omgeving, data kwaliteit en processen. Het is belangrijk dat je zelfstartend bent en je ruime ervaring hebt met het aan elkaar knopen van datasets in sql.


Over de organisatie

Dit bedrijf is gevestigd in Den Haag. Deze organisatie heeft in totaal circa 140 IT collega‚Äôs. De IT afdeling zit midden in een transitie. Jij zal terechtkomen in het BIDS (BI & Data science) team. In dit team werken ongeveer 25 collega‚Äôs die zich focussen op Frontend of op Backend. Dit bedrijf ziet dat de informatie(technologie) een steeds grotere rol gaat spelen binnen de behandeling van pati√´nten en speelt hier doormiddel van data een grote rol in.


Wie ben jij

  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke rol;
  • Bachelor of master;
  • Ervaring met SQL en de microsoft stack;
  • Ervaring met r en of python is een mooie plus
  • Ervaring met de zorgsector is een pr√©.

(Sluit jij wellicht niet helemaal perfect aan op bovengenoemde eisen, maar spreekt de functie je wel aan? Laat het mij dan ook zeker weten. Ik kom graag met je in contact om te bespreken of je profiel wellicht toch interessant voor hun kan zijn).


Wat bieden we je

  • Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van werkervaring (tot ‚Ç¨5300 per maand) op basis van 36 uur;
  • 32 en 36 uur mogelijk;
  • Een 13e maand;
  • 166 vakantie-uren en 35 extra vakantie uren;
  • Vrijheid om jouw werkdag in te delen;
  • Een goed pensioen.


Interesse?

Kan jij je vinden in de bovenstaande beschrijving en wil je een stap maken in je carri√®re? Neem dan contact op met mij via m.bodaar@elevationpartners.nl Stuur je een recent CV mee? Dan kunnen we meteen kijken of jouw ervaring aansluit bij het opgestelde profiel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast with experience in digital marketing or payments analytics? Can you skillfully manage multiple business stakeholders to achieve their goals? Do you thrive on communicating with diverse teams and transforming their requirements into impactful data solutions?

If this sounds like you, then a role as a Data Analyst at Creative Clicks could be your next exciting career move! Join our dynamic team and make a real difference with your data-driven insights. Apply now and let's create something amazing together!




We are Creative Clicks

Creative Clicks is the world's leading data-driven marketing platform for mobile and beyond. We empower brands, publishers, and marketers to attract and engage global customers at scale through our proprietary machine learning technology. Our KPI-driven mobile marketing solutions include social and search, video, native, and display advertising, delivered at a massive scale via our robust network of 36,000 partners.

At Creative Clicks, data is the fuel that drives our campaigns, powered by insights. Our proprietary machine learning and tracking technology ensures automatic optimization of your campaigns. Additionally, our team leverages insights from audience, user, and campaign data, gathered from thousands of campaigns since our founding in 2009. Join us to experience the power of cutting-edge technology and unparalleled expertise in digital marketing.




About the team:

As a Data Analyst in the Analytics & Commercial Insights team, you will collaborate with two other data analysts, a business analyst, a data scientist, and the team lead. Our team supports various business development teams for our in-house products on all data-related matters. We work closely with the Data Engineering team, Project Managers, Product Owners, and Software Developers to uncover new data insights, analyze KPIs, and create data models that provide new optimization opportunities for the business. Our daily focus includes analyzing digital campaign performance on platforms like Google and Facebook, optimizing conversion rates, studying customer churn and lifetime value, conducting pricing and product analysis, detecting fraud, and optimizing payment flows.




Job responsibilities:

Design KPIs and measurable metrics according to the different stakeholders and product needs.
Build dashboards and reports around growth initiatives and business priorities.
Manage the relationship with key stakeholders in order to gather and guide reporting and analytical requirements.
Understand and find the best solutions for stakeholders' questions related to different business projects and divisions based on data insights (user behaviour, payment performance, fraud detection, customer churn and lifetime value, etc.).
Proactively translate the results from your analysis to actionable points that help stakeholders take the correct approach to improve their business.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams with different expertise, including Operations, Product, Payments, Marketing and Finance.
Be responsible for the long-term data quality of the solutions implemented.




Job requirements




Who are you?

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
2+ years of relevant work experience. Experience with digital payment flows, performance marketing, or mobile app funnels is a plus.
Business stakeholder-oriented.
A curious individual motivated by solving data challenges, understanding customer behavior, and exploring the complexity of digital payment data.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts to stakeholders clearly and concisely.
Capable of proposing and building innovative solutions, as well as testing and ensuring the quality of your analyses and implementations.




Required experience with:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong technical experience with relational databases and SQL.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud services.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Project management skills.
Knowledge of DAX and Power Query is a plus.




We offer:

A highly dynamic and fast ‚Äì growing working environment.
An international company with more than 25 different nationalities.
Competitive salary and fully paid commuting expenses.
Unlimited access to OpenUp (Certified Psychologists) .
25 days of annual leave (and the opportunity to buy out 10 more) with a healthy work-life balance and a hybrid work set up.
A place to learn discover and develop yourself.
Healthy daily lunch in the office.
Fun and ambitious young team of colleagues and a recently renovated beautiful office only 2 minutes from Leidseplein in in Amsterdam.







Creative Clicks is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of relevant work experience. Experience with digital payment flows, performance marketing, or mobile app funnels is a plus.
  • Business stakeholder-oriented.
  • A curious individual motivated by solving data challenges, understanding customer behavior, and exploring the complexity of digital payment data.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts to stakeholders clearly and concisely.
  • Capable of proposing and building innovative solutions, as well as testing and ensuring the quality of your analyses and implementations.


Required experience with:

  • Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
  • Strong technical experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud services.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment.
  • Project management skills.
  • Knowledge of DAX and Power Query is a plus.


We offer:

  • A highly dynamic and fast ‚Äì growing working environment.
  • An international company with more than 25 different nationalities.
  • Competitive salary and fully paid commuting expenses.
  • Unlimited access to OpenUp (Certified Psychologists) .
  • 25 days of annual leave (and the opportunity to buy out 10 more) with a healthy work-life balance and a hybrid work set up.
  • A place to learn discover and develop yourself.
  • Healthy daily lunch in the office.
  • Fun and ambitious young team of colleagues and a recently renovated beautiful office only 2 minutes from Leidseplein in in Amsterdam.



Creative Clicks is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Data Analist 


Wil jij je richten op het monitoren en analyseren van trends en ontwikkelingen? Ben je op zoek naar een positie waarin je contact hebt met stakeholders op verschillende niveaus? Ben je innovatief en heb je een passie voor data? Als Data Analist identificeer je trends, patronen en afwijkingen in data en presenteer je aanbevelingen om de besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Je cre√´ert en onderhoudt nieuwe dashboards, rapporten, visualisaties en datasets. Als ideale kandidaat heb jij een afgeronde master Business Analytics, Data Science of vergelijkbare richting, enige ervaring met data analyse en visualisatietools en kennis van Python en SQL. 


Over onze opdrachtgever


Onze opdrachtgever is een toonaangevende internationale organisatie, bekend om zijn toewijding aan kwaliteit, innovatie en duurzaamheid. Duurzaamheid staat centraal in de bedrijfsfilosofie, waarbij er voortdurend wordt gezocht naar manieren om de ecologische voetafdruk te minimaliseren, zowel in het productieproces als in de levenscyclus van de producten. Daarnaast zet het bedrijf zich actief in voor maatschappelijke projecten die gericht zijn op het promoten van gezonde en actieve levensstijlen. 


Brightminds ontwikkelprogramma


In een wereld die constant verandert moet je op verschillende manieren slim zijn. In ons tweejarig ontwikkelprogramma ontwikkel je vier niveaus van intelligentie. Wij geloven dat het vinden van balans in emoties, relaties, gezondheid en denkvermogen leidt tot groei en persoonlijk leiderschap. 


Je krijgt 2 trainingen per maand over een periode van 2 jaar. De begeleiding is intensief. Elke 2 tot 3 weken heb je een coachgesprek over je persoonlijke en professionele groei. We lopen letterlijk de eerste 2 jaar met je mee en je krijgt coaching bij alles wat je nodig hebt om goed in je vel te zitten. 


Het programma doorloop je met 8 tot 10 andere young professionals. Met elkaar bouw je een hechte band op! We vertellen je graag meer over ons unieke programma en wat de verschillende niveaus van intelligentie inhouden:  


IQ is je vermogen om kennis en cognitieve vaardigheden toe te passen. We gaan aan de slag met Excel, Power BI (binnen 3 maanden behaal je het PL 300 certificaat), Data Storytelling & Visualization, SQL en Python op professioneel niveau, Machinelearning & AI en meer! 


EQ helpt je gevoelens bij jezelf en anderen te herkennen, te begrijpen en ermee om te gaan. Je krijgt onder andere presentatietraining van de meest bekeken TED talk spreker van Nederland, je gaat aan de slag met je eigen gedragspatronen en mindset. Alles erop gericht om samenwerken te bevorderen.   


SQ geeft inzicht in wat jou als persoon drijft en hoe je handelt. Het stelt je in staat om dicht bij jezelf te blijven. Ontdekken van jouw interesse en drijfveren is de eerste stap naar zinvol werk. Daar gaan we jou bij helpen. Na deze trainingen sta jij sterker in je schoenen, ben je in staat bewust keuzes te maken en weet je hoe je impact kan maken.


FQ gaat over vitaal en in balans zijn, zodat je kan blijven presteren. Hoe zorg je nou eigenlijk voor een goede werk-priv√© balans? Hoe ga je om met stress? En aan welke signalen kan je stress herkennen? We gaan aan de slag met vitaliteit, ademwerk, mindfulness en meer. Ook krijg je training van een AI-lover die jou alle tools gaat leren toepassen in je dagelijkse werk, zodat je meer tijd over houdt voor andere zaken. 


Wat wij jou bieden 


  • Geweldige baan als Data Analist bij een internationale organisatie;
  • Na 2 jaar treed je in vaste dienst bij de opdrachtgever;
  • Startdatum uiterlijk 1 oktober 2024;
  • Bruto salaris van ‚Ç¨ 3.200, - bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur per week. Na 1 jaar maak je een stap naar ‚Ç¨ 3.500, - bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur per week;
  • Plus 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Goede pensioenregeling;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van 0,23 cent per kilometer (optie tot huurauto);
  • Telefoon- en internetvergoeding van ‚Ç¨ 40,- per maand;
  • Deelname aan ons vitaliteitsprogramma;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en 1 betaalde vrijwilligersdag per jaar;
  • Uniek ontwikkelprogramma met doorlopend trainingen en coaching;
  • Word onderdeel van een groep jonge mensen met een gelijke studie achtergrond;
  • Een-op-een coaching om jou te helpen optimaal te kunnen presteren.


Dit neem jij mee


  • Een masterdiploma in Data Science, Business Analytics of een vergelijkbare richting;
  • Kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python of R is een pr√©;
  • Ervaring met data analyse en visualisatietools is belangrijk;
  • Je durft vragen te stellen en bent communicatief sterk;
  • Je bent innovatief en hebt een passie voor data;
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.


Werken bij Brightminds betekent


Plezier en verbinding: Bij Brightminds willen we plezier maken en brengen we graag een glimlach op het gezicht van anderen. Ook op die van jou! Je wordt onderdeel van een hechte groep young professionals van wie je kan leren en ervaringen kan delen. Iedereen kan zichzelf zijn en we vieren diversiteit en gelijkwaardigheid.


Ondernemerschap en creativiteit: Wij zijn ondernemers. We gaan uit van onze eigen kracht en blijven leren. Jezelf ontwikkelen gaat met vallen en opstaan. Daar gaan wij je bij helpen! Wil je op strategisch niveau meepraten? Dat kan! Neem deel aan onze businessclub en breng je scherpe idee√´n in.


Harmonie en empathie: Brightminds hecht waarde aan een gezonde werk-priv√© balans. We hebben aandacht voor de behoeften en het welzijn van elkaar. Je krijgt de flexibiliteit die jij nodig hebt.


Training en ontwikkeling: Het is onze missie om samen de leiders van morgen te ontwikkelen. We gaan investeren in jouw toekomst en je krijgt de trainingen en persoonlijke begeleiding die jij nodig hebt.


Ben jij enthousiast over deze functie als Data Analist en weet je dat Brightminds precies biedt wat jij nodig hebt om een kickstart te geven aan jouw carri√®re? Stuur dan je CV naar huibjan@brightminds.nl of bel naar 06-27271499.

Title: Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models)
Description:
Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models)




As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Client, I am seeking for a Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models) for a position in Utrecht, Netherlands. The successful candidate will be working within the Data Domain, you will be working on projects mainly focused on Credit Modelling and will collaborate a lot with different colleagues in the Tribe Data Factory and Tribe Credit Analytics.




Top 4 responsibilities

Analysis and determination of the scope of data to be archived to Modeldata-HiSDA (Highly Secured Data Archive) of a decomissioned system.
Analysis and determination of the scope of sources from GDP to Modeldata- HiSDA. Due to GDPR retention.
Reasoning from the mandate for HiSDA and data products in these analyses.
Guiding the team on how to store data so it can be used for Credit Modelling.




Practical Examples

Source Data for Credit Risk Models
Historical Datasets of 20 years.
Analysing Databases.




Core Requirement:

You have a Master degree in a quantitative field or IT, or Finance/Economics.
You have at least 5 year relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector.
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills and you have gained experience in working with large volumes of data in complex -data structures (un-transparent, low quality). MS SQL code is a must have, some Python is helpful too.
Banking knowledge is preferred, especially of credit risk, financial markets and corporate banking products and processes, and how this is translated into data flows.
Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written




Contract: 12+ month

Rates: Excellent

Location: Utrecht

Interview: 2 stages




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre passionate about data, aren‚Äôt you? Here‚Äôs your chance to leverage your passion for data and innovative strategies and campaigns! Lead our growth and make your mark in the world of fintech. Ready to take your Data skills to new heights?




What will you do?

As a Data Analyst with BridgeFund, you play a crucial role in expanding marketing data and transforming insights into targeted strategies. You will analyze customer data and market trends to measure and improve campaign effectiveness. By conducting customer segmentation and profiling, you create detailed profiles for targeted marketing strategies. You optimize marketing processes by advising on and implementing process automation. You will work in the data team alongside Data Engineers and Data Scientists, who ensure the data foundation and support other teams with their data-related issues. Your work, along with your colleagues‚Äô, ensures that we operate in an increasingly data-driven manner as an organization.




What you will do:

Your analyses of marketing data and proposals for optimizations and automations will result in improved campaign conversions.
You identify and define different customer segments based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant factors to gain better insights into customer behavior.
You contribute to creating a culture within the marketing team where data-driven decision-making is central.
Identify and combine customer segments for targeted marketing approaches.
Create clear reports and visualizations to communicate insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Assist the marketing team in conducting A/B testing.




What we offer:

A fun, challenging position at an ambitious FinTech scale-up in a fast-growing environment. No day is the same. You‚Äôll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, allowing you to develop quickly and make a real impact on the organization.

A good salary between ‚Ç¨3.900 and ‚Ç¨5.000 based on a 40-hour workweek.
26 vacation days; plenty of time to recharge.
Your pension is well arranged with ASR, +4% on your gross salary.
You receive ‚Ç¨0.21 per kilometer for travel expenses, even if you come by bike.
Uber(Eats), ClassPass, or Felyx credit? Customize your secondary benefits with ‚Ç¨40 YourCampus credit per month.
We consider your development super important. That‚Äôs why we offer individual training as well as team training.
A super funky office in Amsterdam, near Amstel station. No cubicles or drop ceilings here.
Parties and boat trips. Friends coming along? Great!
We throw the coolest parties and drinks every quarter. We celebrate our successes together.
Skiing trips or partying in Berlin. You won‚Äôt want to miss our fully paid trips abroad.
A catered lunch every day.
A good fixed workspace. You‚Äôll get a MacBook and two monitors from us. We also have standing desks if you prefer.
A place where you feel at home and everyone can be themselves.




Our Culture:

What makes us unique is our culture. This is also one of the main reasons why we are growing so rapidly. We share the same mindset. We are a close-knit team of driven, ambitious people who want to disrupt the financial world. We are true entrepreneurs. You can feel it in our workplace. We work hard, but we also celebrate our successes in a big way together. Hierarchy is a difficult word for us, and we only do top-down when we go skiing together. We ask critical questions, give honest feedback, and are not afraid to fail occasionally, because failure means learning, and learning means growth.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Freelance Power BI Consultant




Location: Utrecht/Remote

Type: Freelance/Contract

Daily Rate: DOE




Position Overview:

We are seeking a Freelance Power BI Developer based in Utrecht, Netherlands, to create impactful data visualizations and dashboards.
This role is ideal for someone with strong expertise in Power BI, capable of turning complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Additional skills in data modelling, SQL, or cloud platforms like Azure are highly valued but not mandatory.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop custom Power BI reports and interactive dashboards.
Work closely with clients to understand their data needs and translate them into effective visual solutions.
Optimize Power BI models for performance and usability.
Integrate Power BI with various data sources, including databases and cloud services.




Bonus Skills:

Experience with SQL and data modelling.
Familiarity with ETL processes.
Knowledge of cloud platforms like Azure.




If interested please send your most recent CV to Rami.James@source-technology.com

Title: Senior Data Analist
Description:
Bij Olympia zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data Analist die een sleutelrol gaat spelen in het beheren en uitvoeren van datagedreven projecten binnen onze organisatie. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het toepassen van geavanceerde statistische analyses en het ontwikkelen van machine learning-modellen. Het cre√´ren van inzichtelijke data visualisaties om vraagstukken binnen de organisatie op te lossen valt ook in jouw takenpakket.




Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Projectmanagement. Je co√∂rdineert en beheert (kleinere) dataprojecten, bewaakt de voortgang en rapporteert dit aan de stakeholders.
Statistische Analyse. Je voert complexe statistische analyses uit om trends, patronen en inzichten te genereren die bijdragen aan strategische besluitvorming.
Data Visualisatie. Je ontwikkelt interactieve dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Tableau om data-inzichten effectief te communiceren.
Data Governance en strategie. Je ondersteunt en draagt bij aan het opstellen en handhaven van data governance-principes en data strategie√´n.
Coderen. Je schrijft en optimaliseert SQL-query‚Äôs en Python-scripts voor data-extractie, analyse en automatisering van processen.




Waar ga je werken?

Als je bij Olympia komt werken ga je een avontuur aan. Je sluit je aan bij een professionele uitzendorganisatie waar bij twee zaken centraal staan: ondernemerschap en impact. Je gaat werken in een gedreven, gemotiveerd en hecht team. Er is veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng.




Jouw standplaats is het Olympia Service Center (hoofdkantoor) van Olympia in Hoofddorp. Wij werken activity based en passen onze werkplek aan op onze activiteiten. Het spreekt voor zich dat (deels) vanuit huis werken tot de mogelijkheden behoort. In principe werken wij twee dagen per week op kantoor.




In de rol van Senior Data Analist maak je deel uit van de afdeling Data bestaande uit vier collega‚Äôs. Je rapporteert aan Coen Seinen (Manager Data & Insights) en die rapporteert aan Gabriella Serreli (CDO).




Wie ben je?

Om succesvol te zijn in je rol als Senior Data Analist ben je positief en ondernemend ingesteld en beschik je over strategisch en analytisch inzicht.

Je hebt een HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau, in de studierichting Data Science, Informatica, Statistiek, Wiskunde, of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
Je hebt minimaal 3-5 jaar werkervaring in data-analyse, statistische modellering en projectmanagement.
Ervaring in een consultancy-omgeving is een sterke pr√©.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met SQL, Python en statistische analyse en data visualisatie tools, zoals Tableau.
Je hebt ervaring met het bouwen en valideren van machine learning-modellen in een productomgeving.
Je hebt ervaring met het beheren van dataprojecten.




Wat mag je verwachten?

Een avontuur bij een top speler onder de Nederlandse uitzendbureaus! Bij Olympia werken we vanuit gedeelde kernwaarden met als ideaal een samenleving waarin iedereen zich optimaal ontwikkelt door werk dat voldoening geeft. Onze ambitie is een high performance en een digital first organisatie te worden. We kunnen je hierdoor een inhoudelijk uitdagende rol bieden. Werken voor Olympia, dat betekent dit voor jou:




Voel je gewaardeerd in een omgeving waar iedereen welkom is
Maak, samen met ons, werk van je persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling
Haal energie uit onze unieke ‚Äòwij-maken-het-waar‚Äô cultuur
Haal persoonlijke en maatschappelijke betekenis uit werk




En verder bieden we je uiteraard:




Een dienstverband van 32, 36 of 40 uur per week. Jij bepaalt wat het beste bij je past.
Een passend salaris tussen ‚Ç¨ 4.000 en ‚Ç¨ 6.659, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Bovengemiddeld veel vakantiedagen, 32,5 verlofdagen bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Onkostenvergoeding van ‚Ç¨105,- netto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Een mooie bonus aan het einde van het jaar.
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een gunstige pensioenregeling en korting op verzekeringen.
Volledige reiskostenvergoeding op basis van al het openbaar vervoer of een kilometervergoeding vanaf 10 km (‚Ç¨ 23 ct.).
Een laptop en smartphone om je werk goed te kunnen uitvoeren.
8% vakantietoeslag.
Bij Olympia geven we onze collega‚Äôs de mogelijkheid om drie offici√´le feestdagen per jaar om te ruilen voor een andere culturele of religieuze dag die voor hen belangrijk is.
Het hybride werken met de juiste balans van werken op kantoor en vanuit huis.
Een inspirerende, moderne en bovenal duurzame werkplek. Wij zijn gevestigd in het Pharos-gebouw tegenover station Hoofddorp.
Opleidingsmogelijkheden die passen bij jouw ontwikkeldoelen.
Eens per jaar een ‚ÄúDag van betekenis‚Äù. Een vrije dag die je volledig zelf invult om iets te doen wat veel voor je betekent.




Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Wil je meer weten over Olympia? Of meer over de functie als Senior Data Analist? Onze Recruitment Business Partner Merve Kaplan is bereikbaar op 06 51 05 70 91 of via m.kaplan@olympia.nl. Ken jij iemand anders waarvoor dit d√© droombaan zou kunnen zijn? Stuur deze vacature dan vooral door en geef zo betekenis aan werk.

Show more

  • Je hebt minimaal 3-5 jaar werkervaring in data-analyse, statistische modellering en projectmanagement.
  • Ervaring in een consultancy-omgeving is een sterke pr√©.
  • Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met SQL, Python en statistische analyse en data visualisatie tools, zoals Tableau.
  • Je hebt ervaring met het bouwen en valideren van machine learning-modellen in een productomgeving.
  • Je hebt ervaring met het beheren van dataprojecten.


Wat mag je verwachten?

Een avontuur bij een top speler onder de Nederlandse uitzendbureaus! Bij Olympia werken we vanuit gedeelde kernwaarden met als ideaal een samenleving waarin iedereen zich optimaal ontwikkelt door werk dat voldoening geeft. Onze ambitie is een high performance en een digital first organisatie te worden. We kunnen je hierdoor een inhoudelijk uitdagende rol bieden. Werken voor Olympia, dat betekent dit voor jou:


  • Voel je gewaardeerd in een omgeving waar iedereen welkom is
  • Maak, samen met ons, werk van je persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling
  • Haal energie uit onze unieke ‚Äòwij-maken-het-waar‚Äô cultuur
  • Haal persoonlijke en maatschappelijke betekenis uit werk


En verder bieden we je uiteraard:


  • Een dienstverband van 32, 36 of 40 uur per week. Jij bepaalt wat het beste bij je past.
  • Een passend salaris tussen ‚Ç¨ 4.000 en ‚Ç¨ 6.659, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
  • Bovengemiddeld veel vakantiedagen, 32,5 verlofdagen bij een 40-urige werkweek.
  • Onkostenvergoeding van ‚Ç¨105,- netto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek.
  • Een mooie bonus aan het einde van het jaar.
  • Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een gunstige pensioenregeling en korting op verzekeringen.
  • Volledige reiskostenvergoeding op basis van al het openbaar vervoer of een kilometervergoeding vanaf 10 km (‚Ç¨ 23 ct.).
  • Een laptop en smartphone om je werk goed te kunnen uitvoeren.
  • 8% vakantietoeslag.
  • Bij Olympia geven we onze collega‚Äôs de mogelijkheid om drie offici√´le feestdagen per jaar om te ruilen voor een andere culturele of religieuze dag die voor hen belangrijk is.
  • Het hybride werken met de juiste balans van werken op kantoor en vanuit huis.
  • Een inspirerende, moderne en bovenal duurzame werkplek. Wij zijn gevestigd in het Pharos-gebouw tegenover station Hoofddorp.
  • Opleidingsmogelijkheden die passen bij jouw ontwikkeldoelen.
  • Eens per jaar een ‚ÄúDag van betekenis‚Äù. Een vrije dag die je volledig zelf invult om iets te doen wat veel voor je betekent.


Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Wil je meer weten over Olympia? Of meer over de functie als Senior Data Analist? Onze Recruitment Business Partner Merve Kaplan is bereikbaar op 06 51 05 70 91 of via m.kaplan@olympia.nl. Ken jij iemand anders waarvoor dit d√© droombaan zou kunnen zijn? Stuur deze vacature dan vooral door en geef zo betekenis aan werk.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you'll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You're a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You'll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who you are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you'll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We're passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

What's in it for you?

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Location: Oldenzaal

What you can expect At ROSEN Europe we are looking for a fulltime Data Analyst to strengthen our evaluation team in Oldenzaal. We offer thorough in-house training, so that you learn the skills required for the position of technical data analyst within the ROSEN group.

The team of Data Analysts prepare inspection reports describing the condition of the pipeline in detail. As a member of the evaluation team, you are part of the ambitious and growing organization that offers state-of-the-art technologies to customers worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • In line inspection data assessment;
  • Integration and confirmation of supplementary data;
  • Data Analysis;
  • Feature categorization and evaluation;
  • Feature sizing;
  • Application of anomaly interaction rules;
  • Standard & non-standard analysis;
  • Organize and report In-line inspection tool results as per client requirements;
  • Maintain personal skills/certifications, and complete additional training as required.

What you will bring

  • Secondary vocational education (MBO) diploma in a technical discipline with an analytical background;
  • Previous Inspection Data Analysis experience is an asset;
  • Advanced English communication skills (written and verbal) are required ‚Äì ability to receive and communicate technical information accurately and timely;
  • Living within driving distance of Oldenzaal (max. 1 hour);
  • Available for 40 hours per week;
  • Strong computer and software skills;
  • Strong attention to detail, ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time;
  • Ability to pass the required vision and color blindness tests.

Providing a Certificate of Good Conduct (VOG) is a condition for employment. ROSEN Europe will bear the costs associated with the application for the certificate.

What we offer

  • Working in an international, dynamic and service-oriented team where collegiality is an important value;
  • An open culture that promotes and inspires a highly committed team to deliver world-class products and services to our customers;
  • Flexible working hours that help to combine work and private life;
  • Excellent secondary employment conditions such as health and pension schemes and a cycling plan to support a healthy lifestyle;
  • Opportunities for development and growth within the ROSEN group.

Are you interested in working in an environment where collaboration is valued and innovation is recognized? Then apply online or quickly send your motivation and CV to recruitment-oldenzaal@rosen-group.com.

Who we are The ROSEN Group is a leading global provider of cutting-edge solutions in all areas of the integrity process chain. Since its beginnings as a one-man business in 1981, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a technology group that operates in more than 110 countries with over 4,000 highly qualified employees.

ROSEN‚Äôs products and services:

  • Inspection of critical industrial assets to ensure reliable operations of the highest standards and effectiveness
  • Customized engineering consultancy providing efficient asset integrity management
  • Production and supply of customized novel products and systems
  • Market-driven, topical state-of-the-art research and development providing ‚Äúadded-value‚Äù products and services

For more information about the ROSEN Group, go to www.rosen-group.com.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?




Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling √©n een goede werk-priv√©balans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.




Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).




De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financi√´le instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past




Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.




Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

‚Ä¢ Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

‚Ä¢ Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

‚Ä¢ Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

‚Ä¢ Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

‚Ä¢ Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

‚Ä¢ Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega‚Äôs.

‚Ä¢ Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.




Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).




Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‚ÄòThuis van‚Äô-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega‚Äôs, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het cre√´ren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.




Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt ‚Äúdata crunchen‚Äù ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least‚Ä¶ Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en priv√© erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een uitstekend salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4.500 en ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand, bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component.
35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar.
Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling.
Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
Een MacBook Air.
Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding.
Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega‚Äôs!
Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies.
Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‚Äò‚Äôthe sky is the limit‚Äô‚Äô.
Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega‚Äôs.
Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.




Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carri√®re met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega‚Äôs praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Zwaagdijk, Noord Holland




We are a specialist¬†in temporary assignments. Our clients are wellknown banks, government, energy, construction, FMCG and other companies.




For our client Action in Zwaagdijk (NL)¬†we are looking for a¬†Data Analyst

____________________________________________________________________________________________________







¬†

Assignment :¬†Data Analyst




Location:¬†Zwaagdijk

Startdate:¬†02-09-2024

Enddate:¬†31-12-2024¬†with extension possiblity

Working hours a week :¬†38 ‚Äì Hybrid -




Deadline to apply : 26-08-2024 at 08.00 cet

(¬†We review incoming resumes daily and will immediately forward them to the client if there is a match)




ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE CURRENTLY LIVING IN THE NETHERLANDS, HAVE A VALID WORKING PERMIT FOR THE EU AND DO NOT NEED A SPONSORSHIP

____________________________________________________________________________________________________




Our Client

Action is a fast growing retailer in Europe with its IHQ in Zwaagdijk Netherlands. Countries where you can find the stores are Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France, Spain, Italy, Germany, Austria, Poland,¬†Slovakia, Czech Republic and Portugal.




Job description

These are your daily Actions

As an expert in Excel Power Query, SuccessFactors, and HR Systems, you offer valuable insights by combining multiple data sources. Reporting to the Team Lead of HR Reporting and Analytics, you handle assignments from the business and initiate projects based on your functional HR knowledge. You play a key role in managing HR data requests, utilizing your analytical skills to anticipate problems and discuss solutions with your team. You collaborate with line managers across all our operating countries and are responsible for maintaining the HR master dataset in all HR applications. Your responsibilities include defining data and reporting standards, developing reports, and resolving data issues.




Additionally:

You provide structural analyses and reports on HR management information, personnel data, and trend analyses.
You identify areas for improvement in HR reporting from the HR Project Processes and Systems department and the HR organization, and ensure their implementation.
You support management with valuable insights.







This is you:

Prerequisites:

You have a strong command of the English language.
Experience with SuccessFactors HCM and SAP Systems.
Experience with Excel Power Query.
Ability to commute to the office in Zwaagdijk-Oost at least twice a week




Requisites:

Over 5 years of work experience, preferably in an international environment.
Experience with HR systems and cloud solutions such as SuccessFactors and SAP Analytics Cloud.
Experience with SQL and SAP Datasphere.
Pragmatic with data, able to prioritize effectively under pressure and high demand.
Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to maintain a clear overview.
A critical eye for data manipulation, offering both solicited and unsolicited advice on optimizing and automating reports.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Business, HR, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Experience in HR data analysis, reporting, and visualization with large datasets.
A team player with strong communication skills to deliver quality insights


Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst

Zwaagdijk, Noord Holland


We are a specialist in temporary assignments. Our clients are wellknown banks, government, energy, construction, FMCG and other companies.


For our client Action in Zwaagdijk (NL) we are looking for a Data Analyst

____________________________________________________________________________________________________



 

Assignment : Data Analyst


Location: Zwaagdijk

Startdate: 02-09-2024

Enddate: 31-12-2024 with extension possiblity

Working hours a week : 38 ‚Äì Hybrid -


Deadline to apply : 26-08-2024 at 08.00 cet

( We review incoming resumes daily and will immediately forward them to the client if there is a match)


ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE CURRENTLY LIVING IN THE NETHERLANDS, HAVE A VALID WORKING PERMIT FOR THE EU AND DO NOT NEED A SPONSORSHIP

____________________________________________________________________________________________________


Our Client

Action is a fast growing retailer in Europe with its IHQ in Zwaagdijk Netherlands. Countries where you can find the stores are Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France, Spain, Italy, Germany, Austria, Poland, Slovakia, Czech Republic and Portugal.


Job description

These are your daily Actions

As an expert in Excel Power Query, SuccessFactors, and HR Systems, you offer valuable insights by combining multiple data sources. Reporting to the Team Lead of HR Reporting and Analytics, you handle assignments from the business and initiate projects based on your functional HR knowledge. You play a key role in managing HR data requests, utilizing your analytical skills to anticipate problems and discuss solutions with your team. You collaborate with line managers across all our operating countries and are responsible for maintaining the HR master dataset in all HR applications. Your responsibilities include defining data and reporting standards, developing reports, and resolving data issues.


Additionally:

  • You provide structural analyses and reports on HR management information, personnel data, and trend analyses.
  • You identify areas for improvement in HR reporting from the HR Project Processes and Systems department and the HR organization, and ensure their implementation.
  • You support management with valuable insights.



This is you:

Prerequisites:

  1. You have a strong command of the English language.
  2. Experience with SuccessFactors HCM and SAP Systems.
  3. Experience with Excel Power Query.
  4. Ability to commute to the office in Zwaagdijk-Oost at least twice a week


Requisites:

  • Over 5 years of work experience, preferably in an international environment.
  • Experience with HR systems and cloud solutions such as SuccessFactors and SAP Analytics Cloud.
  • Experience with SQL and SAP Datasphere.
  • Pragmatic with data, able to prioritize effectively under pressure and high demand.
  • Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to maintain a clear overview.
  • A critical eye for data manipulation, offering both solicited and unsolicited advice on optimizing and automating reports.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Business, HR, Data Analytics, or a related field.
  • Experience in HR data analysis, reporting, and visualization with large datasets.
  • A team player with strong communication skills to deliver quality insights

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you are part of the Data & BI team and will be responsible for transforming complex data into actionable insights by designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports. You make connections between data that is already present within different departments of our company (sales, HR, IT, installations). The main focus in this role will be to rebuild existing reports and consolidate them towards a single model. This will empower our organization to make informed decisions based on data-driven insights.

Your job


Reviewing report catalogs and data sources
Define a single model together with our Data Engineer
Rebuilding existing reports towards a single model
Identify process improvements, propose system modifications.
Audit data quality and define improvement plans.



We Offer

At Eneco eMobility, you come first. You are the driving force. We invest heavily in your personal and professional development ‚Äì because when you shine, we shine. Therefore, we offer our employees attractive conditions so you can stay energized while you keep your eyes on creating a better future.


Salary between ‚Ç¨3,882 - ‚Ç¨5,446 per month based on 40 hours.
An annual 5% development and vitality budget, including a sports allowance.
Access to Good Habitz development portal.
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days at home, 2 days in the office, and 1 day of your choice.
Home working allowance of ‚Ç¨32.50 per month.
OV free travel subscription (24/7 throughout the Netherlands). With your OV free card, you can also travel privately.
27 days of leave + option to purchase 5 extra days per year.
Working in the heart of Rotterdam, 3 minute walk from Rotterdam Central train station
Focus on adventure, balance, and fun.



Job requirements

Working at Eneco eMobility means working in an organization that seizes opportunities ‚Äì even if they are not readily available. What is certain now may be different tomorrow. You are given the space to experiment. That's why you clearly love adventure and like to put your hands on to the wheel to 'get the job done'. And although you can work independently, you also know that real impact is made together. In short:


3+ years of experience as BI Consultant / Data Analyst, or similar roles.
Experience with Power BI (or other reporting tooling)
Experience in rebuilding reports into a single model
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge of data governance principles, policies, and practice.
Experience with data visualization and UX
Bonus skill: Experience with data science (incl. programming)



Please apply with your resume and motivation letter explaining your experience, aligned with our requirements.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent French speaker (C1 and above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.
