Title: Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream
Description:
Company Description

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Retail Unit at Sales is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences ‚Äì securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the newly formed Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. The Product Data Analyst works closely together with the product teams, structured as Value Streams, within the Retail Tech department. The role includes supporting the Value Stream in setting KPIs and creating business cases for the products in that product area, as well as conducting data analysis, A/B testing and creating the BI reports needed to evaluate the product performance and guide the Value Stream‚Äôs work forward.

As a Product Data Analyst working towards the Decide & Go Value Stream, you will be a key enabler to explore and support data driven product development for the checkout products in store: physical and self-checkout, as well as mobile checkout solutions. You will build BI dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, perform A/B tests, provide analysis and insights to support your colleagues with data and insight-driven decision making on strategic directions.

In the role you will:


Be a crucial person for your colleagues to understand how our product development impacts the business
Proactively support product development with analytical insights and recommendations which helps to drive innovations and achieve strategic advantage
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract impactful insights that will inform and guide development efforts within the Value Stream as well as supporting in creating and following up on business cases related to the products within he Value Stream
Support the product teams within the Value Stream with setting KPIs and following up on performance through reporting and A/B testing
Translate business requirements into analytical requirements and design analytics and reporting solutions together with global business stakeholders as well as regions to maximize their impact
Interact and influence the analytical community within H&M to explore and enable new data areas to realize even more business potential



Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player. Your positive drive and curiosity sees the potential and opportunities in our way of working and wants to understand, test, scale and learn. By having a business and customer-oriented mindset with the motivation to constantly improve, achieve targets and drive agenda forward you are key player in the team. You like taking responsibility, prioritize and enjoy working in a changing environment

Additionally, we see that:


You have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least three years of experience working as Data Analyst, Product Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar roles
You are experienced in using programming languages like R or Python for data analysis
You have deep knowledge in how to use tools such as Power BI and SQL and are confident in working with large data sets and extracting data by writing complex queries.
You have experience in A/B testing
You are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
You are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues



Additional Information

This is a permanent role, based in Stockholm and reporting to Tobias Klingberg, Head of Retail BI & Analytics. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Title: BI/Data Analyst - Streaming
Description:
emagine is looking for an experienced BI/Data analyst to our client in streaming.

As member of the Data team, you‚Äôll be instrumental in providing valuable insights to stakeholders throughout the organization.

Start: ASAP

Duration: 4-6 months initially

Location: Hybrid setup from the Stockholm office

Technology stack: (GCP, BigQuery, Dataform, Dataflow, Airflow, Terraform, Python, Matillion, Thoughtspot)

Background: It would be great with either engineering or development background if possible

What You Will Do


Explore data using SQL or python to uncover insights and opportunities, in particular understanding the customer journey and identifying opportunities for growth/improvement.
Own the end-to-end process of developing trusted reports and data products: from business requirements gathering, to dashboard development, to the delivery of actionable insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with the data engineers to provide requirements for product & customer data creation and model development.
Fluent in SQL within analytical data warehouses (we use GCP BigQuery) and in business intelligence tools.


Bonus points:


Experience with the modern data stack and ecosystems.
Experience working with tracking events.
Experience working with CRM and finance data.
Experience with data modeling and data engineering procedures
Experience in A/B testing

Title: Freelancers
Description:
Why Avaus?

We are the leading marketing and sales transformation partner in the Nordics! We have several years of experience in data-driven marketing and sales across B2C & B2B industries.

Our vision is to become the leading actionable marketing data-asset provider in Europe. We believe that to survive, companies will have to invest in capabilities related to intelligence & AI, customer experience orchestration and change management. Our mission is to foster customer-centric organisations equipped to grow and face the future, our future growth will be heavily driven by applying smart data and analytics for our clients.

Who Are You?

Are you a techy freelancer with a passion for data, automation, and AI? We‚Äôre looking for talented individuals like you to join forces with Avaus! As a consulting firm dedicated to delivering tangible results in marketing and sales, we frequently need specialized skills to meet our growing demand.

Right now, we‚Äôre on the lookout for:


Data Engineers
Data Architects
Salesforce Developers
Adobe Developers
Frontend Developers


What We‚Äôre Looking For:

You‚Äôre someone who‚Äôs excited about using technology and data to drive business results. You understand the importance of continuous delivery and know what it takes to achieve it. You‚Äôre a team player who builds valuable relationships and takes ownership of your work.

Tell us about your expertise! Be specific about the platforms, technologies, and programming languages you excel in‚Äîthat way, we can match you with the right opportunities.

Practical Information:

As a freelancer with Avaus, you‚Äôll be an integral part of our delivery team, collaborating with other brilliant minds to achieve success for our clients. We work in a hybrid model, and we‚Äôd love to see you at our office in S√∂dermalm, Stockholm.

Interested in joining our roster? Send us your resume, and we‚Äôll be in touch! Please note that, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Title: Fraud & Data Analyst to The Fraud Strategy & Analytics Team
Description:
About Entercard

Entercard is one of Scandinavia‚Äôs leading credit market companies with over 1.7 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. We are dedicated to providing innovative and secure financial solutions, and our commitment to integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction is unwavering. At Entercard, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where every team member can grow and make a significant impact.

Job Description

The Fraud Strategy & Analytics team consists of four analysts who own the Entercard Group‚Äôs short- and long-term fraud strategy. As a Analyst, you will have a broad strategic mandate to mitigate 1st and 3rd party fraud in the credit card and consumer loan segments. Additionally, you will help set budgets and forecasts, perform continuous risk assessments, and manage strategies and rules. In this dynamic position, you will:


Contribute to the construction of short- and long-term fraud prevention strategies.
Find, analyze, and investigate patterns related to card and application fraud.
Propose solutions that mitigate the company‚Äôs fraud exposure based on your analyses.
Develop strategic rules and track their performance over time.


The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, with a particular focus on fraud detection and prevention. As a Fraud & Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our customers and business from fraudulent activities by leveraging advanced data analytics and developing effective strategies.

Profile

We Believe The Right Candidate For This Position Has


A relevant education and 5+ years of experience in fraud detection, data analysis, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages like SQL, Python or similar is required.


You should be open-minded, creative, enjoy problem-solving, and be eager to learn about fraud. To succeed in this position, you need to have an analytical mindset, be curious about new ideas, embrace change as a part of your daily work, and have strong verbal skills and the ability to present ideas effectively. Our corporate language is English, and you need to be fluent in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Swedish/Norwegian/Danish) would be beneficial but is not required.

In this recruitment, Entercard is collaborating with Blaq Executive Search AB. If this position sounds interesting and aligns with your experiences and competencies, please contact Henrik Flood at 0739-830500 or *protected email*.
Show more
HTML:
About Entercard

Entercard is one of Scandinavia‚Äôs leading credit market companies with over 1.7 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. We are dedicated to providing innovative and secure financial solutions, and our commitment to integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction is unwavering. At Entercard, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where every team member can grow and make a significant impact.

Job Description

The Fraud Strategy & Analytics team consists of four analysts who own the Entercard Group‚Äôs short- and long-term fraud strategy. As a Analyst, you will have a broad strategic mandate to mitigate 1st and 3rd party fraud in the credit card and consumer loan segments. Additionally, you will help set budgets and forecasts, perform continuous risk assessments, and manage strategies and rules. In this dynamic position, you will:

  • Contribute to the construction of short- and long-term fraud prevention strategies.
  • Find, analyze, and investigate patterns related to card and application fraud.
  • Propose solutions that mitigate the company‚Äôs fraud exposure based on your analyses.
  • Develop strategic rules and track their performance over time.

The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, with a particular focus on fraud detection and prevention. As a Fraud & Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our customers and business from fraudulent activities by leveraging advanced data analytics and developing effective strategies.

Profile

We Believe The Right Candidate For This Position Has

  • A relevant education and 5+ years of experience in fraud detection, data analysis, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages like SQL, Python or similar is required.

You should be open-minded, creative, enjoy problem-solving, and be eager to learn about fraud. To succeed in this position, you need to have an analytical mindset, be curious about new ideas, embrace change as a part of your daily work, and have strong verbal skills and the ability to present ideas effectively. Our corporate language is English, and you need to be fluent in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Swedish/Norwegian/Danish) would be beneficial but is not required.

In this recruitment, Entercard is collaborating with Blaq Executive Search AB. If this position sounds interesting and aligns with your experiences and competencies, please contact Henrik Flood at 0739-830500 or *protected email*.

Title: Web Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job description:

We are looking for a Web Analyst to work with our product teams and support the following:

Responsibilities and tasks:


Website Performance: Web analysts focus specifically on analyzing website traffic, user behavior, and performance metrics.
User Experience Optimization: They analyze user journeys and interactions on websites to optimize user experience and conversion rates.
Designing, implementing, and analyzing A/B tests.
Continuous Optimization: Web analysts are involved in a continuous optimization process, where they iterate on A/B tests to improve website performance continually. They learn from past experiments and apply insights to future tests, contributing to the overall enhancement of user experience and conversion rates.
Proactively identifies areas where data is missing or inaccurate in order to do trustworthy and understandable analysis
Work closely in the product team with designer and product manager (and other team members) to identify areas on improvements and guide in proritization and UX design decisions
Tools Mastery: Web analysts are adept at using web analytics tools like Google Analytics, DEP in H&M, Optimizely, content square,



We are looking for you who:

Start: Immediately

Location: Stockholm

Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.

Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations and the mission of the Data and Analytics craft is to turn that raw data into actionable insights.

We are now looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our flagship Angry Birds 2 game in the Stockholm studio. Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimising existing ones, structure vague problem statements in collaboration with stakeholders such as the Game lead, product managers, designers and producers.

The team is located in our studio in the centre of Stockholm and works in a hybrid mode (2-3 days per week onsite). Currently not based in Sweden? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!

You will have impact and fun at work by:


Bringing an objective perspective and recommendations to all phases of decision making, leveraging your technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information
Constantly designing and running in-game A/B test experiments, helping the team to find options leading to better game monetization performance and our audience satisfaction
Creating dashboards and reports to help the game team understand your findings
Proactively working with data exploration and looking for opportunities to improve gameplay experience
Working closely with peer Data Analysts, Product Managers and Project Leads to continuously improve how we are interpreting game metrics and making decisions
Coaching and sharing best practices between colleagues in the data craft and whole game teams


Experience and skills we are looking for:


High proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or R
Solid understanding of statistics
Experience in product analysis and experiments design including A/B testing
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Presentation and collaboration skills with proven ability to present data and provide actionable recommendations to senior stakeholders
Prior experience in mobile games or apps with large audiences will help you to hit the ground running but not a must


Please apply with your CV in English. We look forward to meeting you!





We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

What to expect when you join us

Meet the Rovians

About Rovio

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

Title: BI Consultant

Title: Analyst
Description:
Experienced Analyst With Interest In CRM And Data-driven Personalization

Insurance is all about life. And it is all about data. At If we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data, analytics, and customer experience to help understand our customers even better.

About The Role

In this role you will be working in a cross-functional agile team, increasing insights, and contributing to creating the best insurance solutions and experiences for our customers. This will be done through providing insights on customer life-events affecting customers‚Äô insurance needs, supporting with reporting and analysis regarding activities, customer base development, and customer satisfaction and more.

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. To enable your work, you will have access to flexible and robust data platforms both for analytics and visualization. And to help you in your quest for insight you will for cheered for, and supported by, 50+ data professionals in a Nordic Data and Analytics unit.

We offer

In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think that you have a general interest in analytics and customers. You have strong technology and analytics skills. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand our customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics and have a positive, sharing, and proactive mindset. We also believe that you are excellent at communicating insights to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.

Key Responsibilities Include


Creating actionable insights from large volumes of data.
Building visualizations to support business in understanding performance and identify areas of improvement.
Connecting data and insights to strategies to improve the customer journey.
Utilize relevant data to support personalized experiences to individual customers.
Proactively identifying new opportunities within data and analytics.
Supporting users in their understanding of data & analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with users.



Your Background


Excellent in data transformation and programming (e.g., SQL, Python).
Data visualization experience from BI tools such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI.
You have a good understanding of CDPs and related technologies.
Hands-on experience with a CDP is a plus.
Experience from data driven CRM teams or CRM analytics is a plus.
Relevant university degree.
Fluent in English, understanding one or more of the Nordic languages



Additional Facts

Application deadline: Last date to apply is 25th of August 2024 ‚Äì application review will start immediately so don‚Äôt wait with sending in your application. All applications will go through our recruitment system.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. You don‚Äôt need to write a cover letter, instead please answer the questions that come up when you are applying.
Work location: Sweden (G√∂teborg/Stockholm) or Finland (Espoo/Turku)
Travelling: Some travelling is required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to the country chapter lead:

For Sweden contact Kenny Karlsson at kenny.karlsson@if.se

For Finland contact Kirsi Rastas at kirsi.rastas@if.se

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it ‚Äì because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers‚Äô side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn‚Äôt matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!

Title: Finance Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Within TUI Group, TUI Airline regroups all airline activities across UK, Nordics, Belgium, The Netherlands, Germany, Spain, Morocco, France, and the Dutch Antilles. TUI Airline Finance is a function within our airline organisation responsible for supporting the newly restructured TUI Airline Board in delivering against the strategic agenda and managing our continued transformation to a functionally led business with a single-airline mind-set.

As Finance Business Intelligence Analyst, you will project manage high profile financial and strategic projects across five European Airlines with a cost base of ‚Ç¨4bn, through scoping business and technical requirements, model development, database management and BI analysis. You will develop robust financial databases and key processes to enable project development, implementation and monitoring phases; providing proportionate levels of control in a highly technical team.

The individual will support finance by liaising with Data Science to provide extraction and transformation of data through a centralised data warehouse, using a variety of software tools to provide the best experience for the end user.

About The Job

As Finance Business Intelligence Analyst, you‚Äôll be responsible for:


Working with subject matter experts across airline finance to manage analytics projects from start to finish, gathering and transforming data sources; creating bespoke financial models, which are automated where possible, and versatile to cope with extensive scenario testing
Liaise and challenge stakeholders to understand business requirements to design and build business appropriate solutions to support
Construct a detailed roadmap of all analytics and reporting requests across Airline Finance, giving priority to projects with the biggest financial and efficiency savings.
Provide regular input & challenge to the Senior Leadership Team on progress versus roadmap targets, prioritisation of projects and financial savings achieved
Deliver financial savings through understanding the commercial application of data insights to drive business decisions, prioritising projects with the biggest potential and proactively identifying new opportunities.
Create bespoke financial models and databases using data management, transformation, and automation, ensuring versatility to cope with extensive business scenarios
Maintain the airline finance data lake, ensuring appropriate controls are in place
Build, deploy, and maintain reports to support the TUI airline budget process and cost base of ‚Ç¨4bn. Ensuring these are accurate, effective, and understood by the business users and are in line with company development and design standards
Build processes that enable non-technical users to load data sources that update bespoke built models within a software platform
Building interactive, self-serve dashboards in Tableau and provide training to the business on how to use
Provide ongoing and proactive quality assurance checks
Continuously seek improvements to underlying processes and drive efficiency into the team



About You

Experience of relational databases and ETL processes


Advanced user of SQL.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
A minimum of 2 years industry experience in a Business Intelligence role
experience in data visualization (Tableau or similar)
Proven track record of using data to implement change
Javascript knowledge (desirable)
Comfortable communicating complex insights to non-technical stakeholders at all levels
Ability to prioritize and structure own workload, managing stakeholder expectations and timelines
Role requires strong business English, both spoken and written, and may involve some international travel



About Our Offer


Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of digital training opportunities and international career opportunities.
Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.



At TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to.We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click here

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role:


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Essential requirements:


Passion for Data, people, and technology
At least 4+ year‚Äôs work experience including hands-on as either:
Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
Experience in GCP tools ‚Äì Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools
Fluent in English both written and verbal


Meritorious:


Experience in data processing framework ‚Äì Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
Business understanding of retail industry

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role:


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world‚Äôs leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join Kambi‚Äôs Data Platform stream to support us in building a decentralized and self-serviced data platform, contributing to our Data Mesh journey. We believe in the high importance of data in every organization, and we are committed to empowering Kambi‚Äôs businesses through our solution.

The Role And Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer, you will help shape our data platform by connecting modern data mesh principles with the practical aspects of our current warehousing solution.

You will initially join the Data Warehouse team, however as we move forward with next delivered data products you may find yourself to work in smaller, cross-functional teams with Data Engineers and Analytics Engineers, focusing on a particular area of our unified data platform.

We believe that you have valuable experience in data modelling and transformations, which will help you understand business requirements and how they translate into data models. Experience with dbt or other modern tools will be beneficial.

As we aim to shift from Data Warehouse towards Lakehouse concept, we expect that you will be familiar with CI/CD and cloud infrastructure solutions appropriate for data platform. At Kambi we work with AWS tools, we use Airflow for orchestration, and we have recently rebuilt our Data Lake with the use of Iceberg and Trino.

Languages that we are looking for are Python and SQL for your daily work, and English for communication with your colleagues.

Is Kambi a place for you?

We highly value soft skills such as collaboration, communication, and problem-solving abilities. Our teams have a high level of autonomy in decisions around solutions and ways of working. You will thrive in this role if you are curious, enjoy technical discussions with your team and willing to collaborate to find the most suitable solution.

We offer friendly, welcoming, and inclusive working culture in an international work environment. We value learning and development, both on an individual level and as a whole organization. It is important for us that we grow together. We like to have fun with our colleagues, but we also understand that each employee needs their flexibility to thrive.

And one last thing...

We would be happy if you tick off all our boxes, yet we also believe it is just as important we tick off all of yours. And if you think you have most of what we are looking for, but not every single thing, go ahead and hit apply. We would still love to hear from you!

We want a balance between office work and working from home. We believe we will all gain from the best of both worlds, so the way of working in Kambi is hybrid ‚Äì we want to have a chance to work with you in our Stockholm office 2 days in a week.

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
‚ö°Ô∏è What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden‚Äôs industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

üåüThe Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Engineer based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

üë©‚Äçüíª About The Role

We are looking for a passionate, self-driven and dedicated Data Engineer to join our Implementation and Operations team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and systems that power our data-driven solutions. You will also work closely with our Data Scientists from the Trading Strategy and Modeling team. Your work will contribute to the development and maintenance of an important stage in our solutions, by making sure that the data travels seamlessly from end to end in our pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and efficient data pipelines
Build and optimize data ingestion and processing systems for structured and unstructured data
Work with the data science team to maintain data models and build and maintain MLOps and ETL pipelines
Implement and maintain data quality checks, validation, and monitoring
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitHub and AWS
Build and maintain data lake and storage solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop data-driven solutions
Design and implement data security and privacy controls
Create and maintain documentation of data pipelines, processes, and procedures


Qualifications


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as Docker, CI/CD, git, testing
Familiarity with cloud data services, preferably from AWS, such as Lambda
Understanding of data modeling, data storage, and database design
Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and best practices


üìç Location

We value office collaboration but support some hybrid work. Our office is at S√∂der M√§larstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

üõí Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Engineering Team, Hiring Manager and the CEO.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What We Do At Qliro

At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.

What Your Team Does

We're a data team responsible for the data platform that powers Qliro's Analytics and data producs, handling over 50 TB of data! We believe great work can be done anywhere, that's why we offer flexible remote work. Join us and leverage your data expertise to build high-impact data products that fuel business decisions and power our machine learning models serving millions of customers.

How you'll make a difference:


Wrangle massive datasets related to Payments.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for efficient data flow.
Champion data quality and ensure its accuracy for critical business decisions.
Utilize cutting-edge tools like AWS, Snowflake, GitLab, and dbt to build a robust data platform.
Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Finance, Credit and Tech teams) to translate data into data products and building the foundation for Analytics.


What You Bring To The Team


You are highly experienced in the majority of our techstack, but most importantly in SQL, Python, dbt and Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouse)
You bring value to the business by using data, preferably within financial and/or related industries
You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users
Passionate about solving complex business problems by building data products with high quality and velocity
You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team.


Our stack:

Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, AWS & Tableau

Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for - apply now!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer. The successful candidate will work on developing and maintaining our data architecture to support various initiatives, ensuring data quality, and adopting data mesh capabilities. This role is crucial to our One Data Foundation Initiative and other prioritized projects like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147, and BTI-260.




Key Responsibilities:

Development of SADP and IDPs: Create and manage scalable and efficient data pipelines and infrastructure.
Ensuring Data Quality: Implement data quality checks and processes to maintain high data standards.
Adopting Data Mesh Capabilities: Integrate and support data mesh architecture to enhance our data ecosystem.




Required Technical Skills:

Strong GCP Skills: Proficient with Google Cloud Platform services, understanding their use cases and cost implications.
Data Warehouse Concepts: Expertise in data warehousing, SQL, and related concepts.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python.
Data Build Tool (DBT): Experience with DBT for data transformation.
Infrastructure as Code: Knowledge of Terraform for infrastructure management.




Leadership/Experience Level:

Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer: We are open to evaluating both mid-level and senior candidates to find the best fit for our client.




Required Cloud Certification:

Google Cloud or other Cloud Engineering Certification: Must possess relevant cloud certifications.

Title: Digital Strategy Product Data Analyst to H&M Sales (Parental Cover) ‚Äì Digital Experience & Commercial Unit
Description:
Company Description

H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day.‚ÄØ

We believe that it‚Äôs when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That‚Äôs why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong.‚ÄØ

Be yourself & more at H&M.‚ÄØ

Job Description


The Digital Strategy Analytics Team supports the Value Streams and Commercial Teams within the Digital Unit with actionable insights and data-driven strategic options. This role will support our global digital product teams in improving our shoppers‚Äô journeys and growing their analytics prowess by steering data-driven roadmaps and commercial initiatives. The role interacts with a vast number of stakeholders (regional teams, central BI teams, commercial leaders, expansion teams, product teams) to coordinate the totality of conversations and competencies around our digital business performance.



Some of your main responsibilities & tasks will include:


Coordinate analytical projects across Digital Value Streams (for example, Pay, Receive & Return or Inspire & Discover), leading the process of hypothesis formulation - analysis - conclusion ‚Äì recommendations
With high customer centricity, empower stakeholders to improve the customer experience through expert analysis of behavioral, commercial and product performance data
Help steer product roadmaps by supporting Product Managers and Value Stream Managers to prioritize resource allocation and product / value stream backlogs
Build and take ownership of business cases owned by the value streams, bringing together commercial, digital, user behavior understanding
Help commercial stakeholders understand the performance of products and features owned by your value stream peers
Work with multiple advanced analytics tools to analyze, execute and follow up initiatives from idea to industrialization
Be the driver for data driven decision making by enabling data visibility and educating the different stakeholders
Convert different forms of data into common language in order to guide commercial and regional teams
Use SQL, Google BigQuery, Google Looker, PowerBI and other analytical tools to dive deep into the data lake
Participate in the wider analytics community, both within CX&S and the wider H&M group



Qualifications

Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a sales-minded, social, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.


3+ years of experience from product or business analysis, customer or commercial analytics, management consulting
Very strong experience with SQL
Previous experience with cloud analytics environments such as Databricks or GCP
Previous experience within ecommerce, retail, fashion or tech product driven companies
Academic degree within Business Administration, Economics, Engineering (or similar)
Experience in working with data visualization tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, etc
Demonstrated ability to synthesize large amounts of data into clear insights
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across different competences (Commercial Leads, eCommerce Managers, Product Managers, Developers, Designers, Data Engineers, etc.)
Be comfortable with working within a large matrix organization
Strong communication skills and an ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills
Fluent in English (written and spoken)



Additional Information

H&M Group is a value-driven company that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want.

The role is based in Stockholm. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English. We will review and interview applicants continuously.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an ambitious and driven Data Engineer to join our team in building our modern scalable data platform!

Two is bringing the very best of B2C e-commerce to B2B. We're passionate about building solutions that enable B2B Merchants to sell more, faster, and more efficiently. Growing 30% month-on-month, our goal is to become the world's largest B2B payment solution by 2027. We're backed by the very best VCs in the world ‚Äî raised over ‚Ç¨30m from Sequoia, Shine, Local Globe, Antler, Posten and influential angel investors in Fintech.

Two is built by a passionate and energetic team with second-time founders with successful exits. We are a small, but mighty team leading Two into new countries. We have a global mindset, but deeply understand local nuance. We are entrepreneurs at heart, problem-solving to launch new countries end to end. We are team players that execute diligently from ideation to reality. We believe in diversity in opinions and ideas and expect all employees to think like an owner.

Location

We are seeking a candidate to join one of our offices in London, Glasgow, Oslo or Stockholm. Our work model embraces a hybrid approach, offering employees the flexibility to work both onsite and from home.

About The Role

We are currently looking to expand our Data Team with an experienced and ambitious Data Engineer with a passion for building a highly scalable data platform!

You'd be joining a fast-paced Data Team whose mission is to empower business decisions by provisioning quality data information and ML Engineers by building scalable Feature Engineering platform. We have a data-driven culture and believe that data wealth and the ability to leverage it effectively is what sets us apart!

You will be working closely with stakeholders across business divisions to enable quality decisions based on clean, trusted, and enriched data.

This is a fantastic opportunity in one of the most exciting and fast-growing start-ups of the global Fintech industry with the mission to revolutionise B2B payments!

What You Will Be Doing

The role requires a proactive and independent individual, who understands the challenges of working in a startup, wants to own the problem, and is able to design data solutions with great attention to the quality of products being delivered. Your main responsibilities will be to:


Lead the design and implementation of a scalable and reliable data platform at Two
Scale our Data Analytics platform across the company in the most cost-effective way
Help establish a data culture across the business by implementing a self-serve data platform
Build pipelines to enrich internal data with data from 3rd parties by using different integration tools such as Airflow, Airbytes, etc
Be the key player in architecting and building our Feature Engineering and Feature Store platforms to be leveraged by the Data Science and Machine Learning teams
Ensure quality of data delivered to end user



Technologies We Use:


Our foundational core products run as micro-services on Kubernetes
Python and Golang for our back-end applications
PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Spark for distributed data storage and compute
Two cloud infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform
Our CI/CD pipeline consists of Github Actions, Helm and Terraform



Requirements


2-5 years of experience in working with the cloud platforms, ideally GCP or AWS
Experience in designing and building data pipelines in the cloud, working experience with data integration tools or APIs ( Airflow, dbt, Fivetran, Airbytes etc.)
Strong SQL skills and ability to tune SQL performance in RDBMS (PostgreSQL) as well as columnar store (BigQuery, Redshift)
Strong understanding of CI/CD principals
DevOps experience is a bonus
Track record of successfully achieving your set goals and meeting tight deadlines
You are ambitious, reliable, and resilient with a can-do attitude, always with a suggestion for a solution rather than just explaining a problem!



Benefits


25 days paid time off per year + public holidays üå¥
Annual allowance to spend on anything that will contribute to your mental or physical health ü§∏
Allowance towards a phone device every 24 months (from your 6th month anniversary) üì±
Annual allowance for learning and training üìö

Title: Web Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job description:

We are looking for a Web Analyst to work with our product teams and support the following:

Responsibilities and tasks:


Website Performance: Web analysts focus specifically on analyzing website traffic, user behavior, and performance metrics.
User Experience Optimization: They analyze user journeys and interactions on websites to optimize user experience and conversion rates.
Designing, implementing, and analyzing A/B tests.
Continuous Optimization: Web analysts are involved in a continuous optimization process, where they iterate on A/B tests to improve website performance continually. They learn from past experiments and apply insights to future tests, contributing to the overall enhancement of user experience and conversion rates.
Proactively identifies areas where data is missing or inaccurate in order to do trustworthy and understandable analysis
Work closely in the product team with designer and product manager (and other team members) to identify areas on improvements and guide in proritization and UX design decisions
Tools Mastery: Web analysts are adept at using web analytics tools like Google Analytics, DEP in H&M, Optimizely, content square,



We are looking for you who:

Start: Immediately

Location: Stockholm

Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer. The successful candidate will work on developing and maintaining our data architecture to support various initiatives, ensuring data quality, and adopting data mesh capabilities. This role is crucial to our One Data Foundation Initiative and other prioritized projects like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147, and BTI-260.




Key Responsibilities:

Development of SADP and IDPs: Create and manage scalable and efficient data pipelines and infrastructure.
Ensuring Data Quality: Implement data quality checks and processes to maintain high data standards.
Adopting Data Mesh Capabilities: Integrate and support data mesh architecture to enhance our data ecosystem.




Required Technical Skills:

Strong GCP Skills: Proficient with Google Cloud Platform services, understanding their use cases and cost implications.
Data Warehouse Concepts: Expertise in data warehousing, SQL, and related concepts.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python.
Data Build Tool (DBT): Experience with DBT for data transformation.
Infrastructure as Code: Knowledge of Terraform for infrastructure management.




Leadership/Experience Level:

Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer: We are open to evaluating both mid-level and senior candidates to find the best fit for our client.




Required Cloud Certification:

Google Cloud or other Cloud Engineering Certification: Must possess relevant cloud certifications.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role:


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Essential requirements:


Passion for Data, people, and technology
At least 4+ year‚Äôs work experience including hands-on as either:
Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
Experience in GCP tools ‚Äì Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools
Fluent in English both written and verbal


Meritorious:


Experience in data processing framework ‚Äì Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
Business understanding of retail industry

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job description:

3 daily tasks:

Development of SADP, IDPs. Ensuring Data Quality. Adopting to Data mesh capabilities. These are all covered in our One Data Foundation Initiative, but also working for other stack ranked initiatives like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147 and BTI-260.

Technical skills: Strong GCP skills with understanding of different Google services, when to use which service, their cost implications. Data warehouse concepts, SQL, Python, DBT and Terraform.

Leadership/experience level: Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer (will evaluate both these experience levels and choose the most suited consultant for team)

Required cloud certification: Google Cloud or other Cloud Engineering

We are looking for you who:

Start: Immediately

Location: Stockholm

Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life¬†

Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) ‚Äì tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies.¬†



Excellent communication is key ‚Äì you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." ‚Äî Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don‚Äôt lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn



Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

¬†

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page



Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!



Is this not the right position for you? Don‚Äôt worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Data Engineer with Machine Learning
Description:
My client is looking for a Data Engineer who has experience and a desire to work with Machine Learning, to join their vibrant team in their sleek Stockholm office.




The company's main focus is working alongside businesses (small, medium and enterprise) to ensure that they are maximising their business operations; this includes anything from auditing, payroll to VAT accounting, declaration or business acquisition.




They are now looking to build their impactful technology dept with somebody who can utilise new data techniques to further improve their data-driven company mind-set.




Responsibilities

Enhance MLOps environment: Continuously improve the machine learning operations (MLOps) environment to streamline model deployment and monitoring processes.
Work with Large Language Models (LLMs): Develop and optimize models using large language models to meet various project requirements.
Deploy ML models to production: Manage the end-to-end deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient in production.
Collaborate with internal teams: Partner with internal business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions.
Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.




Qualifications

Minimum of 2 years working as a Data Engineer or similar, which could include a Data Scientist who's heavier on the engineering side (very confident with Python) or Software Engineer who's built ML algorithms
2 years engineering experience with Python
Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and others
Worked with supervising models in production
Familiar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMs
It's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to production
BSc/MSc in a relevant field
Fluency in Swedish and English




In this position, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.




This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.




Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

Title: BI & Analytics Developer
Description:
Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Come join us

If you‚Äôre passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let‚Äôs talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Skills And Experiences


You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
You speak fluently Swedish and English


About You

Characteristics that can spell success for this role:


Collaborative, curious, client-centric
Resilient, adaptable, flexible
Passionate about tech


What You'll Do

As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


Learn more

Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you! Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.

Enjoy your career

Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade


People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Working in a hybrid/flexible model


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.
Show more

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Insurance is all about life. And it‚Äôs all about data. At If we are developing solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data, analytics, and customer experience to help understand our customers even better.

In this role you will be working in an agile team, increasing insights, and contributing to create the best insurance solutions and experiences for our customers. This will be done through providing insights on customer life-events affecting customers‚Äô insurance needs, supporting with reporting and analysis regarding activities, customer base development, and customer satisfaction and more.

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. To enable your work, you will have access to flexible and robust data platforms both for analytics and visualization. To help you in your quest for insight you will for cheered for, and supported by, 50+ data professionals in a Nordic Data and Analytics unit.

Who are you?

We think that you have a general interest in analytics and customers. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and monitor the business performance. You have previously worked with analytics and have a positive, sharing, and proactive mindset. We also believe that you are great at communicating insights to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.

Key Responsibilities Include


Driving and creating actionable insights from large volumes of data.
Building visualizations to support business in understanding performance and identify areas of improvement.
Connecting data and insights to strategies to improve the customer journey.
Proactively identifying new opportunities and initiatives for improvements.
Supporting users in their understanding of data & analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with users.



You also have


Extensive experience in handling big amounts of data from various sources (using e.g., sql, python).
Experience with web analytics tools, like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
Experience in data visualization with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Microsoft Power BI or Looker Studio).
Experience with tag manager systems (e.g., GTM) and data layers.
Understanding of web technology (e.g., HTML and JavaScript).
Proficiency with analytical methods.
Relevant university degree.
Fluent in English, understanding one or more of the Nordic languages.



We offer

In the same way that we place expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome.
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment.
Possibility of hybrid workplace.
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities.
Great insurance benefits.



Additional Facts

Application deadline: Last date to apply is 25th of August 2024 ‚Äì application review will start immediately so don‚Äôt wait too long. All applications will go through our recruitment system.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. You don‚Äôt need to write a cover letter, instead please answer the questions that come up when you are applying.
Work location: Sweden (Stockholm, Gothenburg) or Finland (Helsinki, Turku)
Travelling: Some travelling is required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to the country chapter lead:

Sweden: Kenny Karlsson at kenny.karlsson@if.se

Finland: Kirsi Rastas kirsi.rastas@if.fi

Union representatives:

Carina Lidgren (Forena) at carina.lidgren@if.se

Oskar Nordstr√∂m (SACO) at oskar.nordstrom@if.se

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it ‚Äì because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers‚Äô side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn‚Äôt matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!
Show more
