Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Description:
Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight‚Äôs purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




What does it mean to be a Data Engineer Consultant at Netlight?

It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems, and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.




As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.




Minimum Qualifications

Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
Verbal and written fluency in English
0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

Show more

At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.


As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.


Minimum Qualifications

  • Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
  • Verbal and written fluency in English
  • 0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams


Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Business Intelligence Consultant - Specialised in cloud based platforms




Nigel Frank are partnered with a leading BI consultancy who continuously keep an eye on the market for skilled consultants who are interested in delivering an entire data project to their customer, not just working on a small section.




They were founded by highly experienced consultants (each with 20+ years of experience) who felt as though the larger consultancies they worked with, didn't deliver what the customer actually needed; a tailored and thorough data delivery.




Their consultants work with the customer to thoroughly understand their need, consulting on what would be the best route and then build and deliver that with a team of highly-skilled consultants. They will then continue to work with these companies to ensure the platforms are being used to their highest potential and often these projects can take up to two years.




If you're somebody who's either feeling the same as their founders and want to explore a more consultative environment, or you want to step into a consulting role as you feel ready to work with interesting projects that will challenge you to progress in your career, this could be a great option for you.




What can you look forward to?

Hybrid policy with an encouraged 2-3 days in their Stockholm office
Your choice of laptop and set-up
With over 30 customers who consistently work with them they have interesting projects in various industries Logistics, Transport, Manufacturing, Automotive and Retail
Competitive remuneration package: high base salaries, collective bonus, you specify your pension level and over 30 days' vacation
Monthly catch-ups with your manager to make sure you‚Äôre happy with your work and on the right path to reach your goals
A fantastic team and culture which is friendly and supportive
Highly senior team that supports knowledge sharing and progression
Time and budget devoted to training and development
Team trips abroad and in Sweden throughout the year




Their technology stack includes Azure BI and Data stack inc. Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, etc., GCP, AWS, Power BI and some Tableau. They are now also working with customer that are encouraging more Data Science methods.




If you want to develop within the most prominent data platforms and join a team of colleagues who encourage knowledge sharing and progression, take a look at the requirements below.




What we need from you

At least 2 years of BI or data engineering experience: building data pipelines, modelling, cleansing, transformation, data warehousing, etc.
Proficiency in a cloud platform: Azure, GCP or AWS
Skilled in working with databases, both on prem and cloud: Snowflake, SQL, Postgres, etc.
A desire to learn more and keep on up-skilling ‚Äì current consultants are building their experience in advanced analytics (AI/ML) and project leadership
Strong communication demonstrated through managing and engaging stakeholders and eliciting requirements effectively
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team ‚Äì you will be working alongside your skilled colleagues while also taking the initiative
Experience with visualisation and tools such as Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.
Fluency in Swedish is required




This is an established company that has a fantastic reputation and since they prioritise having a great culture and working environment, you can expect to be surrounded by the latest tech and very best consultants; offering you a great chance to continue to grow your skill set.




As a consultant, no two days will be the same, really giving you an opportunity to propel your career forward.




If you find this opportunity interesting, apply and we can run through the details. Alternatively, if you have any questions, drop me a message on LinkedIn or give me a call: +46 77 588 86 15

Title: Senior Analytics Engineer
Description:
Job Description

About the Team

Analytics at Wolt is a business-critical competence team that covers Analytics Engineering, Data science, and Data analytics. In total, we are a team of 80+ professionals, all united by our excitement to put Wolt‚Äôs valuable data assets into everyday use.

About The Role

We're looking for awesome people to join Wolt as an Analytics Engineer role in Helsinki, Stockholm or Berlin. We have Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers working as embedded data professionals in different business domains and now we‚Äôre looking to reach the next level in data quality and advanced analytics within these .

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be the partner for the business leaders and product leaders. You‚Äôll work closely with Product Leads, Software Engineers, Finance Managers and External Consultants. You'll build and manage data pipelines, metrics and dashboards to provide insights that will support product and business development at Wolt.

We are looking for someone that enjoys working closely with stakeholders to design smart and efficient data solutions that lead to real insights. Good communication and ownership skills as well as a passion for problem-solving are critical for this role.

Team Overview

You‚Äôll be a part of the Analytics Engineering team!

The team focuses on all kinds of projects such as data modeling, design of pipelines, creating dashboards to describe the business and deriving insights from them.

If you are wondering whether you do possess the relevant skills and background, there is a hint for you üôÇ We are looking for potential and the right attitude so even if you are missing some of the mentioned skills but feeling strong in your SQL, apply and let‚Äôs have a discussion about it :)

Our humble expectations


4+ years of experience in data related roles - data engineering, business intelligence or analytics engineering.
Expertise with SQL and ETL tools (Airflow, dbt or similar)
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Ability to influence senior leadership to make critical decisions
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience
You are able to work and communicate effectively in English


Next Steps


Lots of room to build the direction of product management at Wolt, with a global impact!
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
In addition to our country-specific benefits, our compensation package includes a monthly salary based on your expertise and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie. üöÄ
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work. ü§©


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!

If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal Szafraniec

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Head of Intelligence, in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA)
Description:
Job ID:¬†25476¬†

¬†

We are looking for a head for the Intelligence Team in Stockholm or Helsinki. This is a very unique opportunity for you to fight financial crime together with us.

¬†

At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About this opportunity¬†

You will join and lead the Intelligence Team in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA). This is a new position which will lead the Intelligence Team, a new unit within FCIIA which consists of four existing sub-teams: Strategic Intelligence, Operational Intelligence, Tactical Intelligence, and Complex Analysis.

¬†

As the Intelligence Team leader, you will report into the Head of FCIIA and be responsible for managing the four sub-team leaders and directing their respective teams‚Äô output. You will work closely with other teams in FCIIA, especially our Intelligence Unit along with other areas across Nordea.¬†As the Head of Intelligence, you‚Äôll play a valuable role in ensuring that the Bank is responsive to new and emerging financial crime risks.



What you‚Äôll be doing:

Developing and managing the production of continuous intelligence coverage on financial crime threats
Coordinating and leading proactive intelligence projects grounded in our data analytics capabilities
Operational management of the output from intelligence and analytics products developed within FCIIA
Supporting intelligence requests from, and development of, Nordic anti-financial crime public-private partnerships
Nurturing the professional and personal development of intelligence analysts
Acting as a subject matter expert in AML/CTF, as well as having key domain knowledge in other financial crime risks
Building close working relationships with colleagues in FCIIA and elsewhere in Group FCP, as well as working with stakeholders in the business
Contributing to continuous improvement in investigative skills and intelligence analysis, both within the team and in the development of capabilities across FCIIA
Participating in the development and execution of the Intelligence Team and FCIIA‚Äôs strategic goals
Maintaining situational awareness of new and evolving financial crime risks and typologies
Stakeholder management will be important in this role. You must have the capability and knowledge to influence and advise senior management within Nordea, as well as providing effective support to external engagement, such as FCIIA‚Äôs involvement in public-private partnerships and GFCP‚Äôs interactions with regulators



You‚Äôll join a forward-looking team aiming to provide high-quality, proactive intelligence to help protect Nordea and our customers against financial crime. The role can be based in¬†Stockholm, Helsinki, Warszawa, ≈Å√≥d≈∫, Gdynia, Gda≈Ñsk or Tallinn.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Demonstrate excellent leadership skills and have a proven track record in managing and mentoring teams. FCIIA is seeking an inspirational leader who can bring a high level of capability in both the strategic and operational sides of team management
Are able to balance time-critical operational investigations with more strategic activities such as thematic trend analysis
Are a proactive self-starter who is comfortable working in an environment that can be fast-paced and changeable
Are a collaborative team player, with a track record of establishing effective working relationships with other teams
Are results-oriented and able to deliver through your team and to develop your team‚Äôs potential
Have sharp decision making-skills; able to prioritise, multi-task, and problem-solve while meeting deadlines
Are able to maintain attention to detail, accuracy, and organisation under pressure
Use available technical capabilities and resources effectively
Have a strong cultural awareness

Your experience and background:¬†

Experience in financial crime investigations or intelligence analysis, including network analysis (essential)
Experience in exploration, analysis, and visualisation of large and multi-source datasets (essential)
Experience of producing high quality English language reports based on data analysis and qualitative sources (essential)
Experience in people management of analysts and/or data analysts and/or investigators (essential), and in managing teams ¬†with specialist and hybrid skillsets (desirable)
Track record of readily adopting new analytical tools and datasets (essential), and experience with analytical tools like i2 analyst notebook or Quantexa products (desirable)
Knowledge of financial crime risks and their management (essential) preferably in a banking context
AML/CTF or sanctions legal/compliance knowledge (desirable)
Experience in training or coaching in any of the skills listed above (desirable)
Existing people management experience (desirable)
AML/CTF qualification from a recognised body such as ICA or ACAMS (desirable)
University degree (essential)



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 05/09/2024.¬†

¬†

For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Alex Meehan (alex.meehan@nordea.com), Head of FCIIA.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. ¬†

For candidates in Sweden only -¬†For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.



For candidates in Poland only - Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‚ÄòGDPR‚Äô. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.

The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza ≈ömiglego 20, 93-281 ≈Åod≈∫. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf

We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

Title: Senior Manager Analytics
Description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.

We are looking for a Senior Manager Analytics to lead our data analysts working in our game studios in Stockholm and Copenhagen. In this role you will ensure that the game teams receive valuable insights for creating the best games, by participating in strategic planning and nurturing your team members to be their very best to to reach the studio goals. As a team lead, you will nourish an inspiring team culture and mentor your team members to develop professionally. You will also have the opportunity to participate in a game project as an individual contributor.

You will have impact and fun at work by:


Providing leadership and support to a team of data analysts working in game teams
Coaching team members to improve their performance and help them advance in their career development
Supporting studios and game management in high level analysis and planning
Daily contributing to the key game projects in the Nordic studios providing actionable insights from the data


Experience and skills we are looking for:


Proven experience as a manager for data analyst or data scientist in a product setting, preferably within gaming or mobile apps with large user basis
Proficiency in relevant scripting language and data tools (SQL, Python, R) and experience in A/B testing design, implementation and decision making
Track record of turning analysis into valuable recommendations, creating visible business impact for the product you are supporting
Understanding of statistical analysis, bayesian methods and machine learning
Good communication and interpersonal skills and a commercial mindset, with an understanding of the business implications of data insights


Please send your CV in English.





We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

What to expect when you join us

Meet the Rovians

About Rovio

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Commercial & Marketing
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way ‚Äî but there‚Äôs still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot‚Äôs growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! That‚Äôs where Analytics comes in - you‚Äôll enable us measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. We‚Äôve built a innovative analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Data Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate with Trusties in our Commercial and Marketing or Trust teams and spend your time digging through our data to provide them with data-driven insights, as well as analytics and dashboards/reporting. You‚Äôre keen to ensure them use data to answer their toughest questions, and you can proactively identify areas that need a little data support. You‚Äôll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our data warehouse at your fingertips, working with analytical tools including BigQuery and Looker.

Commercial/Marketing

As a B2B company, understanding our customers‚Äô journey from prospect to paid customer is key. In this role, you get to join a growing team of data analysts and work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Operations teams. The team is responsible for all types of analyses to support our marketing and commercial efforts and strategy, from understanding which marketing campaigns work well, to mapping our customers‚Äô journey through data and analysing the impact of our pricing initiatives.

Trust

A huge part of what we do at Trustpilot is Trust (it‚Äôs in the name!). We need to ensure that the content on our platform is real content from real people. That means eliminating scam and spam, and identifying fraudulent behavior. We have several cross functional teams devoted to Trust. You‚Äôll be tightly aligned to their goals, assisting teams such as Content Integrity to discover fraudulent activity, and helping data scientists assess their spam models.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Delivering expert analytics and insights to different parts of the business, through both workstream-focused initiatives and ad-hoc inquiries
Picking the right solution for the problem you‚Äôve got, from your arsenal of analytical tools and methods
Working closely with the Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams to understand their data and their goals to deliver awesome solutions
Presenting and promoting your work to the wider business, to enable data-inform choices
Mentoring and transferring knowledge to more junior team members


Who You Are


Deep knowledge of key analytical and statistical methodologies, such as model-based analyses (regression, clustering etc.), cohort analysis and A/B testing. as well as reporting best practices, leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Experience in stakeholder and project management, with the knowledge to deliver results back to the business
Proficiency in R or Python, and awesome SQL skills
Familiarity with Airflow, DBT or similar tools used for building data pipelines
Advanced written and verbal communication skills


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It‚Äôs complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever ‚Äî to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial ‚Äî we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 260 million reviews and 57 million monthly active users across the globe, with 117 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we‚Äôre headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We‚Äôre driven by connection. It‚Äôs at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh ‚Äì‚Äì it‚Äôs built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Where grit and data meets

Global logistics is an intricate blend of tangible operations and complex data streams. Each product ordered, manufactured, sold, and delivered involves real people and is meticulously tracked at every stage. This meticulous tracking is driven by the growing demand for transparency and predictability in shipping. Within the Data and Customer Experience team at Blue Water Shipping, we meet this demand and spearhead the digital transformation of logistics. We lay the data foundation for tomorrow‚Äôs customers by weaving together the threads of our global business.

As a Data Analyst on our team, you will collaborate closely with the Business and Process Excellence teams to ensure that data from internal processes provides tangible value to BWS customers through our customer portals. Your role will be crucial in setting the bar for data quality in our digital products and driving data-driven excellence within an agile organization.

Enhancing customer value through data excellence

Our team is pivotal in crafting scalable, robust solutions that enhance our enterprise through data accessibility and quality. Key projects include:


Ensuring dataflows from internal processes to customer insights, directly impacting customer satisfaction.
Collaborating with the Business experts and Process Excellence teams to ensure seamless data integration and utilization across systems.
Implementing data quality standards that elevate the accuracy and reliability of information available on customer portals.
Creating validation processes together with the business to increase and improve our customers insights.


As a Data Analyst, you will delve into datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities, ensuring our data solutions align with the highest industry standards. Whether you are developing new analytical models, refining existing processes, or presenting data-driven insights to stakeholders, your work will directly influence our success.

Elevate our team

At Blue Water Shipping we believe in the power of teamwork and shared success. You bring a strong analytical background and a passion for data, but you also thrive in collaborative environments and contribute to a sense of camaraderie within the team. We are a growing team, offering ample opportunities to influence our culture, processes, and collective growth. While our primary location is in Esbjerg, we offer flexibility for the right candidate.

As a Data Analyst you will play a crucial role in adopting data analysis standards and contributing with fresh perspectives. You are structured and continuously looking to improve data quality. We seek someone who embodies the following qualities:


Excited by tackling complex data challenges.
Enjoys identifying anomalies and outliers in data.
Proficient in Python, R or SQL for data analysis and visualization.
Familiar with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Knowledgeable about data warehousing and ETL processes.
Enjoys crafting insightful, elegant solutions that adhere to industry best practices.
Thrives in a technology-driven environment and adapts seamlessly to change.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


What We Can Offer You

Blue Water Shipping has an informal company culture of respect and trust. We keep our agreements, and we walk the walk. We value employee well-being, and it is an important part of our culture to have fun while working to achieve our common goals. We offer you:


An unpretentious and flexible working environment.
Plenty of influence and challenges working towards a distinct strategy.
Possibilities to join relevant courses and education.
Impact and opportunities to develop personally and professionally.
A strong community where team collaboration is in focus.


What we do ‚Äì Together we create solutions‚ÄØ

Blue Water Shipping is a global provider of all logistic services in modern supply chain management. Founded in Denmark in 1972, Blue Water is a global organization of professionals, skilled to offer complete and tailor-made solutions to any shipping requirement anywhere in the world. We offer clients the best service and highest quality in the industry.‚ÄØ

The company is represented with more than 80 offices in 30 countries worldwide combining a strong global network with local expertise. Every day our 2500 employees and 6 distinct business units present a broad range of offers from standardized services delivered with optimal user and customer focus, to tailor-made projects with co-created solutions for unique customer needs

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description: Data Visualization Specialist UI/UX - ATHENA

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive actions and business value? Do you have a keen eye for how to best vizualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to help shape a design thinking process for our products?

Pandora is seeking a talented UX/UI Data Visualzsation Specialist to join the ATHENA team. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to improve the usability of the portal and to increase the satisfaction of our users as well as shaping the future of user interactions and service design, even using AI tools.

About the ATHENA team at Pandora:

ATHENA is the one stop shop for reporting in Pandora. All enterprise company reports are built in Power BI and hosted in ATHENA from where everyone can access and consume data, insights and self-service analytics products.

As Data Visualization Specialist within the team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing user experiences and designing interfaces that leverage the full potential of design best practices as well as checking consistency and design coherence across all the distributed insights.

Collaborating closely with our D&A Product Lines, you'll be instrumental in crafting user-centric solutions to improve Pandora‚Äôs colleague and customer experience.

Roles and Responsibilities:

UX Design:


Define design principles, best practices, quality check for the visuals used across the company
Create wireframes, mock-ups, templates, and high quality designs for data-driven applications.
Ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience across the ATHENA platform and the Power BI reports.
Collaborate with data visualisation specialists and developers to implement and iterate on designs, ensuring alignment with design principles and engineering standards.



Usability Testing:


Plan and execute usability testing sessions to validate design concepts and gather user feedback.
Iterate on designs based on usability testing results and feedback from stakeholders.
Advocate for user-centered UX design principles in Power BI within the organization.



Cross-functional Collaboration:


Work closely with product managers, business domains, local data teams and other stakeholders to integrate their product into ATHENA, giving advice about best practices and design principals, as well as applying the company data and governance model for Power BI.
Collaborate with communication teams to ensure consistent branding and messaging across all touchpoints.
Foster a collaborative and innovative design culture within all teams, for example through Communities of Practice and/or other initiatives.



Experience Required:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
Proven experience in service design and UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing successful projects.
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.
Experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS
Experience with Agile development processes and working in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey design principles and rationale to stakeholders.
Familiarity with emerging design trends and a passion for staying updated on industry best practices.



Our Pandora Values:

We‚ÄØdream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØdare‚ÄØto pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØcare‚ÄØdeeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and‚ÄØ

we‚ÄØdeliver‚ÄØon our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you‚Äôre excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.‚ÄØ

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

HTML:
Job Description: Data Visualization Specialist UI/UX - ATHENA

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive actions and business value? Do you have a keen eye for how to best vizualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to help shape a design thinking process for our products?

Pandora is seeking a talented UX/UI Data Visualzsation Specialist to join the ATHENA team. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to improve the usability of the portal and to increase the satisfaction of our users as well as shaping the future of user interactions and service design, even using AI tools.

About the ATHENA team at Pandora:

ATHENA is the one stop shop for reporting in Pandora. All enterprise company reports are built in Power BI and hosted in ATHENA from where everyone can access and consume data, insights and self-service analytics products.

As Data Visualization Specialist within the team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing user experiences and designing interfaces that leverage the full potential of design best practices as well as checking consistency and design coherence across all the distributed insights.

Collaborating closely with our D&A Product Lines, you'll be instrumental in crafting user-centric solutions to improve Pandora‚Äôs colleague and customer experience.

Roles and Responsibilities:

UX Design:

  • Define design principles, best practices, quality check for the visuals used across the company
  • Create wireframes, mock-ups, templates, and high quality designs for data-driven applications.
  • Ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience across the ATHENA platform and the Power BI reports.
  • Collaborate with data visualisation specialists and developers to implement and iterate on designs, ensuring alignment with design principles and engineering standards.


Usability Testing:

  • Plan and execute usability testing sessions to validate design concepts and gather user feedback.
  • Iterate on designs based on usability testing results and feedback from stakeholders.
  • Advocate for user-centered UX design principles in Power BI within the organization.


Cross-functional Collaboration:

  • Work closely with product managers, business domains, local data teams and other stakeholders to integrate their product into ATHENA, giving advice about best practices and design principals, as well as applying the company data and governance model for Power BI.
  • Collaborate with communication teams to ensure consistent branding and messaging across all touchpoints.
  • Foster a collaborative and innovative design culture within all teams, for example through Communities of Practice and/or other initiatives.


Experience Required:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in service design and UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing successful projects.
  • Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.
  • Experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization
  • Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS
  • Experience with Agile development processes and working in cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey design principles and rationale to stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with emerging design trends and a passion for staying updated on industry best practices.


Our Pandora Values:

We‚ÄØdream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØdare‚ÄØto pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØcare‚ÄØdeeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and‚ÄØ

we‚ÄØdeliver‚ÄØon our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you‚Äôre excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.‚ÄØ

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Revenue analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable business opportunities? Do you excel in dynamic environments, leading data-driven commercial improvements with multiple stakeholders?

Join Kahoot!, one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS companies, and be part of our exciting growth journey!

We are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our Commercial Excellence team, responsible for driving commercial success across our global organization. If you thrive in a global setting, welcome challenges, enjoy being hands-on, and are driven to perform and succeed, this is a fantastic opportunity to shine in our commercial team. With access to vast amounts of data, you will play a key role in translating it into valuable business opportunities for our customer-facing teams and management.

This position can be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Oslo, Norway.

Please note due to vacation the first stage of this recruitment will not start before 15th August 2024.

About Kahoot!

The Kahoot! Group is on a mission to make learning awesome! We want to empower everyone, including children, students, and employees to unlock their full learning potential. Our Kahoot! learning platform makes it easy for any individual or corporation to create, share, and host learning sessions that drive compelling engagement.

Launched in 2013, Kahoot!'s vision is to build the leading learning platform in the world. Since launch, Kahoot! has hosted hundreds of millions of learning sessions with more than 10 billion participants (non-unique) in more than 200 countries and regions. The Kahoot! Group includes Clever, the leading US K-12 EdTech learning platform, together with the learning apps DragonBox, Poio, Drops, Actimo, Motimate, and Whiteboard.fi.

The Kahoot! Group is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with offices in the US, the UK, France, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Spain and Poland. To learn more, visit us at kahoot.com, and let's play!

Our K!rew

At the Kahoot! Group we champion a positive culture of collaborative learning and innovation. With a global team of more than 500 employees representing over 50 different nationalities, we're a diverse and fun bunch of people! We work hard and celebrate our wins, tackle challenges with original ideas and learn something new every day.

We are driven by our mission and guided by our values: playful, curious and inclusive.

If you talk to anyone working in the Kahoot! Group, they will tell you that one of the greatest perks is being able to see how the work you do puts a smile on the face of kids, teachers and learners all around the world.

The role

To further strengthen our commercial success, we are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our team. You will report to the Director of Commercial Excellence and work closely with the commercial teams and sales operations in the US, EMEA & APAC regions.

We want to take the next step in becoming more data driven in our commercial operation, and your main responsibility is to work on revenue-generating initiatives, deliver valuable data insights, and collaborate cross-functionally to improve business performance.

Responsibilities


Monitor and analyse sales performance data, revenue trends and patterns, to identify growth opportunities for our commercial functions.
Identify and analyse revenue leakage or areas of underperformance to recommend corrective actions.
Lead data projects that support revenue growth and strategic business initiatives
Working closely with cross-functional teams, including Customer Success, Business Development, Industry Sales, Channel Sales, Data team and Sales Operations to ensure maximum impact of data projects.
Collaborating with our CRM team to streamline processes and reporting across our CRM platform and other relevant tools.
Work with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration of data insights into sales processes.
Recommend, develop and maintain relevant key metrics to monitor commercial success and drive continuous improvement
Perform ad-hoc analysis, reports/key metrics on recurring schedule, translate and communicate results to management



Requirements


Bachelor's degree or equivalent
3+ years of experience in similar position
Experience supporting large account sales and customer success teams
Experience with Google BigQuery, HubSpot and Amplitude is a clear advantage
Strong skills in data analysis, including the ability to analyse large datasets, identify trends, and draw actionable insights
Solid commercial acumen with a good understanding of sales and the commercial side of the business.
Great communication and presentation skills for delivering data insights to various internal stakeholders
Teamplayer with strong collaboration skills, experience and ability to work across functional teams and across multiple markets
Ambitious with a track record of supporting strong results through analysis, insights, collaboration and the ability to make things happen and within tight deadlines
Structured, proactive and professional approach, always seeking to create progression.



Benefits


A competitive compensation package
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Home broadband allowance
Mobile subscription
Lunch contribution
Hybrid work set up
Flexible working
Buddy program
Social and company events (virtual and in person)
A diverse, friendly and international environment
Modern office in central Copenhagen
Show more

  • Solid commercial acumen with a good understanding of sales and the commercial side of the business.
  • Great communication and presentation skills for delivering data insights to various internal stakeholders
  • Teamplayer with strong collaboration skills, experience and ability to work across functional teams and across multiple markets
  • Ambitious with a track record of supporting strong results through analysis, insights, collaboration and the ability to make things happen and within tight deadlines
  • Structured, proactive and professional approach, always seeking to create progression.


Benefits

  • A competitive compensation package
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Home broadband allowance
  • Mobile subscription
  • Lunch contribution
  • Hybrid work set up
  • Flexible working
  • Buddy program
  • Social and company events (virtual and in person)
  • A diverse, friendly and international environment
  • Modern office in central Copenhagen

Title: BI & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Are you looking for a big challenge and opportunity to have a high impact on a startup company? If so, keep on reading!

The Opportunity And What We Offer

Formalize is on a scaling journey with significant traction across Europe. As our new BI and Analytics Specialist, you'll have the opportunity to learn, grow, and tackle significant challenges to make a meaningful impact in our Revenue Operations team. You will be our first specialized BI and Analytics hire, so it comes with great growth opportunities. Seize this distinctive chance to actively contribute to shaping Formalize's products growth narrative.

Responsibilities

Project Leadership:


Lead data science projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and meet business objectives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, and sales, to integrate data science solutions seamlessly into business processes


Technical Development:


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and models
Optimize and refine models to improve their performance and accuracy
Integrate various marketing platforms and tools via APIs to create seamless workflows


Communication & Collaboration:


Communicate complex data science concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their needs and how data science can provide value
Advocate for a data-driven culture within the organization


Business Acumen


Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Understanding of the SaaS (or similar) business model
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and performance metrics that support strategic decision-making


Qualifications And Expectations Towards You:


Proficiency in programming and query languages such as SQL
Proficiency in programming basic Javascript
Minimum of 2 years of experience in data science or a related field
Proven track record of delivering successful data science projects
Familiarity with data warehousing: BigQuery preferred
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau etc. applicable)
Strong data integrity, accuracy, and security by implementing robust data governance and management practices
Knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and HubSpot


The Opportunity And What We Offer:


Be part of a fast-growing venture backed SaaS company
Be part of an international culture that invest heavily in their people - from skill development, company trips, to promotion opportunities
High level of trust and autonomy
Possibility of partial work from home or remote work.


Traits That Describe Our Culture And Employees:


We are all very goal oriented and hardworking
We are responsible, and we like accountability - we expect you to take responsibility of your tasks and deadlines
We are connecting, and we like to build meaningful relationships
We are optimistic and like to laugh and have a positive atmosphere
We like to dream big and to have clear visions for the future


Test in the recruitment process

In the recruitment process, we use talent profiles. You will therefore receive a link to the test if you proceed from the first round of interviews.

Experience shows that it provides the best experience for both candidates and us as a company. It's not about answering right or wrong, but whether one's talents match the context you will work in. We want to hire a colleague who really thrives and flourishes with us, and therefore we are looking for the employee who will be a good fit with Whistleblower Software in relation to


Fit between the person and work tasks
Fit between the person and the colleagues in the team
Fit between the person and the role


We know that when this is staged optimally, you thrive and succeed much better in your job.

Recruitment Process

üìÉ Send application and upload relevant information

üöÄ 15 minutes online interview w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üß† Completion of personality test

üìä 30 minutes deep dive of the role w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üìö Case preparation

üåü 60 minutes in-person case interview with our Head of Revenue Operations & our CMO

üèÅ Criminal record check

Apply by attaching your resume and other relevant information and you will hear from us soon!

We will hold interviews and hire on an ongoing basis. For more information or questions please contact the responsible recruiter in the Talent team.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Tester
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are You Ready to Work With the Latest Technologies?

We are looking to grow our IT team with a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Tester. If you appreciate working with the latest technologies, wish to improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives, it could be you who we are looking for.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data. Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK as well as colleagues from other departments.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our data pipelines, reports, and dashboards.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for BI solutions
Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionalities are not affected by new developments
Conduct behavioral testing to validate the system‚Äôs behavior against expected outcomes
Write and execute tests in dbt (data build tool) to ensure data transformations are accurate and reliable
Collaborate with BI developers, data engineers, and analysts to understand requirements and validate solutions
Identify, document, and track defects and issues through to resolution
Ensure data quality and integrity across all data platforms
Participate in continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our BI testing capabilities


Please note that current residency in either Denmark or the UK with work and residency permit needs to be in place before applying.

A Great Match for Us

The ideal candidate will have completed a degree that provides a solid foundation in computer science principles, programming, data structures, and database management. That could be, for example, a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.

You must have worked professionally for 2-5 years in roles involving BI testing, demonstrating the ability to handle job-specific challenges and deliver results in a business environment.

Moreover you need to have:


Extensive experience conducting regression tests to ensure new code changes do not adversely affect existing functionalities.
Conducted behavioral tests to validate that the system behaves as expected under various conditions.
Hands-on experience in designing and executing test plans for ETL pipelines, ensuring data is accurately extracted from various sources, correctly transformed into the required format, and reliably loaded into data warehouses or other destinations.
Hands-on experience using dbt (data build tool) to write and execute tests for data transformations, proving your ability to ensure data quality and accuracy.
High proficiency level in SQL and the capability of writing complex queries to validate data integrity and accuracy.
Practical experience in validating data models and ensuring data consistency across the data warehouse.
Experience validating data visualizations and dashboards to ensure you provide accurate and actionable insights.
Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.


It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you are:


Experienced in validating and testing big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), ensuring data processing and transformations are performed correctly and efficiently across large-scale datasets.
Familiar with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe‚Äôs largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd‚Äôs of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.
Show more

  • Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.

It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you are:

  • Experienced in validating and testing big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), ensuring data processing and transformations are performed correctly and efficiently across large-scale datasets.
  • Familiar with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe‚Äôs largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd‚Äôs of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

Title: BI & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Are you looking for a big challenge and opportunity to have a high impact on a startup company? If so, keep on reading!

The Opportunity And What We Offer

Formalize is on a scaling journey with significant traction across Europe. As our new BI and Analytics Specialist, you'll have the opportunity to learn, grow, and tackle significant challenges to make a meaningful impact in our Revenue Operations team. You will be our first specialized BI and Analytics hire, so it comes with great growth opportunities. Seize this distinctive chance to actively contribute to shaping Formalize's products growth narrative.

Responsibilities

Project Leadership:


Lead data science projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and meet business objectives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, and sales, to integrate data science solutions seamlessly into business processes


Technical Development:


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and models
Optimize and refine models to improve their performance and accuracy
Integrate various marketing platforms and tools via APIs to create seamless workflows


Communication & Collaboration:


Communicate complex data science concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their needs and how data science can provide value
Advocate for a data-driven culture within the organization


Business Acumen


Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Understanding of the SaaS (or similar) business model
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and performance metrics that support strategic decision-making


Qualifications And Expectations Towards You:


Proficiency in programming and query languages such as SQL
Proficiency in programming basic Javascript
Minimum of 2 years of experience in data science or a related field
Proven track record of delivering successful data science projects
Familiarity with data warehousing: BigQuery preferred
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau etc. applicable)
Strong data integrity, accuracy, and security by implementing robust data governance and management practices
Knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and HubSpot


The Opportunity And What We Offer:


Be part of a fast-growing venture backed SaaS company
Be part of an international culture that invest heavily in their people - from skill development, company trips, to promotion opportunities
High level of trust and autonomy
Possibility of partial work from home or remote work.


Traits That Describe Our Culture And Employees:


We are all very goal oriented and hardworking
We are responsible, and we like accountability - we expect you to take responsibility of your tasks and deadlines
We are connecting, and we like to build meaningful relationships
We are optimistic and like to laugh and have a positive atmosphere
We like to dream big and to have clear visions for the future


Test in the recruitment process

In the recruitment process, we use talent profiles. You will therefore receive a link to the test if you proceed from the first round of interviews.

Experience shows that it provides the best experience for both candidates and us as a company. It's not about answering right or wrong, but whether one's talents match the context you will work in. We want to hire a colleague who really thrives and flourishes with us, and therefore we are looking for the employee who will be a good fit with Whistleblower Software in relation to


Fit between the person and work tasks
Fit between the person and the colleagues in the team
Fit between the person and the role


We know that when this is staged optimally, you thrive and succeed much better in your job.

Recruitment Process

üìÉ Send application and upload relevant information

üöÄ 15 minutes online interview w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üß† Completion of personality test

üìä 30 minutes deep dive of the role w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üìö Case preparation

üåü 60 minutes in-person case interview with our Head of Revenue Operations & our CMO

üèÅ Criminal record check

Apply by attaching your resume and other relevant information and you will hear from us soon!

We will hold interviews and hire on an ongoing basis. For more information or questions please contact the responsible recruiter in the Talent team.
