Title: Data Analyst/Power BI specialist within Marketing Operations
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we‚Äôre already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

The Marketing Operations function in UR Marketing is relatively new. Hence you will join an ambitious and business critical team, who are on an exciting growth journey ‚Äì keen to improve and support the business and UR marketing even better.

The team supports the global and regional marketing teams on everything related to budgets, targets, performance, and extensive reporting. We work with a substantial list of KPIs and metrics, and it is imperative that you understand the logic and formulas behind. Business acumen is vital in this role, as you will actively help us discover trends and insights that will guide our decisions.

You will be responsible for producing new as well as elevating and maintaining insightful, interactive dashboards and visual reports giving our marketing leaders instant performance insight and drive data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Apart from working with the marketing organization, we work closely with the Sales Operations team and the Strategic Data team ensuring our ability to report seamlessly across the commercial organization and spot opportunities and challenges internally and in the market. Hence, you will need to not only work with the numbers but also understand and articulate the story they tell.

Responsibilities


Extract and transform data from various sources e.g. SalesForce to prepare it for analysis.
Develop and maintain dashboards to showcase marketing performance metrics across product areas, pipeline, conversion rates, and value split by e.g. industry, geography, time etc.
Generate Power BI reports with seamless integration into Excel for comprehensive data analysis and reporting.
Build Predictive Analysis reports to enable us to use our data proactively to build stronger plans
Build forecast model


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR


5-8 years of experience from marketing analytics or related field
Proficiency in Power BI, SalesForce and Excel, with hands-on experience in developing marketing dashboards.
Key Competencies includes development of user-friendly dashboards and reports, data visualization and analysis, automating routine tasks and processes, creating data models and implementing best practices
Ability to work independently to identify and visualize relevant KPIs that align with business objectives. Demonstrated ability to gather, structure, and analyze complex data for reporting and visualization purposes
Skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights and actionable recommendations
Strong analytical skills to gather and structure data effectively for reporting purposes and look for trends in the numbers we can use to scale our business.
Must be based in Denmark and be fluid in spoken and written English


We collaborate - it¬¥s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year‚Äôs innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia ‚Äì and we‚Äôre growing all the time. So, if you‚Äôre looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Please apply using the link. We invite candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Student Assistant Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Assistant for Data Engineer, Group IT (GN Group)

Do you want to take data stewardship of some of our most intricate, global, cross-functional strategic data projects in a world-wide recognized company?

Then you might be our new colleague.

At GN Group we design and manufacture world-leading intelligent audio, video, and gaming communication solutions. We have consumer, professional and medical-grade products, and expertise - all under one roof which gives us a great advantage and lots of opportunities. Inspired by people and driven by our passion for innovation, we leverage technologies to deliver unique user experiences that bring people closer through the power of sound.

The team you will be part of

You will be part of Data Engineer, you will be based at our global HQ, located in Ballerup Denmark, and report to our Data Transformation Lead and Product Owner Martin Stevns. You will join a team of 50 technical, cooperative, and encouraging colleagues located in Denmark, Europe and in China, who are all looking forward to welcoming you to the team.

This role is an exciting opportunity to contribute to several strategic projects and initiatives, helping to execute data engineering tasks and develop your skills in a real-world setting.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Assist in executing data engineering tasks for various projects (Strategic Initiatives (SIs) in GN) and the team backlog, collaborating closely with stakeholders
Support the implementation of data integration, cataloging, and data product development tactics
Help coordinate and ensure the integration of your deliverables with multiple teams across the organization
Provide input to a backlog of data engineering tasks in collaboration with the Data Transformation Lead
Contribute to the management of our data catalog
Aid in the development of data products for our future data marketplace
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute new ideas alongside stakeholders and the Data Transformation Lead
Play a role in transforming our existing data utilization structure
Engage with and support collaboration with both domestic and international colleagues


To succeed in the role, we imagine that you:


Are pursuing a relevant higher education degree, ideally in IT, engineering, or a related technical field
Have a passion for data and an understanding of its importance in a dynamic, global organization
Are a team-player thriving collaborating with others. And you can also work independently and maintain initiative
Have strong communication skills and capable of explaining technical concepts to a non-technical audience, since you will work with cross-functional, global internal stakeholders throughout the organization
Are curious or experience with tools such as Microsoft Purview, Azure EventHub, Event Grid, Data Factory, SQL, KQL, or a willingness to learn these technologies
Fluent in English, both written and spoken


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don‚Äôt match all the above-mentioned skills, we gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value the right mindset; motivation and energy and we believe that the right personal competencies are highly important for creating success.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process and all applicants will receive equal consideration for employment.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

Joining GN as a student assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday bars, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‚ÄòAPPLY‚Äô link no later than August 30. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don‚Äôt wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up-to-date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying ‚Äì quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Martin Stevns, Data Transformation Lead and Product Owner, on LinkedIn or on +45 24 37 57 26.

Joining GN as a student assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday bars, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‚ÄòAPPLY‚Äô link no later than August 30. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don‚Äôt wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up-to-date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying ‚Äì quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Martin Stevns, Data Transformation Lead and Product Owner, on LinkedIn or on +45 24 37 57 26.

Title: Customer Insight Analyst for PeB Analytics Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:¬†23946¬†



Would you like to empower business professionals to unlock the potential of data? We are growing our team in Personal Banking‚Äôs Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE) Denmark. ¬†

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.¬†

About this opportunity

Working in PeB Analytics you will be in the heart of everything we do in Nordea. From strategy projects, to actionable business/customer analysis and to make relevant engagement towards Nordea‚Äôs customers. We support key business stakeholders with a data driven approach making their everyday easy to take actionable actions towards creating positive customer experience and business development. ¬†

We are looking for a curious, driven Data Analysts / Data Scientist that is a crucial part of implementing this strategy. Someone who is comfortable working on their own or as part of wider data analyst community to support Personal Banking (business stakeholders). You will be challenged all from on your data/analytics skills, to your stakeholder management and story telling skills.

¬†

You will be a part of a highly prioritized data strategy in which we as team, in collaboration with stakeholders, will drive Nordea into a new digital age.

¬†

What you will be doing¬†As the Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will act as a link between data and business. You will be driver of the data/analytics strategy development in close collaboration with key stakeholders.

¬†

You will be supporting three key areas in this strategy:¬†

Analytics & Business Intelligence:
Develop Analytics and BI that transform data into actionable insights that drive business development & decisions
Enable the business to be self-driven though data-driven solutions and behaviour
Analyse trends and business movement from a Customer Centric point of view and help key stakeholders identify opportunities
Customer Engagement:
Drive our ability to engage customers by identifying future events, behaviours & opportunities. Enable sales & care utilizing data and analytical tools to drive the customer experience for Nordea Customers¬†



Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

We are looking for someone who is motivated working with data and analytics - someone who can look at all kinds of data and see meaning, insights, ideas, opportunities and elevate analysis and strategic thinking to support the team in delivering the best customer experiences. ¬†We hope that you:

Enjoy teaching your stakeholders to see the possibilities and restrictions of data and analytics, and are proud to see your business colleagues to become even more data driven
Are able to clearly communicate complex issues in an easy and understandable manner to a wide range of stakeholder
Can drive tasks on your own but equally skilled in facilitating collaboration around tasks while maintaining the customer centric mindset
Are innovative, openminded and excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You strive for continuous improvement and love learning and trying out new things. You're dependable, willing to speak up even when it's difficult, and committed to empowering others

¬†To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Have academic degree in highly quantitative discipline or specialisation such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or Finance, and you have understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models
Have 1-3 years of experience in data analytics. Ideally you have experience working on analytics / data science projects delivering tangible benefits / outcome
Are comfortable in using one or more data science programming language e.g. Python, R, SQL
Share ‚Äúmake it happen attitude‚Äù ‚Äì have a proactive, innovative and can-do oriented mind-set with the ability to convert new ideas into concrete actions
Have a passion for teaching others teaching and supporting less experienced data users, with the ability to inspire and motivate
Are proficient in written and spoken Danish & English

¬†Additional background and/or skillset, that are beneficial in this role:

You know your ways around tools like Hive, Snowflake, visualization tool such as Power BI
You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach
Financial industry expertise
Teaching experience

¬†

What we offer

¬†

By joining Nordea you can impact on the life of 11 million customers. Our team has an important role in helping to inspire and educate business teams on effectively utilizing data to drive informed decision-making. Joining the team will provide you with opportunities to use your experience with data management, data analysis and data engineering to support business developers, leaders, digital marketing specialists & other stakeholders. ¬†We have modern office in Copenhagen where you can enjoy lunch together with your colleagues. We follow hybrid model of working. Nordea Bank offers various employment benefits.

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 02/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Martin Zinglersen.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Would you like to empower business professionals to unlock the potential of data? We are growing our team in Personal Banking‚Äôs Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE) Denmark.

We are looking for a curious, driven Data Analysts / Data Scientist that is a crucial part of implementing this strategy. You will be a part of a highly prioritized data strategy in which we as team, in collaboration with stakeholders, will drive Nordea into a new digital age.

 

What you will be doing As the Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will act as a link between data and business. You will be driver of the data/analytics strategy development in close collaboration with key stakeholders.

  • Analytics & Business Intelligence:
    • Develop Analytics and BI that transform data into actionable insights that drive business development & decisions
    • Enable the business to be self-driven though data-driven solutions and behaviour
    • Analyse trends and business movement from a Customer Centric point of view and help key stakeholders identify opportunities
  • Customer Engagement:
    • Drive our ability to engage customers by identifying future events, behaviours & opportunities. Enable sales & care utilizing data and analytical tools to drive the customer experience for Nordea Customers 



Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.  

We are looking for someone who is motivated working with data and analytics - someone who can look at all kinds of data and see meaning, insights, ideas, opportunities and elevate analysis and strategic thinking to support the team in delivering the best customer experiences.  We hope that you:

  • Are able to clearly communicate complex issues in an easy and understandable manner to a wide range of stakeholder
  • Can drive tasks on your own but equally skilled in facilitating collaboration around tasks while maintaining the customer centric mindset
  • Are innovative, openminded and excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You strive for continuous improvement and love learning and trying out new things. You're dependable, willing to speak up even when it's difficult, and committed to empowering others

 To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Have academic degree in highly quantitative discipline or specialisation such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or Finance, and you have understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models
  • Have 1-3 years of experience in data analytics. Ideally you have experience working on analytics / data science projects delivering tangible benefits / outcome

  • Share ‚Äúmake it happen attitude‚Äù ‚Äì have a proactive, innovative and can-do oriented mind-set with the ability to convert new ideas into concrete actions
  • Have a passion for teaching others teaching and supporting less experienced data users, with the ability to inspire and motivate
  • Are proficient in written and spoken Danish & English

 Additional background and/or skillset, that are beneficial in this role:

  • You know your ways around tools like Hive, Snowflake, visualization tool such as Power BI
  • You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach
  • Financial industry expertise
  • Teaching experience

 

What we offer

 

By joining Nordea you can impact on the life of 11 million customers. Our team has an important role in helping to inspire and educate business teams on effectively utilizing data to drive informed decision-making. Joining the team will provide you with opportunities to use your experience with data management, data analysis and data engineering to support business developers, leaders, digital marketing specialists & other stakeholders.  We have modern office in Copenhagen where you can enjoy lunch together with your colleagues. We follow hybrid model of working. Nordea Bank offers various employment benefits.

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Located in Denmark.

Title: Consumer Insights Specialist
Description:
Are you passionate about working with customer insights, and do you want to be part of an exciting journey where you ensure the voice of the customer across JYSK? Then you might be the new Customer Insight Specialist we are looking for!




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Customer Insight Specialist you will help collect and analyse customer data and communicate customer insights across the organisation. You will work with many different types of projects and stakeholders and help create the foundation for the newly established customer insight function.




Furthermore, we offer you:

To join a newly established function where you can help define the direction for customer insights in JYSK
To play a central role in understanding and communicating our customers‚Äô behavior and preferences as well as overall market trends
To work with a wide range of interesting and challenging customer insights tasks that provide great learning opportunities within an international retail success story
To be part of a small team striving to exceed expectations in everything we do, whilst having fun




WHAT YOUR NEXT JOB WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities in the job include:

Lead customer insight projects from start to end ‚Äì both qualitative and quantitative - for stakeholders across JYSK to bring customer insights for decision-making
Assess and apply most relevant methods to get valid and applicable insight in cooperation with stakeholders and in some cases external partners
Analyse and interpret customer data to actionable insights by use of both existing and new data sources including our new digital solutions (e.g. CDP)
Communicate actionable customer insights to stakeholders across JYSK
Set up and maintain ongoing reporting on main customer KPIs for top management and relevant stakeholders across the customer journey
Develop the customer insight function together with the rest of the team




You can read more about working at JYSK at https://job.jysk.dk/dk/head-office




WHAT SHOULD YOU BRING

To succeed in this role, you have an analytical and structured mindset. You have a strong understanding of business and great stakeholder management and communication skills. You thrive in a dynamic environment where we help each other to get the best results for our stakeholders. You bring relevant experience to the team and want to contribute to the foundation and development of the function.

In addition, you:




Have +3 years or more experience working with customer insights and customer data in a similar internal role or/and as an external consultant
Have a strong and broad understanding of data sources, tools and survey methods for getting relevant insights
Have worked with projects and project management
Have strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Can quickly understand new business areas and become a valuable customer insight sparring partner across the organisation




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Head of Customer Insights, Anita Rytter +45 2266 8801 (on holiday until 6th of August).




Send us a brief application with your CV by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. We process applications on an ongoing basis and complete the recruitment once we have found the right candidate.

Description:

Title: Senior Specialist Membership Performance Analytics & Insights
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Ready to transform LEGO¬Æ Membership's performance management, driving data-driven decisions and joining a value-driven company in a global role? Then look no further!

Join us for an exciting career as ‚ÄúSenior Membership Performance Specialist‚Äù as part of the newly established Membership & Personalisation team within LEGO¬Æ Market & Channels Global Marketing.

Please note the work location is either Copenhagen or Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Lead performance management projects for Membership & Personalization, by supporting the creation of reporting frameworks, helping to define relevant performance and business metrics, and by supporting performance improvement initiatives across all cross-functional reporting & analytics teams
Support the delivery of high-quality reports on a weekly and monthly basis, covering the latest performance insights on our member base to drive data-driven decision making, in close partnership with reporting, analytics and finance teams across the business
Support the briefing and/or creation of self-service dashboards, to facilitate speed and transparency in performance updates
Support the delivery of member, channel and campaign insights, levering all available data and tools to showcase business opportunities, working closely with Membership Acquisition & Activation, and Membership Expansion teams
Support the (annual) forecasting & target setting process of Membership & Personalization, in conjunction with the LEGO Group‚Äôs OKR and portfolio planning process, and in close partnership with Finance, CRM Hub, Membership operations, M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Development), Digital and Supply chain
Support the P&L management process of Membership & Personalization, by investigating trends by and creating insights on what actions will improve top and bottom line results, in close partnership with Finance
Partner with the Membership Operations team on member feedback & satisfaction tracking and reporting, and help synthesize into overall membership performance
Contribute to creating a performance culture by helping to define the standard-of-excellence in performance management, and by actively encouraging knowledge-sharing across performance management teams in M&C, PMD and LEGO Retail
Help driving an agile way-of-working model, ensuring quality, flexibility and speed in how business questions are tackled




Play your part in our team succeeding

This position will be responsible for leading performance management projects and actively contributes to planning & target setting within Membership & Personalization. Collaborating with key cross functional teams across M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Department), and Digital, helping us leverage data to achieve our membership and personalization goals effectively and efficiently.

You will report directly to the Senior Director Performance, Development & Decisioning.

Do you have what it takes?





Strong experience in performance management, insights, and/or analytics, with proficiency in Adobe Analytics or similar tools, SQL-based databases, and Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience in SQL and Excel is a must
Strong structured problem solving & communication capabilities
Excels at creating clear, concise and actionable insights from multiple data sources to answer business questions
Proficient understanding of personalization, CRM, and loyalty programs
An enthusiastic, positive approach and determination to overcome obstacles; can-do attitude, focused on quality, efficiency, and operational excellence.
Open, collaborative communication style, with experience working across cultures and time zones to build connected, sustainable relationships regardless of organizational structure




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Student Worker Strategic Data Office
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., our mission is simple: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. With 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we‚Äôre making a significant impact. Working towards our vision provides endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes globally.

We are seeking a talented and versatile student worker to join our team as a Data Science, Data Analytics, and Business Development Specialist. This role is ideal for a student with a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and a keen interest in business development.

Due to summer vacations, we will start reviewing candidates in August.

Key Responsibilities


Perform statistical analysis and create visualizations using Python, R, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Develop machine learning models and apply statistical methods to solve business problems.
Clean, process, and analyze large datasets; manage data warehousing and ETL processes.
Write efficient, scalable code in Python, R, SQL, and possibly Java or Scala.
Build and deploy models using TensorFlow, Keras, and Scikit-learn.
Utilize business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) and manage code with Git.
Understand business operations, translate data insights into strategies, and develop business initiatives.
Conduct market research and analyze competitive landscapes.
Present data insights to non-technical stakeholders and create business reports.
Plan, execute, and monitor projects; build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR

For you to have success in the position as our Student Worker, we imagine you have the following:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience in data science, data analytics, or business development is a plus. Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, data visualization, programming, and machine learning.
Commitment to continuous learning and ethical standards.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to approach problems methodically and develop data-driven solutions.
Adaptability to new technologies, tools, and business environments.
Good interpersonal skills for collaborative teamwork and effective engagement with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Strategic thinking about business opportunities and challenges.
High ethical standards and integrity in all business and data-related activities, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.


The working hours will be around 15 hours/week and be flexibly scheduled around your studies. There is also flexibility in additional hours and hours after 4pm as one colleague is based in Boston. You should expect to work in the office at our headquarters in Energivej.

We collaborate - it¬¥s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year‚Äôs innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia ‚Äì and we‚Äôre growing all the time. So, if you‚Äôre looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Om itm8:

itm8 er en innovativ IT-partner, der specialiserer sig i at levere l√∏sninger, der transformerer og optimerer vores kunders forretningsprocesser gennem intelligent brug af data. Vi v√¶rds√¶tter et milj√∏, hvor samarbejde, innovation og teknologisk ekspertise er n√∏glen til vores f√¶lles succes.

Title: System Engineer
Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Looking for a diverse position in a growing biotech company? Are you dedicated to cross functional engineering in a dynamic environment?




About us

Sophion Bioscience is a leading global life science company founded in 2000 by a group of electrophysiologists who were passionate about making patch clamping objectives independent of user skills.

We specialize in developing and manufacturing automated patch clamping and cell line solutions. With our complete technical, biological, and application support, we help our partners pioneer ion channel research and drug discovery within cardiology and neuroscience, among others. We take the voodoo out of patch clamping to provide faster, more accurate, and objective patch clamping results for our users.

Through the continued development of our QPatch Compact, QPatch, and Qube 384 platforms, we offer uncompromised data quality in a user-friendly environment, from assay setup to advanced data analysis.

Sophion is a team of over 100 members. We are headquartered in Denmark and have subsidiaries in the United States, Japan, and China.




What we are looking for:

System engineer with skills and interest to contribute and take leading part in diverse and broad aspects within development of high-tech lab instruments and a desire to work closely and in the middle of a group of other professionals like hardware and software engineers, biologists, physicists and end-users to create world class analytical solutions for biological applications within pharmaceutical research.




About the Role:

Our instruments are a succesfull combination of mechanics, electronics, fluidics, embedded and higher level software. As member of our team, you will contribute both to the development of future solutions for new products, as well as the continuous development of solutions for our current products on the market. As a system engineer you will take central part in making different components come together in the best possible manner and be key to help defining how individual components are developed while having an eye on the final product together with the product owner and project team.




We will be looking for candidates with interest, skills and personal drive to thrive in the cross-functional interface with both attention to detail and overall experience of the end-user. We imagine you find it natural to work in areas such as designing 3D mechanical parts, putting together various hardware components, do a bit of wiring/soldering as well as coding high level scripts on Pi/Arduino units as part of development towards the end product.




Through different combinations of co-teaching and relevant hands-on assignments, the onboarding process in Sophion will introduce you to the various key applications, technologies and challenges we are facing during daily work.




We can offer a relaxed but international atmosphere in a flat organization where processes are value-driven, decision paths are short and R&D developments usually enter a short turnaround cycle being quickly distributed to actual users which provides a good sense of ownership and satisfaction. Advanced, well-functioning and user-friendly systems is key for success and your contribution to the team will help our customers in pharmaceutical research throughout the world in fighting diseases and bringing new life saving medicine to the market.




Experience from the life science industry is a plus, but definitely not a must. An interest in working with cross-functional development is required.

The position is based in Ballerup and reports to the R&D Portfolio Manager




Main Responsibilities

Take active part in defining and driving development of new, innovative solutions for new products, and contribute to the development and maintenance of products in our current portfolio.
Interact with project and product managers to translate, formalize and prioritize market requirements into specific product requirements.
Collaborate closely with R&D teams within mechanics, electronics, hardware and software engineers as well as application specialists to define and develop solutions that match the needs of our customers.
Support incoming special needs from customers.
Play an important role as an agile team member to actively support the rest of the team where possible.




Key Qualifications

MSc. in engineering or a similar educational background.
Practical experience in development within one or more areas such as mechanics, fluidics or automation.
Practical test- and data driven approach to development.
Knowledge about modular design and integration into overall system architecture.
Interest in overall user experience for instrument operation.
Digestion of use cases and breaking them into relevant sub-components.
Interest in working in an environment of continuous development with changing priorities as part of an agile development framework.




Personal Qualities

Social skills and open minded towards working cross-functionally.
Thrive in working independently while being part of a team effort.
Take responsibility and pride in quality and deliverables.
A team player that works well in a dynamic environment and can have several activities ongoing at once and keep the overview.
Self-starter, highly self-driven and motivated work ethics.
Service minded, enthusiastic and enjoy solving complicated problems with a general technical flair and a ‚Äúcan do, will do‚Äù mindset.
Able to step in when colleagues need help, and able to ask for help when needed
Motivation to develop new, exciting, and innovative solutions to help scientists generate more data in the lab, faster.
A hands-on person who can thrive in a laboratory environment.
Good communication skills in English, both speaking and writing.




Apply now via LinkedIn




If you have any questions, please contact hiring manager:




Lasse Homann

Phone +45 30459880




Application deadline: As soon as possible




Apply now via LinkedIn

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Our Team as an Analytics Engineer at Maersk in Copenhagen!

Are you passionate about incorporating cutting-edge technology like machine learning and mathematical optimization into real-world operations? Do you thrive in collaborative environments where your expertise drives impactful solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

About Us

At Maersk, we are passionate about creating a world where global trade flows seamlessly. We are achieving this by harnessing the power of data and technology and embedding advanced machine learning and mathematical optimization into the core of our operations. As a global expert in container logistics, we are dedicated to building sustainable solutions that benefit our customers, communities, and the planet. Join our Network Strategy team and be part of shaping the future of shipping.

Your Role

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be at the forefront of expanding our advanced analytics capabilities within mathematical optimization, operations research, machine learning and statistics. The position involves close collaboration with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, develop innovative solutions, and implement algorithms that enhance operational efficiency and decision-making processes. Working alongside experts in mathematical optimization, business strategists, and software developers, you will contribute to the innovation of cutting-edge technologies that optimize one of the world‚Äôs largest container vessel networks.

What We Offer


An exciting role in our Network Strategy team, where you will tackle some of Maersk's most challenging optimization problems.
Opportunities to apply innovative scientific solutions to real-world challenges, making a significant impact at Maersk.
Work with a diverse range of tasks, offering opportunities for growth and the ability to take increasingly ownership of your work.
Drive optimization initiatives that advance the decarbonization journey while targeting an addressable cost base of billions annually.
Engage with a broad data science community featuring specialists in machine learning, operations research, deep learning, and many other fields.
Opportunities to contribute to Maersk's long-term strategic planning, focusing on optimizing our global ocean transportation network, but also extending to other transportation modes.
A chance to work in an international environment at our headquarters in Copenhagen.
Collaborate with a dynamic, highly diverse team that values inclusivity and brings a wide range of perspectives to drive innovative solutions.
Flexible work culture with partial remote work options.


Key Responsibilities


Develop tools in collaboration with Maersk's business to facilitate decision-making in network design and ocean product development.
Gather and analyze business requirements, conceptualize solutions, design, test, and refine prototypes and production applications.
Partner with a diverse range of business experts and stakeholders to identify opportunities for creating additional value through prescriptive analytics.
Shape the vision for leveraging software to optimize Maersk business operations.


Who We're Looking For


Strong technical background with a master's or PhD degree in engineering, mathematics, or computer science, focusing on mathematical optimization/operations research or AI/machine learning.
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in software development, particularly in algorithms and optimization tools.
Track record of successfully implementing analytical tools leading to measurable improvements in operational performance and decision-making.
Ability to translate business requirements into mathematical and quantitative models, adhering to best software development practices.
Analytical mindset with a knack for solving complex technical challenges.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with development, debugging, test, and version control tools.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for seamless collaboration.
Positive and inclusive mindset that embraces challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.
Experience in graph theory, database management (preferably MS SQL Server), systems programming languages such as C++, statistical and probability analysis, is a plus.


Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:¬†24876¬†¬†

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating a new cloud environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of near real time data ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. ¬†About this opportunity¬†To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

¬†

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you‚Äôll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

¬†

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea¬¥s target payment architecture.¬†¬†What you‚Äôll be doing:

Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis



The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup. ¬†Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset ‚Äì actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team



Your experience and background:¬†

Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups



At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

¬†

Submit your application no later than 31/08/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Troels Nissen at troels.nissen@nordea.com.

¬†

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. ¬†Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
First Digital Finance Corporation (FDFC) is a fin-tech company building disruptive and innovative products in retail credit for Southeast Asia.

The company operates BillEase, the top-rated, buy now pay later (BNPL) platform for merchants and their customers in the Philippines with more than 1m downloads.

Vision: Build financial services that delight and enable consumers

Mission: Use software and AI and to build financial products that are at least 10x better than status quo for our customers

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For


Conduct analysis of current business processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.
Work with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into functional system specifications.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our business operations, systems, and processes.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure that system designs align with business requirements.
Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure system designs meet business requirements.
Develop and maintain detailed documentation of business requirements, system designs, and testing results.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders across the organization, including senior management, to ensure project objectives are met.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and provide recommendations to the business.
Monitor system performance and identify areas for improvement.
Examine current and new business procedures.
Identify effective solutions for business software system issues.
Report common patterns, questions, and other issues to management.
Recommend solutions for improving and restructuring company procedures.
Assess company performance, information, and plans by conducting regular tests and analysis.
Monitor company systems status and report any progress or changes.
Research and estimate the costs of upgrades and improvements.
Establish specifications for new projects by developing project goals, phases, and budgets.
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.


Ideal Profile


You have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology or related field.
You have 2+ years of experience in business analysis or system analysis.
You have experience working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into system specifications.
You have understanding of software development lifecycle methodologies.
Experience in the fintech industry is a plus.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
You have ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You have strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
You have technical skills. Undestending of SQL, API, OpenAPI (swagger), BPMN, Microservice architecture is a plus.


What's on Offer?


Join a well known brand within the Financial Services Industry
Flexible working options
Excellent career development opportunities
Show more

  • Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure system designs meet business requirements.
  • Develop and maintain detailed documentation of business requirements, system designs, and testing results.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders across the organization, including senior management, to ensure project objectives are met.
  • Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and provide recommendations to the business.
  • Monitor system performance and identify areas for improvement.
  • Examine current and new business procedures.
  • Identify effective solutions for business software system issues.
  • Report common patterns, questions, and other issues to management.
  • Recommend solutions for improving and restructuring company procedures.
  • Assess company performance, information, and plans by conducting regular tests and analysis.
  • Monitor company systems status and report any progress or changes.
  • Research and estimate the costs of upgrades and improvements.
  • Establish specifications for new projects by developing project goals, phases, and budgets.
  • Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
  • Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
  • Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
  • Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
  • Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.
  • Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
  • Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
  • Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.
  • Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
  • Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Ideal Profile

  • You have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology or related field.
  • You have 2+ years of experience in business analysis or system analysis.
  • You have experience working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into system specifications.
  • You have understanding of software development lifecycle methodologies.
  • Experience in the fintech industry is a plus.
  • You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • You have ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • You have strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • You have technical skills. Undestending of SQL, API, OpenAPI (swagger), BPMN, Microservice architecture is a plus.

What's on Offer?

  • Join a well known brand within the Financial Services Industry
  • Flexible working options
  • Excellent career development opportunities

Title: Data Engineer in Intraday power team
Description:
Join the team as MFT Energy's new Data Engineer in Intraday power team

In MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our ambitious Intraday power team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Data Engineer

You will be a part of our great Intraday power team working with highly ambitious and qualified quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, tool and system developers, and traders, which means you‚Äôll be as close to the action as you can be.




We prioritize getting an MVP in production to get immediate feedback meaning that a good solution is a trade-off between speed of implementation and extendability to continuously improve our solutions.




As a Data Engineer, you will develop and maintain a sophisticated data architecture used by your colleagues in the front-office team. You will be responsible for creating data pipelines, managing our different data sources, and ensuring high-quality data flow across various projects. All this work will be done in close cooperation with both a central data team and with technically competent quants in this team. This role gives you the chance to dive deep into the exciting power domain, and your work will be critical in unifying our data agenda and supporting both in-house and third-party data needs.




It will be a requirement to be proactive and be able to work autonomously as your collaborators will know "the what" but expect you to figure out "the how". In doing so, you will have the mandate to shape the solution using our existing setup or possibly introducing new tech. Expect that the results you deliver will be used within the day and that your impact will be recognized.




Your key responsibilities

Design and implement data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL).
Manage the central databases, ensuring data is validated, cleaned, and monitored.
Collaborate with quantitative analysts, platform engineers, and traders to meet their data needs.
Help enforce best practices for data management, including schema design and data governance.
Optimize data storage solutions to balance performance, cost, and scalability ‚Äì this will be done with data engineers from our central team as well.




Your core skills

Proficiency in Python.
Experience with database management.
Strong understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.
Familiarity with orchestration and data pipeline tools such as Prefect, Apache Airflow, or similar.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Functions and Azure Data Explorer or similar cloud services.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.




Beneficial skills

Experience with SQL and KQL.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker).
Experience with or interest in big data technologies (Spark, Databricks).




Your qualifications

Relevant experience in data engineering or a related field.
MSc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Business intelligence, Economy, or a related discipline.




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, Austin, Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best and our work culture is based on collaboration, transparency, and a proactive mindset.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a match between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Quantitative Researcher (US Trading)
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging quantitative research to drive trading strategies? Do you excel in a fast-paced, highly automated environment? Are you ready to join a successful team that operates across continents? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Join us in shaping the future of trading with cutting-edge technology and innovative strategies. Your contributions will have a direct impact on our success across global markets. We are seeking a talented Quantitative Researcher to join our intraday trading team. This is your chance to be part of a vibrant and successful group with an independent trading mandate, where your skills will directly contribute to our global trading operations. As a quantitative researcher, you utilize mathematical models, statistical analysis, and computational techniques to analyze market data and forecast energy prices. You will develop algorithms to identify trading opportunities, assess risks, and optimize trading strategies. Additionally, you will continuously refine models based on market feedback and new data.

About NET

Our team operates at the forefront of quantitative trading, utilizing sophisticated models and automated systems to execute trades with efficiency and precision. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and dynamic work environment that spans continents, bringing together some of the brightest minds in the industry. Joining us means becoming part of a team that values innovation, teamwork, and success.

Key Responsibilities



Develop and implement quantitative models to enhance trading strategies.
Analyze large datasets to identify trading opportunities and improve decision-making.
Collaborate with the trading and technology teams to optimize execution processes.
Conduct research to develop new trading strategies and refine existing ones.
Monitor and adjust models in response to market changes to ensure optimal performance.



Job Requirements



An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, data science, or computer science.
Programming skills in Python, R, MATLAB, or similar languages.
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment.



What We Offer



The opportunity to work with a highly automated execution system.
A dynamic and supportive work environment with a focus on collaboration.
Professional development opportunities and career growth.
The chance to be part of a vibrant and successful team with a global reach.
A chance to rapidly learn the secrets of the trade in a fully quantitative algorithmic trading team



Seize the Opportunity!

Did we pique your interest? Submit your application via the link below ‚Äì we continuously hire talented individuals and are ready to invest in your career!

If you have any questions about this position or would like more information, please feel free to contact Troels M√∏ller Larsen.

Title: Senior Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

We're Celonis, the global leading Process Mining software company and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as Consultant.

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customers‚Äô digital transformation and drive Celonis‚Äô international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you‚Äôll do:


Initiate:
Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customer‚Äôs pain points
Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer‚Äôs processes transparent
Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:


Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customer‚Äôs processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate


Adopt:


Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customer‚Äôs success
Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program


What Celonis can offer you:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle‚Äôs Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.

What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team‚Äôs way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it¬¥s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world‚Äôs clearing systems ‚Äì enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.
