Title: Senior Master Data Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Master Data and data management? Do you have an interest in good data quality and sustainable data solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you in the Master Data Team.

Falck has embarked on an ambitious journey towards becoming a digital and data driven organization. Master Data is acknowledged as a critical component by the executive level, which is why, we are part of the most significant programs in Falck.

To fuel our ongoing digital transformation, we are seeking a highly motivated and result-oriented Senior Master Data Business Analyst to join our team. Your role will be crucial in covering business needs and ensuring successful analysis and documentation, while driving the adoption of MDM practices, and improving processes to deliver high-quality data. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering value through data and is eager to contribute to our organization's growth and success.

You will be part of a team consisting of 10 colleagues.


About The Job


In your new position as a In your new position as a Senior Master Data Business Analyst, you will be working with:



Requirements Management: Understand business goals, derive master data ambitions, unveil hidden data needs, and translate them into data requirements. Participate in delivery of requirements and act as quality assurance.
Data Analysis: Lead cross-functional business and data analysis, coordinating within the team and with other teams. Uncovering pains and identifying opportunities.
Governance: Implement global Master Data Governance and data standards across business units and markets.
Business Engagement & Stakeholder Management: Ensure close alignment with business stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts and Master Data Owner/Stewards.
Support Stewardship Community: Actively engage with Master Data Stewards, facilitate meetings and Domain Master Data forums.
Quality Monitoring: Create and utilize quality dashboards to facilitate conversations around the quality and to collaborate with stakeholders to ensure uplift.


We love diversity and we encourage people with all kinds of backgrounds to apply for the job, but

unfortunately, we do not have the possibility to reallocate candidates. Given the nature of the job,

the position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen.


About You


We are looking for a senior profile with a high drive and curiosity to enable better Master Data Management and Master Data Quality.


You enjoy engaging with stakeholders and translate business needs into relevant master data deliverables.
You are comfortable working with requirements related to processes & organization, systems & integrations and especially data quality.
You are good at planning and coordinating deliverables. Some you will manage and develop yourself; others will be co-created together with colleagues in the team.
You are used to incorporating many perspectives in your work, you consider the end-to-end impact and the full data flow. It comes natural to you, to ask ‚Äòwhy‚Äô.
You have a strong focus on impact and business value. If you have experience connecting data use cases with measurable business impact, it will be an advantage.
You have proficiency within Data Management and Data Governance. If you have experience within Master Data Management, it will also be an advantage.
You know your way around Power BI and know how to use it as input for dialogue on data quality.
You have worked with modern data management tools or MDM platforms.
You strive to work smarter by embracing digital opportunities whether it is using our own Falck GPT to support your work, automating data cleansing with robots, or improving data entries by applying data quality assurance practices.
You have great experience in working between business and IT. Maybe you have worked as a Data Analyst, Senior Business Analyst, or Data Governance Specialist.
The ideal candidate has domain knowledge across the entire value chain; commercial, operations,



Financial, HR And Other Group Functions.



About us


The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Master Data, Strategic Automation and Power Platform & AI Services. In the entire function we are 90+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw. ‚ÄØ

The Master Data Team is an international team with good energy and high spirits. We respect each other‚Äôs differences and spend many lunches discussing shared interests. We are an animal-loving team that can always be won over with good snacks and cake.

The team has existed for almost 3 years and has grown every year. We work in an agile way, using Azure DevOps, and we have a Master Data-specialized Scrum Master. We are a strategic team that aims to enable the business and group functions through governance, data quality, standardization, and principles. Over the past year we have adopted a more fact-based approach, by using Master Data Quality measurements as input for dialogues.

In Falck, you get highly flexible working conditions. We believe in a strong work-life balance and will aid you in becoming the best version of yourself. We value candidates with a willingness to learn and want you to grow with us by continually exploring new skills and new domains.

If you are a self-starter who is passionate about data, data governance and data quality and want to deliver long-term change, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

We look forward to meeting you.

Show more

Are you passionate about Master Data and data management? Do you have an interest in good data quality and sustainable data solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you in the Master Data Team.

Falck has embarked on an ambitious journey towards becoming a digital and data driven organization. Master Data is acknowledged as a critical component by the executive level, which is why, we are part of the most significant programs in Falck.

To fuel our ongoing digital transformation, we are seeking a highly motivated and result-oriented Senior Master Data Business Analyst to join our team. Your role will be crucial in covering business needs and ensuring successful analysis and documentation, while driving the adoption of MDM practices, and improving processes to deliver high-quality data. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering value through data and is eager to contribute to our organization's growth and success.

You will be part of a team consisting of 10 colleagues.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:

Vi tilbyder et milj√∏ med fokus p√• faglig udvikling, hvor du kan vokse b√•de personligt og professionelt.

Integrere on-premise-l√∏sninger med Azure-baserede systemer.
Assistere analytikere med komplekse dataudtr√¶k og forretningsanalyser.




Hvem er du?

Vi s√∏ger en person, der kan kombinere teknisk dygtighed med en analytisk tilgang. Derfor har du gerne:

Erfaring med Data Lakes og ETL-v√¶rkt√∏jer (f.eks. FME, SQL).
Kompetencer indenfor Azure, specielt Azure Data Factory og pipelines.
Erfaring med datamodellering og implementering af nye datakilder.
Kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python eller Spark.




Det er en fordel, hvis du har arbejdet med Power BI eller lignende rapporteringsv√¶rkt√∏jer samt GIS-systemer og geografiske data. Som person er du initiativtagende, selvk√∏rende, og trives i et milj√∏, hvor samarbejde og vidensdeling er i h√∏js√¶det.




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Hos Banedanmark l√¶gger vi v√¶gt p√• en balanceret hverdag, hvor faglig dygtighed g√•r h√•nd i h√•nd med en positiv og inkluderende arbejdskultur. Vi har fokus p√• work-life balance og tilbyder hjemmearbejdsdage samt mulighed for at v√¶re med til tilrettel√¶ggelsen af din arbejdsdag. Vi tilbyder ogs√• fitnessrum og Falck Health Care sundhedsordning.




L√∏n

Som akademiker ans√¶ttes du efter g√¶ldende overenskomst mellem Skatteministeriet og AC.

Som udgangspunkt er stillingen placeret i l√∏ngruppe 4. Den endelige l√∏nindplacering beror p√• en vurdering af de individuelle kompetencer og kvalifikationer. Udover basisl√∏nnen kommer pension og eventuelle lokale till√¶g.




Ans√∏gning og kontakt

Er du klar til at tage n√¶ste skridt i din karriere? S√• send din ans√∏gning og CV hurtigst muligt. Vi afholder l√∏bende samtaler.




For mere information, kontakt sektionschef Anne Ohlin Ladegaard.




Vi ser frem til at modtage din ans√∏gning!




G√•r du videre fra de indledende samtaler, vil der blive indhentet referencer fra tidligere arbejdsgiver. Du vil blive informeret inden, at der bliver indhentet en reference.

Title: Virtual Data Coordinator
Description:
Are you feeling ready to fly high? This job lets you fly drones and collect data in a playful way that helps pave the way for a greener tomorrow!




Eurowind Energy is a global and leading developer, owner and operator of wind and solar energy projects. Based in Denmark, we operate in 16 different countries across Europe and in the U.S. and we are continuously growing our project portfolio. We believe in a future of renewable energy, and we have an ambitious plan of becoming the next generations‚Äô ‚ÄúPower Major‚Äù. Based on a full value chain from greenfield project development to energy trading, more than 500+ team members are dedicated to create a greener future fueled with nothing but renewable energy!




Your role

As Virtual Data Coordinator you will be responsible for designing Eurowind‚Äôs drone strategy and doing the daily drone operation. Your main responsibilities include:




Selection/design of industrial drone for use in: Mapping/3D Surveys, Photovoltaic Thermographic Inspections, Wind Turbine inspections, Agricultural, Marketing Pictures and Video.
Cooperation with different departments and building reports.
Establishing setup for automated inspection flights in parks globally.
Being responsible for hardware and data collection via CCTV in parks globally.




The role combines your inner explorer with your fascination of data and takes a certain accuracy and immersion. More specifically, the tasks include:




Daily drone operation and maintenance with safety and compliance.
Surveying of land, and conversion to scalable maps.
Ensuring that data collection is automated, repeatable and directly integrated into the GIS structure.
PV inspections and optimization using drone‚Äôs normal and thermal pictures.
Organizing, managing and reporting on data in a coherent manner.
Preparation of documentation for analysis on a group level.
Assistance in regards to agricultural drones ‚Äì both aerial and on ground level.

Cooperating with data analyst regarding Machine Learning / AI on the drone/camera data




Your profile

To succeed in this role, you must demonstrate your tech skills and be capable of programming the drone so it will produce insightful data at every flight. We imagine that you have a technical background and can agree on the following:




You are educated as Software Engineer, Automation Engineer, Land Surveyor, Drone Pilot/Drone Operator, Geographer, Cartographer or similar.
You are a tech ‚Äúnerd‚Äù with an unquestionable interest in technical data and automatation.
You are organized and good at adapting to the workflow.
You are good at communicating with colleagues and stakeholders and have a proactive approach.




Renewable energy is our future. And so are our people!

At Eurowind Energy we do our best to create a culture where everyone is valued and feels at home. You will notice this in your everyday work life, where you have the freedom to speak up and where your voice does mean something to us. We know that when you grow, we grow. Therefore, we strive to support you in what you think is right and in your personal and professional development. We offer you an exciting job in an energetic and international environment. And we promise you: the wind is never standing still.




Did we capture your attention?

Great! If you see yourself in this role, do not hesitate to apply for the position. Please use the link below.




Should you have any questions before applying, please feel free to contact Mette Birk, Manager Operational Development, on mbs@ewe.dk.




Developing, operating and managing wind and solar parks is not just pure business for us. It is a way to view the world. And with this worldview comes a genuine ambition to be one of the leading developers in Europe. Because creating a future run entirely on green energy matters to us.




We manage our own portfolio of projects and at the same time, we perform technical and financial management of projects. We have throughout many years experienced sustained economic growth in the number of developed projects and companies in management. And we continue to expect this. Simply because it is in our nature to keep developing ‚Äì projects, companies and our people.




Read more about Eurowind Energy on our website or LinkedIn.




Application deadline: 15. September 2024

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We seek a driven Data Engineer to join us as the 5th team member of Subsets and help us advance toward our vision of redefining Customer Relationship Management (CRM). As the fifth employee, you will be at the heart of our data operations and a core team member. This role offers an opportunity to shape the data infrastructure and directly influence product development at Subsets. You will collaborate with our software engineers and data scientists to build a scalable data infrastructure that powers our AI-driven platform.

At Subsets, we are developing the future of AI-driven Retention Automation for subscription media companies. To explain this in simple terms, consider the latest subscription you have held personally (news, streaming, etc.). The communication you have received as a subscriber was probably either non-existent, impersonal, not fitting your preferences, or not engaging. We are building Subsets to rethink this experience and simultaneously increase subscribers' lifetime.

We are a small team backed by leading VCs, such as Y Combinator, and our customers include some of the largest subscription businesses in the world, such as Daily Mail (UK) and The Athletic (US). As a data engineer at Subsets, you will work directly with our customers' data and have the opportunity to shape and impact the product experience.

In this role, you will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Design, develop, and manage our scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Monitor and optimize our data pipelines (we are moving a lot of data!).
Work in a small, high-performing team where you will influence the product.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.


You may be a good fit if you have


A background in data engineering.
Hands-on experience in SQL, dbt and BigQuery, postgreSQL, or similar.
Have prior experience building ETL pipelines.
Experience working with Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or similar.
Experience working with technologies such as Docker, Terraform, Python, or similar.
The ability to work effectively in a startup environment where things change fast and are sometimes loosely defined.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary list of attributes. If none of these apply to you, but you believe you can contribute to Subsets, please reach out.


Benefits


Competitive salary
A stake in Subsets‚Äô success (equity)
A flexible work environment with frequent social activities
Great Lunch (and breakfast)


Applying


Send your resume and LinkedIn profile
Typically, we will meet three times: 1) for an introductory coffee in our CPH office, 2) for an in-depth technical interview, and 3) to discuss our offer.
Note: Subsets does not accept fully remote applications. We value flexibility, but we prioritize working together from our Copenhagen office most of the time.


For more information or questions please contact us at hiring@subsets.com

Title: Process Analytics Technology (PAT) expert
Description:
Are you a Process Analytics Technology (PAT) expert looking to elevate your career with a dynamic and innovative company? This opportunity could be just for you!




Position Overview:

We are on the hunt for a talented and experienced PAT Expert to support our client's cutting-edge projects. This role demands a high level of technical proficiency and strategic thinking to optimize and enhance process analytics technologies.




Key Responsibilities:

Utilize your in-depth knowledge of SQL clustering within the PAT framework to improve system performance and reliability.
Make informed decisions on network segregation and WLAN configurations to ensure robust and secure network infrastructures.
Provide comprehensive support and strategic insights, leveraging your broad expertise in PAT to drive continuous improvement and innovation.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Technical Mastery: Extensive experience and understanding of SQL clustering within the PAT context.
Strategic Thinker: Proven ability to make critical decisions regarding network segregation and WLAN deployment.
Versatile Expert: Broad knowledge and practical experience in PAT, enabling you to offer valuable guidance and support.




How to Apply:

If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team that values expertise, innovation, and success.

We are on the hunt for a talented and experienced PAT Expert to support our client's cutting-edge projects. This role demands a high level of technical proficiency and strategic thinking to optimize and enhance process analytics technologies.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best ‚Äì we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day have ownership within the company
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior Data Analytics Engineer
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights?

Join us with your outstanding business intelligence and process mining skills and make an impact within our Procure to Pay process team!

Please note the work location is Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Create visualisation dashboards in PowerBI for end users to quickly identify areas for further investigation.
Create new reports by handling the full process of identifying data needed, connecting to data sources through Power BI Gateway, structuring data for modelling and building data model in Power BI
Maintain and improve existing reports, driving reporting standardisation and definitions alignment.
Drive automation of both existing and new reports
Perform maintenance, documentation, optimisation & decommissioning of reports.
Participate in projects and workgroups, requiring knowledge of data foundation and Business Intelligence (BI)
Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
Stakeholder management of Global Process Owner, IT & others




Play your part in our team succeeding

Business Processes & Information is part of Business Service Operations. Our responsibilities cover global process ownership of finance transactional and HR processes as well as process support for controlling, training and project portfolio. Our main mission is to develop, maintain and optimise efficient and effective standardised processes and bridge business needs with IT solutions.

The Procure to Pay (P2P) business process team is tasked with establishing a robust reporting framework to enhance decision-making and performance management within our Shared Service Centers. With a focus on process optimization and system integration, we aim to leverage specialized expertise and adopt an end-to-end (E2E) perspective. Your role within the team will be pivotal, as you contribute to defining and facilitating the delivery of reporting needs while actively engaging in projects that demand Business Intelligence proficiency.

Do you have what it takes?





3+ years of experience working with data modelling, data governance and data visualization for decision making.
Advance experience with PowerBI, Power Query (M Query) and DAX (experience with PowerApps / Synapse SQL desired but not essential)
Experience of Process Mining, preferably Celonis
Experience working with SAP HANA Views and COUPA system would have an added advantage.
Excellent communication skills and ability to challenge stakeholders to deliver effective outcomes.
Excellent Presentation skills and experience in performing user training.
Continuous improvement knowledge and mindset
Ability to work with global teams spanning different time zones.




Please note that shortlisted candidates will be required to complete tests and assessments to demonstrate their advanced Power BI skills.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We‚Äôre democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels‚Äîa privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that‚Äôs not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We‚Äôve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

We are looking for a data-savvy analytics engineer to join our BI team and aid us in developing Veo‚Äôs analytical platform, supplying the business with data and insights to make better decisions.

You are enthusiastic about data, emphasizing data warehousing and advanced analytics. You also enjoy doing deep-dive analyses and collaborating with business users and analysts to discover new critical insights.

Key Responsibilities And Tasks


Develop, maintain, and expand our data warehouse and analytical platform through dbt.
Collaborate with subject matter experts across the business to interpret and model data for company-wide usage.
Build dashboards and create one-off reports and deep dives.
Support self-service initiatives and deep-dive analyses.


Experience And Skills


Expert in data modeling and modern data warehousing.
Proven experience with SQL and dbt.
Work experience within data analytics, data engineering, or BI.
Natural curiosity and ability to understand many different business areas.
Comprehensive analytical mindset.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Nice To Have


Experience with BigQuery and GCP.
Experience with BI tools like Looker, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Good understanding of data visualization best practices.
Experience with Git and CI/CD.
Experience with Python or another programming language.


We are a small, diverse team with a big impact. We support all parts of the business - from sales and shipping to product engagement and streaming diagnostics - with curated data, self-service BI, and deep-dive analyses through our modern data stack. Teamwork is key, internally and externally, as we work on consolidating data from all the widely different business areas based under Veo HQ‚Äôs roof, making for some truly remarkable cross-functional meetings and collaborative insights!

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology ‚Äì with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
The Company You‚Äôll Join

Carta is a platform that helps people manage equity, build businesses, and invest in the companies of tomorrow. Our mission is to unlock the power of equity ownership for more people in more places.

Carta is trusted by more than 40,000 companies and over two million people in nearly 160 countries to manage cap tables, compensation, and valuations. Carta also supports nearly 7,000 funds and SPVs, and represents nearly $130B in assets under administration. Carta's tender offer solutions have returned $14B to shareholders in secondary transactions. Today, Carta‚Äôs platform manages nearly three trillion dollars in equity globally.

For more information about our offices and culture, check out our Carta careers page.

The Team You‚Äôll Work With

You‚Äôll be joining our Data Team as an Analytics Engineer. Data is the backbone of our business. Our mission is to enable data-driven decisions across Carta by collecting accurate data, building scalable infrastructure and delivering advanced analytics. We believe in building a strong data foundation to ensure data quality and to promote self-service analytics across the company. We partner closely with Cartans across the company, especially product and commercial teams. We constantly think about how we can improve and grow.

Our analytics function is about 3 years old and we‚Äôre a small bunch, so this will be a role with a wide range of responsibilities: from building data models, discussions on metric definitions, building key dashboards for the company, among others. Without any specialized data analysts within the company, around 90% of our Looker content is built by business users, incl. dashboards used for company-wide reporting.

The Problems You‚Äôll Solve


Collaborating with our different departments to provide them with clean, tested and well-documented data ready for analysis with dbt
Helping drive a change in usage of data by uncovering insights and presenting them to a wide range of stakeholders
Sharing knowledge and best practices with a growing data community across Carta
Optimizing operational processes by providing the necessary data for automation
Iterate and improve our analytics infrastructure to ensure we‚Äôre utilizing the best tools for the job and provide reliable data in a scalable way
Building and maintaining a few key dashboards that show the state of business with our key metrics
Shaping the role and evolving the data story of Carta ‚Äì our tooling, culture and way of doing work!


About You

These are the skills and experience we‚Äôre looking for. Not having any or all of these experiences shouldn't stop you from applying. We‚Äôre looking for the right problem-solving mindset and value diversity. Beyond formal training we care about finding someone who can quickly pick up the necessary technical skills.

Our Ideal Candidate


1-3 years of experience in an Analytics role, preferably in a strong growth environment
Track record of close collaboration with business users to understand and fulfill their analytics needs
Experience with any data visualization tool and any SQL flavor.
Able to communicate complex analytical problems clearly and concisely
Experience with dbt, Looker, Snowflake, Fivetran, and Census
Experience with git and the command line


Bonus Points For


Track record of driving discussions to define metrics and dimensions
Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics needs in a notebook setting (e.g. Jupyter, Hex, Deepnote)
Understanding of SaaS metrics


Don‚Äôt worry about being a 100% fit. If this sounds like an interesting opportunity to you and you think it could work, let‚Äôs chat.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, please connect with the recruiter via email. As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.

Important Security Notice for Candidates

Our company has been targeted by individuals creating fake domains similar to ours to scam prospects and candidates. Please note that all official communications from us will come from an @carta.com domain. Be cautious of any requests for sensitive information or payments outside of our official channels. For more information about this type of scam, please review the guidelines provided by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). If you encounter any suspicious activity, please report it immediately to recruiting-systems@carta.com.

Awards and Acknowledgements

Companies and funds like Tribe and Pipe build their businesses on Carta. The company has been included on the Forbes World‚Äôs Best Cloud Companies, Fast Company's Most Innovative list, and Inc.‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Private Companies. We‚Äôve also been recognized as a 2023 Built In Best Place to Work in the U.S., a Muse VIBE Award winner in the Vacation and Time Off category and certified as a Great Place to Work.

Interested in data privacy? Check out our policies on Privacy and CA Candidate Privacy.

For more information about this type of scam, please review the guidelines provided by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). If you encounter any suspicious activity, please report it immediately to recruiting-systems@carta.com.

Awards and Acknowledgements

Companies and funds like Tribe and Pipe build their businesses on Carta. The company has been included on the Forbes World‚Äôs Best Cloud Companies, Fast Company's Most Innovative list, and Inc.‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Private Companies. We‚Äôve also been recognized as a 2023 Built In Best Place to Work in the U.S., a Muse VIBE Award winner in the Vacation and Time Off category and certified as a Great Place to Work.

Interested in data privacy? Check out our policies on Privacy and CA Candidate Privacy.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I Arbejdernes Landsbank fokuserer vi p√• at blive endnu mere datadreven, s√• data let kommer ud at leve og giver v√¶rdi for os og kunderne. Har du motivation for at l√¶re og udvikle dig i en voksende dataafdeling? S√• er jobbet som Data Engineer noget for dig.




Jobbet

Som Data Engineer i Dataplatform f√•r du en central rolle i udviklingen og vedligeholdelsen af vores eksisterende dataplatform. Vi har f√•et vores f√∏rste erfaringer med dataarbejde i skyen, og skal videre med udviklingen. Teamet er ansvarligt for vores nuv√¶rende dataplatform (placeret b√•de on-premise og i en Azure cloud), samt at drive og vedligeholde vores SAS-driftsetup.




Dine prim√¶re arbejdsopgaver vil derfor v√¶re:

Vedligeholdelse af data p√• SQL-servere (prim√¶rt Azure)
Optimering og strukturering af data p√• Azure
Datamigrering fra on-prem til Cloud
Drift og sparring til l√∏sninger ift. anvendelse og strukturering af data
Dokumentation af vores platform
Datasparringspartner i projekter




Din profil

Der er mange veje ind til jobbet. Vi forventer, at du er serviceorienteret, har stor interesse for data, samt har lyst til at udfordre nuv√¶rende m√•der at g√∏re tingene p√•. Derudover skal du have lyst til at l√¶re vores eksisterende dataplatform at kende, og tage ansvar for dens anvendelse.

Vi forestiller os, at du gerne har;




Erfaring med SAS
Erfaring med Microsoft SQL
Erfaring i udviklingen af MSSQL Views og Stored Procedures
Erfaring med at arbejde i Azure DevOps




Kendskab til BEC-samarbejdet og bank er kun en fordel. Det ogs√• en fordel hvis du kender andre kodesprog herunder Python eller har arbejdet med snowflake eller Databricks.

Vi forventer desuden at du har gode samarbejds- og kommunikationsevner, da v√¶rdien af data skabes sammen med andre. Derudover forventer vi, at du kan arbejde selvst√¶ndigt og struktureret. Det er et krav, at du behersker dansk i skrift og tale.




Dataplatform

Vi v√¶rds√¶tter din karriereudvikling og tilbyder adgang til en bred vifte af l√¶ringsressourcer. Som en del af vores team vil du have mulighed for at udvikle dine f√¶rdigheder og vokse professionelt i et milj√∏, der st√∏tter innovation og personlig udvikling.

Teamet best√•r af 7 Data Engineers og er en del af bankens Data og Modeller afdeling, som rummer over 30 dataentusiaster. Vi er kendetegnet ved godt samarbejde og sparring i hverdagen. Vi tager tid til f√¶lles opgaveafklaring og opgavem√∏der, har retrospektiv med fokus p√• teaml√¶ring, samt har interne demo og review med fokus at kunne fordybe sig i detaljerne.




Teamet er centralt beliggende i Panoptikonbygningen, Baneg√•rdspladsen 1 ‚Äì lige overfor Tivoli og 2 min. gang fra K√∏benhavns Hovedbaneg√•rd. Der ogs√• mulighed for lejlighedsvis at arbejde hjemmefra. Fra 2025 sidder vi alle samlet i vores helt nye hovedkontor p√• Sluseholmen.




Vi tilbyder en attraktiv arbejdsplads

I Arbejdernes Landsbank bliver du del af en kultur, hvor st√¶rke v√¶rdier som ordentlighed, f√¶llesskab og √•benhed er i fokus. Derudover kan du se frem til at blive del af:

En arbejdsplads hvor arbejdsgl√¶den og medarbejdertilfredsheden er blandt de h√∏jeste i sektoren
En arbejdsplads, som er rangeret #3 ud af Danmarks 25 st√∏rste pengeinstitutter m√•lt p√• det bedste image som arbejdsplads i 2023
En bank som 15 √•r i tr√¶k er k√•ret til danskernes foretrukne bank
En flad organisationsstruktur med hurtige beslutningsprocesser
En v√¶kstorienteret organisation, hvor der er rig mulighed for at udvikle sig b√•de fagligt og personligt




Du f√•r desuden en lang r√¶kke medarbejdergoder, som bl.a. omfatter sundhedsforsikring, tandforsikring og ekstra ferietill√¶g.




Er du interesseret?

Hvis du gerne vil have mere information om stillingen, kan du ringe til leder af Dataplatform Mattias Westergaard Clausen p√• tlf. nr. 2370 1741 eller sende en mail til mawc@al-bank.dk.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ans√∏gning - deadline er den 8. september.

Title: Data Engineer - Metals Trading Desk
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Main Purpose:We are seeking an experienced data engineer to join our team and collaborate directly with our data scientists in support of our Metals and Minerals trading and operating teams. The successful candidate will be responsible for building and maintaining time-critical data integration pipelines and designing appropriate data models (both with external and internal data). They will also contribute to the automation of processes on the trading desk and develop web applications, while working closely with stakeholders across business lines and technology. This presents an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced commercial environment and play a pivotal role in a real-time, data-driven trading ecosystem.Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities:
5+ years of experience with Python and SQL.
Proficiency with AWS data stack (S3, Redshift, Glue, Lambda). AWS certifications are a plus.
Experience building and maintaining time-critical data integration pipelines (ETL/ELT).
Strong data modelling skills.
Web application development experience.
Master's degree in computer science or a related subject.
Experience with enterprise-scale data systems.
Experience in a trading environment (physical or paper) is highly desirable.
Experience in logistics and optimization is a plus.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain Python and SQL scripts for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT).
Utilize AWS data stack, including S3, Redshift, Glue, and Lambda, to build and maintain data pipelines.
Design and implement data models for various internal and external datasets.
Contribute to the automation of trading desk processes.
Develop web applications to support trading operations and analytics.
Acquire a deep understanding of technical projects on the trading desk to better serve commercial needs.
Collaborate and communicate effectively with stakeholders across different business lines and technology.¬†

Competencies:

Ability to communicate effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders across business lines and technology
Understanding and experience implementing software and data engineering best practices
Ability to solve problems under pressure
Ability to effectively prioritise tasks of high importance
Key Relationships and Department Overview:

Key Relationships and Department Overview

The Data Science and Engineering team at Trafigura conducts research, develops advanced analytics solutions, and delivers data services to support the trading business and various commercial operations.
Trafigura's Metals and Minerals teams handle both physical and derivative portfolios, relying heavily on data, analysis, and process automation. They seek a candidate who can gain a deep understanding of their business and ultimately assume responsibility for a range of technical tasks on the desk.
Day-to-day management will be provided by Traders and Analysts, while the Data Science and Engineering team offers technical guidance and supplementary engineering and analytics support as needed.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 2 - 10 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Intern - Data Engineer / Product Owner for Learning Platform
Description:
About Us

Factorise is a pre-seed stage AI Fintech startup.

We are an innovative fintech startup on a mission to democratize investment knowledge and tools through our AI-powered chatbot, learning platform, and interactive community. We blend cutting-edge technology with deep industry insights to empower investors of all levels. You will primarily work on our learning platform focused on delivering comprehensive financial education through a multidisciplinary cross silo approach. Our mission is to equip learners with the tools and knowledge needed to navigate the complexities of the financial world. One of our features is leveraging insights from various fields such as physics, biology, sociology, and more. This means enabling the user to acces mental models and knowledge across disciplines with the purpose of upgrading investment strategies, learning and action.

Our Progress

We have achieved significant milestones, including our chatbot is live for internal test use and demo investor purpose both locally through Docker and in a cloud solution. We've built an AWS cloud setup with the following components: Backend: NestJS microservices on AWS Fargate. Frontend: Next.js on AWS Amplify. Message Broker: RabbitMQ on Amazon MQ. Database: MongoDB. API Gateway: AWS API Gateway. Our ML/AI is integrated both in the cloud and locally same as our RAG system. We've enriched our chatbot capabilities and carried out comprehensive API development. Our product designs are complete for some aspects and being further developed on other features, and we are conducting innovative R&D to transform investment knowledge. We've engaged in extensive user research, userbility testing, competitor analysis, product positioning and built a strong and motivated team, and established early industry partnerships.

We have a demand driven approach to pre-Product-Market-Fit (pre-PMF) phase. We have investor meetings scheduled and are currently updating business and project management documentation in addition to integration of core product features.

As we are now ramping up our product development for the learning platform we need a dedicated engineer and product owner intern to help with both data aquisition and product development.

Key Responsibilities

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented person. This role will involve working closely with our CEO and engineering team to help define and develop an investment education product that is built on a novel approach and tech.

Data Acquisition And Integration


Source and acquire data from various repositories, databases, APIs, and web sources.
Develop and maintain data pipelines to ensure smooth extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data into our storage solutions.
Implement data compliant techniques and collaborations to gather data where APIs are unavailable, ensuring data is clean, structured, and ready for use.


Product Development Support


Collaborate with the CEO to define the product's data structure and how collected data and knowledge will be organized within the learning platform.
Assist in developing new models and strategies for financial learning, incorporating principles from various disciplines such as physics, biology, sociology, and more.
Work with the engineering team to ensure that the data infrastructure supports the platform‚Äôs learning models and content delivery.


Documentation And Communication


Document the data acquisition processes and the integration methods used to ensure replicability and scalability.
Communicate effectively with the team to ensure that data needs and product requirements are clearly understood and met.


Technical Innovation


Explore and implement innovative data solutions that align with the CEO's vision for new ways of learning, prediction, and strategizing in financial education.
Contribute to the design of data-driven tools and models that enhance the user learning experience.


Qualifications

Educational Background:


Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Physics, Mathematics, Data Science, Financial Modeling, Data Engineering, or a related field.


Technical Skills


Experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL, or R.
Familiarity with ETL tools and processes, and experience in data aquisition
Knowledge of APIs, data integration techniques, and working with SQL/NoSQL databases.
Understanding of data warehousing and cloud-based data storage solutions (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).


Preferred Qualifications


Using reasoning from first principles - we will teach you this approach to problem solving
Understanding of financial models and principles, even if you lack direct finance experience.
Exposure to machine learning models or algorithms is a plus.
Ability to handle large datasets and work with unstructured data.


Personal Attributes


You need to be a self starter, that can keep motivation and pace in a remote setup
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with a cross-functional team.
Highly motivated and driven to contribute to a dynamic and innovative learning platform.


About You

You can be a student, more experienced and in between projects, and/or wanting in on an exciting opportunity, while you are working your regular job.

It‚Äôs crucial that you have the mindset of a problem solver and are excited about contributing in a startup setting. You need to be able to work remote and independently between team collaborations.

We look at your competences and personality. What matters is your contributions to the mission and ability to work with the CEO and team.

The Team

The team will support you with resources, learning and experience. There will be room for you to develop and grow.

The team have distinct results, experience and achievements in AI, Cloud, Learning and Software Development. This includes technology leadership, learning, knowledge production, education, user centricity and visionary leadership. In addition to a funding track-record and project management optmization.

We are part of the Copenhagen Fintech Community and varoius other networks. You have the opportunity to leverage network resources and meet with a variety of entrepreneurial people.

Check out my LinkedIn profile and connect or follow for more: www.linkedin.com/in/peter-n√∏rgaard-04773167.

What We Offer


Hands-on experience in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
Opportunity to work on a unique product that blends financial education with multidisciplinary learning approaches.
Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals in the fields of data engineering, financial modeling, and product development.
Potential for a full-time role, if funded and you deliver results, upon successful completion of the internship.


How To Apply

If you are passionate about data & AI, eager to learn and create, and excited about the intersection of technology, education, and finance, we encourage you to apply.

Why Join Us?


Collaborate in a culture that values creativity and continuous learning.
Be a part of an innovative team aiming to change the investment domain.
Enjoy the flexibility of remote work.
Build your portfolio, get access to great use case, gain experience, create a network.
Improve your professional trajectory.
Hands-On Experience: Gain practical experience in a novel, complex and experimental startup environment.
Direct Mentorship: Work closely with the CEO and be involved in high-level strategic discussions.
Growth Opportunities: Opportunity to shape the digital narrative of an emerging fintech company.
You get the advantage to get in early in an AI startup. This means opportunity for you ‚Äì if you are excellent at the job.
Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy a flexible work schedule in a remote setup.


The job is unpaid and without equity for now, but when we get funded, you will have a chance to apply and negotiate for a paid position. You will need to sign an NDA.

We will make the contract for 3-6 months with a 14-day trial period. Hours a week will depend upon individual agreement, but there will be a lower limit, for you to be able to deliver the results needed.

Please send your resume and a portfolio showcasing your best projects.

We're excited to review your application and potentially welcome you to our team, where together we'll build something truly impactful in the investment space!

For more information or questions please contact us at hello@factorise-solutions.com
Show more

  • Communicate effectively with the team to ensure that data needs and product requirements are clearly understood and met.

Technical Innovation

  • Explore and implement innovative data solutions that align with the CEO's vision for new ways of learning, prediction, and strategizing in financial education.
  • Contribute to the design of data-driven tools and models that enhance the user learning experience.

Qualifications

Educational Background:

  • Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Physics, Mathematics, Data Science, Financial Modeling, Data Engineering, or a related field.

Technical Skills

  • Experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL, or R.
  • Familiarity with ETL tools and processes, and experience in data aquisition
  • Knowledge of APIs, data integration techniques, and working with SQL/NoSQL databases.
  • Understanding of data warehousing and cloud-based data storage solutions (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Using reasoning from first principles - we will teach you this approach to problem solving
  • Understanding of financial models and principles, even if you lack direct finance experience.
  • Exposure to machine learning models or algorithms is a plus.
  • Ability to handle large datasets and work with unstructured data.

Personal Attributes

  • You need to be a self starter, that can keep motivation and pace in a remote setup
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with a cross-functional team.
  • Highly motivated and driven to contribute to a dynamic and innovative learning platform.

About You

You can be a student, more experienced and in between projects, and/or wanting in on an exciting opportunity, while you are working your regular job.

It‚Äôs crucial that you have the mindset of a problem solver and are excited about contributing in a startup setting. You need to be able to work remote and independently between team collaborations.

We look at your competences and personality. What matters is your contributions to the mission and ability to work with the CEO and team.

The Team

The team will support you with resources, learning and experience. There will be room for you to develop and grow.

The team have distinct results, experience and achievements in AI, Cloud, Learning and Software Development. This includes technology leadership, learning, knowledge production, education, user centricity and visionary leadership. In addition to a funding track-record and project management optmization.

We are part of the Copenhagen Fintech Community and varoius other networks. You have the opportunity to leverage network resources and meet with a variety of entrepreneurial people.

Check out my LinkedIn profile and connect or follow for more: www.linkedin.com/in/peter-n√∏rgaard-04773167.

What We Offer

  • Hands-on experience in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
  • Opportunity to work on a unique product that blends financial education with multidisciplinary learning approaches.
  • Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals in the fields of data engineering, financial modeling, and product development.
  • Potential for a full-time role, if funded and you deliver results, upon successful completion of the internship.

How To Apply

If you are passionate about data & AI, eager to learn and create, and excited about the intersection of technology, education, and finance, we encourage you to apply.

Why Join Us?

  • Collaborate in a culture that values creativity and continuous learning.
  • Be a part of an innovative team aiming to change the investment domain.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of remote work.
  • Build your portfolio, get access to great use case, gain experience, create a network.
  • Improve your professional trajectory.
  • Hands-On Experience: Gain practical experience in a novel, complex and experimental startup environment.
  • Direct Mentorship: Work closely with the CEO and be involved in high-level strategic discussions.
  • Growth Opportunities: Opportunity to shape the digital narrative of an emerging fintech company.
  • You get the advantage to get in early in an AI startup. This means opportunity for you ‚Äì if you are excellent at the job.
  • Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy a flexible work schedule in a remote setup.

The job is unpaid and without equity for now, but when we get funded, you will have a chance to apply and negotiate for a paid position. You will need to sign an NDA.

We will make the contract for 3-6 months with a 14-day trial period. Hours a week will depend upon individual agreement, but there will be a lower limit, for you to be able to deliver the results needed.

Please send your resume and a portfolio showcasing your best projects.

We're excited to review your application and potentially welcome you to our team, where together we'll build something truly impactful in the investment space!

For more information or questions please contact us at hello@factorise-solutions.com

Title: Senior Specialist Membership Performance Analytics & Insights
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Ready to transform LEGO¬Æ Membership's performance management, driving data-driven decisions and joining a value-driven company in a global role? Then look no further!

Join us for an exciting career as ‚ÄúSenior Membership Performance Specialist‚Äù as part of the newly established Membership & Personalisation team within LEGO¬Æ Market & Channels Global Marketing.

Please note the work location is either Copenhagen or Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Lead performance management projects for Membership & Personalization, by supporting the creation of reporting frameworks, helping to define relevant performance and business metrics, and by supporting performance improvement initiatives across all cross-functional reporting & analytics teams
Support the delivery of high-quality reports on a weekly and monthly basis, covering the latest performance insights on our member base to drive data-driven decision making, in close partnership with reporting, analytics and finance teams across the business
Support the briefing and/or creation of self-service dashboards, to facilitate speed and transparency in performance updates
Support the delivery of member, channel and campaign insights, levering all available data and tools to showcase business opportunities, working closely with Membership Acquisition & Activation, and Membership Expansion teams
Support the (annual) forecasting & target setting process of Membership & Personalization, in conjunction with the LEGO Group‚Äôs OKR and portfolio planning process, and in close partnership with Finance, CRM Hub, Membership operations, M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Development), Digital and Supply chain
Support the P&L management process of Membership & Personalization, by investigating trends by and creating insights on what actions will improve top and bottom line results, in close partnership with Finance
Partner with the Membership Operations team on member feedback & satisfaction tracking and reporting, and help synthesize into overall membership performance
Contribute to creating a performance culture by helping to define the standard-of-excellence in performance management, and by actively encouraging knowledge-sharing across performance management teams in M&C, PMD and LEGO Retail
Help driving an agile way-of-working model, ensuring quality, flexibility and speed in how business questions are tackled




Play your part in our team succeeding

This position will be responsible for leading performance management projects and actively contributes to planning & target setting within Membership & Personalization. Collaborating with key cross functional teams across M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Department), and Digital, helping us leverage data to achieve our membership and personalization goals effectively and efficiently.

You will report directly to the Senior Director Performance, Development & Decisioning.

Do you have what it takes?





Strong experience in performance management, insights, and/or analytics, with proficiency in Adobe Analytics or similar tools, SQL-based databases, and Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience in SQL and Excel is a must
Strong structured problem solving & communication capabilities
Excels at creating clear, concise and actionable insights from multiple data sources to answer business questions
Proficient understanding of personalization, CRM, and loyalty programs
An enthusiastic, positive approach and determination to overcome obstacles; can-do attitude, focused on quality, efficiency, and operational excellence.
Open, collaborative communication style, with experience working across cultures and time zones to build connected, sustainable relationships regardless of organizational structure




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Student Worker Strategic Data Office
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., our mission is simple: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. With 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we‚Äôre making a significant impact. Working towards our vision provides endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes globally.

We are seeking a talented and versatile student worker to join our team as a Data Science, Data Analytics, and Business Development Specialist. This role is ideal for a student with a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and a keen interest in business development.

Due to summer vacations, we will start reviewing candidates in August.

Key Responsibilities


Perform statistical analysis and create visualizations using Python, R, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Develop machine learning models and apply statistical methods to solve business problems.
Clean, process, and analyze large datasets; manage data warehousing and ETL processes.
Write efficient, scalable code in Python, R, SQL, and possibly Java or Scala.
Build and deploy models using TensorFlow, Keras, and Scikit-learn.
Utilize business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) and manage code with Git.
Understand business operations, translate data insights into strategies, and develop business initiatives.
Conduct market research and analyze competitive landscapes.
Present data insights to non-technical stakeholders and create business reports.
Plan, execute, and monitor projects; build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR

For you to have success in the position as our Student Worker, we imagine you have the following:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience in data science, data analytics, or business development is a plus. Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, data visualization, programming, and machine learning.
Commitment to continuous learning and ethical standards.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to approach problems methodically and develop data-driven solutions.
Adaptability to new technologies, tools, and business environments.
Good interpersonal skills for collaborative teamwork and effective engagement with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Strategic thinking about business opportunities and challenges.
High ethical standards and integrity in all business and data-related activities, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.


The working hours will be around 15 hours/week and be flexibly scheduled around your studies. There is also flexibility in additional hours and hours after 4pm as one colleague is based in Boston. You should expect to work in the office at our headquarters in Energivej.

We collaborate - it¬¥s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year‚Äôs innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia ‚Äì and we‚Äôre growing all the time. So, if you‚Äôre looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: System Engineer
Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Looking for a diverse position in a growing biotech company? Are you dedicated to cross functional engineering in a dynamic environment?




About us

Sophion Bioscience is a leading global life science company founded in 2000 by a group of electrophysiologists who were passionate about making patch clamping objectives independent of user skills.

We specialize in developing and manufacturing automated patch clamping and cell line solutions. With our complete technical, biological, and application support, we help our partners pioneer ion channel research and drug discovery within cardiology and neuroscience, among others. We take the voodoo out of patch clamping to provide faster, more accurate, and objective patch clamping results for our users.

Through the continued development of our QPatch Compact, QPatch, and Qube 384 platforms, we offer uncompromised data quality in a user-friendly environment, from assay setup to advanced data analysis.

Sophion is a team of over 100 members. We are headquartered in Denmark and have subsidiaries in the United States, Japan, and China.




What we are looking for:

System engineer with skills and interest to contribute and take leading part in diverse and broad aspects within development of high-tech lab instruments and a desire to work closely and in the middle of a group of other professionals like hardware and software engineers, biologists, physicists and end-users to create world class analytical solutions for biological applications within pharmaceutical research.




About the Role:

Our instruments are a succesfull combination of mechanics, electronics, fluidics, embedded and higher level software. As member of our team, you will contribute both to the development of future solutions for new products, as well as the continuous development of solutions for our current products on the market. As a system engineer you will take central part in making different components come together in the best possible manner and be key to help defining how individual components are developed while having an eye on the final product together with the product owner and project team.




We will be looking for candidates with interest, skills and personal drive to thrive in the cross-functional interface with both attention to detail and overall experience of the end-user. We imagine you find it natural to work in areas such as designing 3D mechanical parts, putting together various hardware components, do a bit of wiring/soldering as well as coding high level scripts on Pi/Arduino units as part of development towards the end product.




Through different combinations of co-teaching and relevant hands-on assignments, the onboarding process in Sophion will introduce you to the various key applications, technologies and challenges we are facing during daily work.




We can offer a relaxed but international atmosphere in a flat organization where processes are value-driven, decision paths are short and R&D developments usually enter a short turnaround cycle being quickly distributed to actual users which provides a good sense of ownership and satisfaction. Advanced, well-functioning and user-friendly systems is key for success and your contribution to the team will help our customers in pharmaceutical research throughout the world in fighting diseases and bringing new life saving medicine to the market.




Experience from the life science industry is a plus, but definitely not a must. An interest in working with cross-functional development is required.

The position is based in Ballerup and reports to the R&D Portfolio Manager




Main Responsibilities

Take active part in defining and driving development of new, innovative solutions for new products, and contribute to the development and maintenance of products in our current portfolio.
Interact with project and product managers to translate, formalize and prioritize market requirements into specific product requirements.
Collaborate closely with R&D teams within mechanics, electronics, hardware and software engineers as well as application specialists to define and develop solutions that match the needs of our customers.
Support incoming special needs from customers.
Play an important role as an agile team member to actively support the rest of the team where possible.




Key Qualifications

MSc. in engineering or a similar educational background.
Practical experience in development within one or more areas such as mechanics, fluidics or automation.
Practical test- and data driven approach to development.
Knowledge about modular design and integration into overall system architecture.
Interest in overall user experience for instrument operation.
Digestion of use cases and breaking them into relevant sub-components.
Interest in working in an environment of continuous development with changing priorities as part of an agile development framework.




Personal Qualities

Social skills and open minded towards working cross-functionally.
Thrive in working independently while being part of a team effort.
Take responsibility and pride in quality and deliverables.
A team player that works well in a dynamic environment and can have several activities ongoing at once and keep the overview.
Self-starter, highly self-driven and motivated work ethics.
Service minded, enthusiastic and enjoy solving complicated problems with a general technical flair and a ‚Äúcan do, will do‚Äù mindset.
Able to step in when colleagues need help, and able to ask for help when needed
Motivation to develop new, exciting, and innovative solutions to help scientists generate more data in the lab, faster.
A hands-on person who can thrive in a laboratory environment.
Good communication skills in English, both speaking and writing.




Apply now via LinkedIn




If you have any questions, please contact hiring manager:




Lasse Homann

Phone +45 30459880




Application deadline: As soon as possible




Apply now via LinkedIn
