Title: Azure Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an aspiring individual with a passion for Structuring & optimizing the design of cloud-based data solutions?

We are looking for you, who knows how to harness the power of data and how the right pipelines can support data-driven decisions in the organization.




We are a dynamic, growing IT team committed to innovation and excellence and we are looking for an Azure data Engineer to join our team.




As Azure Data Engineer, you‚Äôll play a critical role in designing and developing our data infrastructure driving technological advancements and playing a pivotal role in shaping the future structure.




Who is this growth company?

We are TP Aerospace! A fast-growing and dynamic company operating in the aviation industry. With headquarters in Copenhagen and eleven sites spanning from Orlando to Melbourne, we operate in a highly global environment where things are moving fast!




The opportunity:

We are looking for a driven Azure Data Engineer to develop, execute, and oversee our data infrastructure on the Azure platform. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in cloud computing and data engineering, as well as a strong interest in utilizing data to drive business insights.




In this position, you will collaborate closely with colleagues in DevOps, the Head of IT and stakeholders throughout the company to offer technical guidance on the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of all Azure-related products and services.




If you're enthusiastic about making a difference and ready to thrive in a challenging, ambitious and rewarding environment, the Green Team at TP Aerospace is the place for you.




The primary tasks:

Design, implement, and manage data solutions on Microsoft Azure.
Create and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
Develop and manage data storage solutions such as Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Lake Storage, and Azure Cosmos DB.
Ensure data integration and ETL processes are efficient and reliable.
Monitor and optimize data storage and data processing tasks.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues.




Qualifications:

We seek a team member who can identify with the description below:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, preferably with Azure.
Strong knowledge of data management and storage solutions on Azure.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and/or Scala.
Experience with data integration tools like Azure Data Factory.
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Azure Databricks and Apache Spark.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




It is an advantage if you have:

Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate certification.
Experience with machine learning and data analytics.
Knowledge of data security and compliance best practices.
Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI




Skills and Attributes:

Great at time management in a dynamic environment.
Results-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality output.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive "can-do" attitude.
Good communication skills and enjoy working in an international environment with diverse cultures.




How do team spirit and professional development sound?

We offer a highly vibrant and international work environment with colleagues from all over the world. We guarantee a steep learning curve that will foster your personal and professional development, and you will have the freedom and ability to influence your tasks and everyday work life in close cooperation with the team.




We take immense pride in the strong team spirit characterizing our global workforce. You will gain a solid group of engaged and dedicated colleagues who are great at what they do and enjoy doing it, and your contribution will be a key part of our success!




Don't hesitate to apply today!

Ready to take the next step? Grab a coffee and spend 10-15 minutes writing a short but motivated cover letter. Click "Apply" and upload this letter and your resume onto our recruiting platform. The deadline for applying is August 30th, so don't hesitate to start your application today!




Only applications received through the recruiting platform will be considered for the position. We will conduct interviews throughout the process and reserve the right to close the vacancy before the deadline if we find the right candidate.

Only applications received through the recruiting platform will be considered for the position. We will conduct interviews throughout the process and reserve the right to close the vacancy before the deadline if we find the right candidate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

YouLend is the preferred global embedded financing platform for many of the world's leading e-commerce sites, tech companies and payment services providers such as Amazon, eBay, Shopify, Mollie, Dojo, Paysafe, Just Eat Takeaway and Takepayments. Our software platform and APIs enable our partners to offer flexible financing products, in their desired branding, to their merchant base. With YouLend's AI-driven credit risk assessment solutions, more merchants and SMEs than ever can receive fast, flexible and affordable funding. We operate in 9+ geographies across the UK, EU and the US.

We believe that the future of financial services will be delivered by customer-oriented tech companies that embed financing in their customer journeys, and we are building the solutions that will power that future.

The Role:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Team. The person taking on this role will collaborate with stakeholders in other departments to understand and specify problems within the business. You will navigate our data, conduct transformations and provide insight and analysis. From there you will communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. You will also create new data assets (data models, dashboards, models) to serve recurring requests for information and insight.

Requirements


Quantitative educational background, particularly mathematical methods and statistics
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions and providing support to the business
Highly skilled in SQL and Python
Strong written & verbal communication skills, particularly in being able to translate detailed data work for non-technical stakeholders and drive towards impact for the business



Essential:


Previous experience in the financial services / lending
Experience working with dbt, Snowflake, Metabase and Tableau



Benefits

Why join YouLend?


Award-Winning Workplace: YouLend has been recognised as one of the "Best Places to Work 2024" by the Sunday Times for being a supportive, diverse, and rewarding workplace
Award-Winning Fintech: YouLend has been recognised as a "Top 250 Fintech Worldwide" company by CNBC



We offer comprehensive benefits package that includes:


Stock Options
Private Medical insurance via Vitality
EAP with Health Assured
Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Leave
Modern and sophisticated office space in Central London
Free Gym in office building in Holborn
Subsidised Lunch via Feedr
Deliveroo Allowance if working late in office
Monthly in office Masseuse
Team and Company Socials
Football Power League / Squash Club



Salary Range: ¬£55,000 - 85,000 + 20% annual bonus

At YouLend, we champion diversity and embrace equal opportunity employment practices. Our hiring, transfer, and promotion decisions are exclusively based on qualifications, merit, and business requirements, free from any discrimination based on race, gender, age, disability, religion, nationality, or any other protected basis under applicable law.

HTML:
About Us

YouLend is the preferred global embedded financing platform for many of the world's leading e-commerce sites, tech companies and payment services providers such as Amazon, eBay, Shopify, Mollie, Dojo, Paysafe, Just Eat Takeaway and Takepayments. Our software platform and APIs enable our partners to offer flexible financing products, in their desired branding, to their merchant base. With YouLend's AI-driven credit risk assessment solutions, more merchants and SMEs than ever can receive fast, flexible and affordable funding. We operate in 9+ geographies across the UK, EU and the US.

We believe that the future of financial services will be delivered by customer-oriented tech companies that embed financing in their customer journeys, and we are building the solutions that will power that future.

The Role:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Team. The person taking on this role will collaborate with stakeholders in other departments to understand and specify problems within the business. You will navigate our data, conduct transformations and provide insight and analysis. From there you will communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. You will also create new data assets (data models, dashboards, models) to serve recurring requests for information and insight.

Requirements

  • Quantitative educational background, particularly mathematical methods and statistics
  • Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions and providing support to the business
  • Highly skilled in SQL and Python
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills, particularly in being able to translate detailed data work for non-technical stakeholders and drive towards impact for the business


Essential:

  • Previous experience in the financial services / lending
  • Experience working with dbt, Snowflake, Metabase and Tableau


Benefits

Why join YouLend?

  • Award-Winning Workplace: YouLend has been recognised as one of the "Best Places to Work 2024" by the Sunday Times for being a supportive, diverse, and rewarding workplace
  • Award-Winning Fintech: YouLend has been recognised as a "Top 250 Fintech Worldwide" company by CNBC


We offer comprehensive benefits package that includes:

  • Stock Options
  • Private Medical insurance via Vitality
  • EAP with Health Assured
  • Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Leave
  • Modern and sophisticated office space in Central London
  • Free Gym in office building in Holborn
  • Subsidised Lunch via Feedr
  • Deliveroo Allowance if working late in office
  • Monthly in office Masseuse
  • Team and Company Socials
  • Football Power League / Squash Club


Salary Range: ¬£55,000 - 85,000 + 20% annual bonus

At YouLend, we champion diversity and embrace equal opportunity employment practices. Our hiring, transfer, and promotion decisions are exclusively based on qualifications, merit, and business requirements, free from any discrimination based on race, gender, age, disability, religion, nationality, or any other protected basis under applicable law.

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
The Insight Analyst will be a junior role; supporting Liberty and the Insights & Analytics team by providing actionable insight to help the business deliver an unparalleled customer experience, as well as driving improvement in key business metrics.




The successful candidate will be someone with excellent communication skills, engaging with stakeholders at all levels of the business. They will play an integral role in influencing both business and customer strategies through quantitative data analysis.




They will work closely with the Insights & Analytics Manager to develop key analytics strategies and approaches to improving processes within the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Communicate with stakeholders to capture requirements and identify key opportunities for improvement
Use analytical and storytelling skills, taking the business owners on a journey to better understand the customer
Ownership of regular and ad-hoc customer insight reports
Work closely with the Insights & Analyst Manager to deliver action orientated insights
Analysis of CRM campaigns across all marketing channels including the post campaign analysis to ensure ROI on activity
Continuously improve existing reporting methods within Liberty
Improve the efficiency of existing reporting methods using data visualisation and techniques in SQL, Microsoft Excel and BI
Help monitor customer data quality and ensure any issues are appropriately resolved or escalated with IT stakeholders.




Acting as a provider of insights and reporting, the successful candidate will show the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders across the business. They will show an interest in customer insights, product performance and the entire purchasing journey on the Liberty website and in the Flagship store. They will be willing to use new tools and approaches to insights.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Analysing data sets in Excel
Presenting results and key recommendations in Powerpoint (or equivalent tool)
SQL and data interrogation of data sets
Communication with stakeholders
E-commerce analytics experience




Desirables

Data Visualisation and BI (eg Power BI, Tableau, Pyramid Analytics)
Google Analytics
Retail and Customer Experience
Marketing campaign analysis
Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you‚Äôll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You‚Äôll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more.¬†




What you‚Äôll do
You‚Äôll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10‚Äôs of billions of data points per day!!)
You‚Äôll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps.¬†
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You‚Äôll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you‚Äôll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc







You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love.¬†You have confidence in the following:
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Creditsafe is looking for a dynamic and forward-thinking Data Analyst to join our Identity Resolution Team. This role is more than a job - it's an opportunity to dive headfirst into a world of transformative tech and impactful analysis. We are driven by the spirit of innovation and our passion for understanding people's needs. We thrive on using cutting-edge technologies such as Machine Learning and data-driven insights to understand our customers at a granular level.




WHO ARE WE?

At Creditsafe, we weave our core values of customer-obsession, trust, respect and the courage to be different into the very fabric of our culture. With these values, we‚Äôve fostered a culture of growth, innovation, well-being and success for the last 20 years at Creditsafe and created a legacy of successful career trajectories within our community of Creditsafers.




Powering business decisions for over 100,000 business across the world requires more than just the right tools. As a company, we don‚Äôt shy away from rolling up our sleeves to do everything possible to create a welcoming environment where every new talent is guided, supported and nurtured to grow and become a part of the culture.




With 25 offices across 14 countries, our geographically disperse community of colleagues are a testament to our inclusive and diverse culture that comes together to solve complex problems and learn from each other.




Twice featured in The Sunday Times list of ‚Äò100 Best Companies to Work,‚Äô our list of successful Creditsafers who‚Äôve created long-standing, strong career trajectories out of what started out as jobs, just keeps growing. We‚Äôre proud to be a part of a culture and a company where careers are made and where talent meet its true potential.




THE TEAM

Identity resolution is one of Creditsafe‚Äôs core teams, enabling our customers to match their customer and client lists against our extensive database of companies across many different countries. Currently built on a python, hadoop / hive and AWS tech stack, the product is constantly evolving and is currently going through a very exciting phase where we seek to streamline and improve our matching capabilities across the whole business.




JOB PROFILE

As our Data Analyst, you will use state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and sophisticated data analysis techniques to decode customer behaviours and translate them into actionable insights, along with analysing patterns in company data, cleansing and enhancing data quality, and devising new rules and methodologies for efficient data matching




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyse patterns in company data across various international markets
Interpret customer data to identify optimal strategies for enhancing our matching capabilities
Identify matching patterns and rules
Identify ways to cleanse and enhance the quality of existing and received data
Collaborate with the technical team to build and implement rules
Prepare comprehensive reports on the results of data analyses using PowerBI, Tableau or similar solution
Collaborate with other teams to identify opportunities for process and policy improvements.




The responsibilities detailed above are not exhaustive and you may be requested to take on additional responsibilities deemed as reasonable by their direct line manager.




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in a similar role.
Proven experience with data cleansing, data analysis and data presentation
Advanced knowledge of data processing and analysis tools and software.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.




BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Company Laptop supplied.
Bonus Scheme.
25 Days Annual Leave (plus bank holidays).
Hybrid working model.
Healthcare & Company Pension.
Cycle to work and Wellbeing Programme.
Global Company gatherings and events.
E-learning and excellent career progression opportunities.
Plus more that can be found on the benefits section on the Careers page, https://careers.creditsafe.com/gb.




Creditsafe is an equal opportunities employer that values diversity. Please contact Creditsafe if there is any support you need with your application.

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for consumer data?

Join us to define and drive positive changes to help us remain at the front edge of consumer engagement through an interconnected ecosystem of touchpoints!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities





Drives communication of our consumers‚Äô voice for CSE, Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) and the LEGO Group through provision of survey and contact analysis
Reviews consumer survey data, including voice and text comments, and creates insights and trend reporting
Produces Product Team reporting into focused areas of consumer insight, utilising CSE contact data in connection with other data sources
Builds consumer journey focused insights and reporting focused on solving issues and supporting improvement initiatives
Works with partner business teams to proactively define analytic questions, scopes of work and align on priorities, all the while challenging status quo beliefs through insights
Collaborate in cross-functional projects using data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimisation opportunities
Analyses performance from a well-rounded view, transforming raw data into measurable insights using data points from Quant and Qual platforms, working across all CSE‚Äôs channels/consumer touchpoints
Delivers results of analytical initiatives and insight activities to stakeholders, utilising presentation skills and storytelling to communicate and influence successfully




Play your part in our team succeeding

LEGO Consumer & Shopper Engagement (CSE) has the objective of putting the voice of the consumer at the heart of everything we do, providing the insights to drive data-based decision making at all levels.

We are looking for a Consumer Insights Analyst to bring their skills with data analysis, insights creation and communication to contribute to our growth and development. Our data comes from a wide range of interactions with consumers, from phone calls to chatbots to social media, and is evolving all the time. We have the vision to fully utilise this data to drive consumer-focused decision making across the business, and this position will play a key role in driving the realisation.

Do you have what it takes?





Advanced data analytics, modelling, and visualisation skills, including use of Power BI or Tableau and the delivery of this in-person and remotely
Shown experience delivering consumer focussed deep-dive reports with strong storytelling narratives via presentations that motivate change
Ability to utilise various data sources to synthesise insights
Experience working with databases, producing data analytics, reporting and dashboards to monitor and communicate performance metrics, including the automation of these
Excellent communication and partner management skills, including proactively defining questions, scope, and delivery
Ability to work both independently and in close collaboration with cross-functional project teams
Engagement and understanding of other business areas, data/insights sources, strategies, challenges
Experience with programming languages like SQL or Python would be advantageous




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

HTML:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for consumer data?

Join us to define and drive positive changes to help us remain at the front edge of consumer engagement through an interconnected ecosystem of touchpoints!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities



  • Drives communication of our consumers‚Äô voice for CSE, Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) and the LEGO Group through provision of survey and contact analysis
  • Reviews consumer survey data, including voice and text comments, and creates insights and trend reporting
  • Produces Product Team reporting into focused areas of consumer insight, utilising CSE contact data in connection with other data sources
  • Builds consumer journey focused insights and reporting focused on solving issues and supporting improvement initiatives
  • Works with partner business teams to proactively define analytic questions, scopes of work and align on priorities, all the while challenging status quo beliefs through insights
  • Collaborate in cross-functional projects using data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimisation opportunities
  • Analyses performance from a well-rounded view, transforming raw data into measurable insights using data points from Quant and Qual platforms, working across all CSE‚Äôs channels/consumer touchpoints
  • Delivers results of analytical initiatives and insight activities to stakeholders, utilising presentation skills and storytelling to communicate and influence successfully



Play your part in our team succeeding

LEGO Consumer & Shopper Engagement (CSE) has the objective of putting the voice of the consumer at the heart of everything we do, providing the insights to drive data-based decision making at all levels.

We are looking for a Consumer Insights Analyst to bring their skills with data analysis, insights creation and communication to contribute to our growth and development. Our data comes from a wide range of interactions with consumers, from phone calls to chatbots to social media, and is evolving all the time. We have the vision to fully utilise this data to drive consumer-focused decision making across the business, and this position will play a key role in driving the realisation.

Do you have what it takes?



  • Advanced data analytics, modelling, and visualisation skills, including use of Power BI or Tableau and the delivery of this in-person and remotely
  • Shown experience delivering consumer focussed deep-dive reports with strong storytelling narratives via presentations that motivate change
  • Ability to utilise various data sources to synthesise insights
  • Experience working with databases, producing data analytics, reporting and dashboards to monitor and communicate performance metrics, including the automation of these
  • Excellent communication and partner management skills, including proactively defining questions, scope, and delivery
  • Ability to work both independently and in close collaboration with cross-functional project teams
  • Engagement and understanding of other business areas, data/insights sources, strategies, challenges
  • Experience with programming languages like SQL or Python would be advantageous



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Title: Data Analysis
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.‚Äã




About the job you‚Äôre considering

‚Ä¢ Inputting to the T1POSx Balance Scorecard and producing relevant report.

- Updating T1POSx Balanced Scorecard

- Prepare T1POSx reports and analysis. e.g.: Tash needs for this month a report of all One Sat suppliers with their OTD.

- Facilitate T1POSx governance execution

- Monitor routine of performance with T1POSx colleagues: eg: ensure and guide people update ZEST_PO, NC declaration.




‚Ä¢ Data repository and reporting mapping.

- Map all SPOT systems and use of g-sheets. To record data for reporting use.

- Map all outputs (reports, presentations)




‚Ä¢ OES T1POS Masterplan management.

- Create tasks in the Masterplan

- Allocate ownership to the task.

- Track progress of the task.




‚Ä¢ SMP updates for Risk Management

- Create risks in SMP.

- Automate the generation of risks from SMP to ARM (in line with the agreed criteria for escalation)




‚Ä¢ Onsite assessment of key subcontractor Oerlikon

- Service provider to attend Oerlikon site in Barleben once per week until site closure varying day of attendance weekly.

- Tour shop floor and complete checklist as provided by ADS, looking at progress to plan and changes in environment.

- When NCs are raised by the supplier, the attendee shall verify the implementation of the containment and corrective action as requested by ADS.

- Prepare and deliver reports and debrief to ADS.




This role is based on site in Portsmouth - 5 days a week.




Your role

Skills and experience







‚Ä¢ In depth experience of SAP

‚Ä¢ In depth experience using an MRP/ERP tool

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills

‚Ä¢ Google workspace knowledge essential

‚Ä¢ Supplier management

‚Ä¢ Reporting to external and internal customers

‚Ä¢ Confident to communicate clearly to all stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Able to work in a demanding environment.

‚Ä¢ Project management







Don‚Äôt meet every single requirements? Studies have shown women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every requirement in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.‚Äã




You can bring your whole self to work. At Capgemini, stiving for equity, diversity and inclusion is part of everyday life, and will be part of your working reality. We have built an inclusive and welcoming environment, for everyone.




Your security clearance

To be successfully appointed to this role, it is a requirement to obtain Security Check (SC) clearance. ‚Äã




To obtain SC clearance, the successful applicant must have resided continuously within the United Kingdom for the last 5 years, along with other criteria and requirements.‚Äã




Throughout the recruitment process, you will be asked questions about your security clearance eligibility such as, but not limited to, country of residence and nationality.‚Äã




Some posts are restricted to sole UK Nationals for security reasons; therefore, you may be asked about your citizenship in the application process.‚Äã




What does ‚ÄòGet The Future You Want ‚Äò mean for you?

You will be encouraged to have a positive work-life balance. Our hybrid-first way of working means we embed hybrid working in all that we do and make flexible working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. All UK employees are eligible to request flexible working arrangements. You‚Äôd be joining an accredited Great Place to work for Wellbeing in 2023. Employee wellbeing is vitally important to us as an organisation. We see a healthy and happy workforce a critical component for us to achieve our organisational ambitions. ‚Äã




To help support wellbeing we have trained ‚ÄòMental Health Champions‚Äô across each of our business areas, and we have invested in wellbeing apps such as Thrive and Peppy. You will reimagine what‚Äôs possible: creating value for the world‚Äôs leading organisations through technology to build a sustainable, more inclusive future. You will work with a range of clients all with a unique set of business, technological and societal ambitions, which will make a real impact across the UK.




Why you should consider Capgemini

Growing clients‚Äô businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. But when you join Capgemini, you join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts. A powerful source of energy that drives us all to find new ways technology can help us reimagine what‚Äôs possible. It‚Äôs why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world‚Äôs leading businesses. And it‚Äôs how you‚Äôll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge and always pushing yourself to do better, you‚Äôll build the skills you want. And you‚Äôll use them to help our clients leverage technology to grow their business and give innovation that human touch the world needs. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is.




About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.‚Äã




‚Äã




Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com‚Äã




‚Äã




At Capgemini Engineering we value excellence, care, responsibility, dynamism and innovation. We offer a job with variation that leaves plenty of room for initiative and development. In fact, we are not just offering you a job, we‚Äôre inviting you to be part of our community where we will provide you trainings, tools & grounds for professional and personal growth. Each career experience is assorted by an attractive salary package.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Newcastle Upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Newcastle upon Tyne (2 days in office / 3 days from home)

Salary: up to ¬£40,000 (+ ¬£6,000 bonus)




NRG are seeking experienced Data Analysts to join our Client headquartered out of Newcastle upon Tyne. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organization that has recently modernised and invested heavily into its Business Intelligence platform.




Our client is a truly revolutionary, rapid growth high-tech financial services provider.




Reporting to the Data Lead, you will play a pivotal role in the team by developing organizational insights and empowering business leaders and managers with improved decision-making capabilities.




Job Duties:




Analysing behaviours, inputs, and outputs to recognize trends and deliver actionable insights for strategic planning and decision-making.
Developing and monitoring key performance indicators.
Producing accurate weekly and monthly reports.
Collaborating with senior stakeholders
Ensuring data is accurate, clean, and up-to-date.
Conducting market research and competitor analysis to support data-driven decisions




What we are looking for:




Proven experience in a analytical position producing key insights, visual and compelling reports / dashboards.
Experience with Visualisation tools such as Power BI
Capability in Business Intelligence, Modelling Data and Visualization
Stakeholder management
Excellent communication and team working skills




Desirables:




Fabric
Synapse




Benefits:




Excellent career progression opportunities
Hybrid working (2 office days per week)
Free parking




If you are interested in this role, please click ‚ÄòApply Now‚Äô and a member of the team will be in touch.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US:

Townhouse was created with a single goal: to disrupt and reinvent the global nail salon industry. We are the fastest growing beauty brand in the UK and are driven by a passionate and disruptive team in achieving our mission.

We've brought together a world class team from a wide range of industries. And as we're growing extremely fast, we need brilliant people (like you!) - to join us on our journey and help us deliver our goal.

ABOUT THE ROLE:



As a Junior Data Analyst at Townhouse, you'll play a pivotal role in our data-driven journey. This is a hands-on, multifaceted role perfect for a generalist who enjoys wearing many hats and thrives in a start-up environment. You'll be responsible for data manipulation, presentation, and analysis, with a strong emphasis on automation and problem-solving. You'll work closely with different parts of the business, providing insights that will directly influence our strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities:


Handle BAU reporting and ensure data is presented in a clear and actionable manner.
Automate BAU reporting and other general data processes to increase efficiency.
Conduct analyses such as customer behaviour analysis, commercial pricing, location modelling, demand prediction, and utilisation.
Gather data through customer surveys and interviews.
Constantly explore new ways to improve existing processes and build innovative solutions from scratch.


ABOUT YOU:


Relevant industry experience.
A generalist mindset, with a desire to take on multiple roles and build things from the ground up.
Proficiency in Excel/spreadsheets, data manipulation, and data visualisation.
Strong mathematical and analytical problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills with high emotional intelligence; able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and conscientious.
Experience with automation tools (e.g., Tableau, basic programming, Excel macros).
Knowledge of SQL is a bonus but not a necessity.


LOCATION:‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

Our office is based in Central London and we offer a discretionary hybrid working model, based on the requirements of the role.

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS AT TOWNHOUSE:‚ÄØ


Private healthcare and wellness support ‚Äì Benefit from the nail industry's first private healthcare package including free telephone / video GP appointments and treatment in private hospitals if there is a long wait on the NHS.
Shopping discounts - a range of discounts on some of the largest brands to save you money every day.
Birthday Pamper Party: During your birthday month, bring a friend for a free signature manicure/pedicure and a glass of bubbles!
Social Budget - Every month your manager gets a budget to spend pampering you and your team. Expect treats, lunch at work or a night out ‚Äì to be agreed with your manager!
Holiday on us: An extra day paid holiday on your annual allowance for every whole year you have been with Townhouse - up to 5 extra days!
Employee Discount: 75% discount on treatments
Interest free advance - To cover you for any emergencies and to avoid interest costs, we will provide up to a ¬£50 advance for every day you have worked for us in a month.
Refer a Friend: Earn up to ¬£550 for every successful hire you introduce to Townhouse.


Socials:

Discover more about us:‚ÄØ


Visit Our Website
Follow us on Instagram
Follow our Careers Page on Instagram


Equal Opportunities:‚ÄØ

Townhouse is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, embracing diversity without compromise. We celebrate all qualified applicants, irrespective of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability status.

Join us in defining sophistication in the world of nail artistry!‚ÄØ

Apply Now and Be Part of Our Exceptional Team!

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Since our launch in 2009, PureGym has been pioneering the model for affordable, flexible, high-quality gyms and our mission to inspire a healthier nation by helping more people in more places live healthier lives has led us to be the UK's favourite gym with over 380+ sites and many more to come. But our ambition hasn‚Äôt stopped there, and our international expansion has seen us become a leading international operator with 150+ clubs in Denmark, 40+ clubs in Switzerland and new openings in the USA, Saudi Arabia and UAE.

We are driven by the passionate people of PureGym, who create brilliant environments for our members and the communities we serve. Our unique "Everybody Welcome" approach provides a friendly, warm and welcoming environment for our members and our ambition to double in size over the next few years gives a great opportunity for our teams to grow and accelerate their careers.




Role Purpose

We are a value business, focused on making gyms and fitness accessible to as many people as possible. Data is at the heart of how we run our business, starting from where to open our gyms, through what we offer within them through to how we engage with past, current, and future members. Combining the data from our over 2 million members with data about locations, operations, and performance allows us to unlock industry leading insights and drive a better member experience and commercial performance.

As an Insights Analyst you will be at the heart of solving some of the hardest data challenges in the business, turning data into insights and business value through a combination of in-depth analysis and reporting creation. You will be leveraging one of the biggest fitness data assets in the world to help determine what drives member behaviour and experience and commercial outcomes across all our operating geographies.




The Job

As a small, agile team, Insights works closely with its stakeholders, putting data at the heart of decision making across the business. While reporting to the Insights Manager, the role works closely with stakeholders across the business in addition to the wider Insights and Analytics functions, which also contains Data Science and Data Engineers.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Work on analytics projects and reporting, identifying outcomes and communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the business.
Work closely with the Commercial, Finance, Operational and Marketing teams, in addition to Data Science and Data Engineering.
Drive continuous improvement to how we enable data driven decision making in PureGym.
Work with Azure Databricks and PowerBI technology, leveraging modern cloud-native technologies and data lakehouse architecture.




About you

We would expect some or all of the following:

Experience in data analytics / insights
Proficient with SQL, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with data visualisation platforms (PowerBI preferred but not required)
A drive and to turn insights into compelling stories for stakeholders to understand, for them to make more effective, data-led decisions
Strong commercial awareness with an interest in B2C

We are looking for an ambitious individual with a passion for leveraging analytics to drive business outcomes. The following core attributes are essential:

Excellent problem-solving: someone who enjoys applying their mind to many and varied business problems and be a driving force behind solving them
Innovative and curious: constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but seeking them out; always interested to find new and better methods and technologies
Biased towards action: take the initiative and get things done under their own steam and in collaboration with others
Collaborative: driven to engage with colleagues from across the business and support and enable your team members
A great communicator: able to translate complex concepts and analyses into digestible recommendations that can be easily interpreted and acted upon

Since our launch in 2009, PureGym has been pioneering the model for affordable, flexible, high-quality gyms and our mission to inspire a healthier nation by helping more people in more places live healthier lives has led us to be the UK's favourite gym with over 380+ sites and many more to come. But our ambition hasn‚Äôt stopped there, and our international expansion has seen us become a leading international operator with 150+ clubs in Denmark, 40+ clubs in Switzerland and new openings in the USA, Saudi Arabia and UAE.

We are driven by the passionate people of PureGym, who create brilliant environments for our members and the communities we serve. Our unique "Everybody Welcome" approach provides a friendly, warm and welcoming environment for our members and our ambition to double in size over the next few years gives a great opportunity for our teams to grow and accelerate their careers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity







Analytics is the compass that guides Sephora on its strategic journey, and we are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who can harness the power of data to propel our business forward. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting customer data to drive business decisions across our digital platforms. Leveraging your strong experience in BigQuery SQL, you'll craft scripts that seamlessly integrate back-end data with Google Analytics 4 for in-depth customer analysis and segmentation.




Your expertise in data modeling will enable you to map out data structures that support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to online engagement, traffic, conversion rates, and marketing effectiveness. In this role, you'll work with data visualization tools like Power BI and Google Data Studio to develop compelling visual reports that convey complex insights in a clear and actionable manner. Additionally, you'll ensure the accuracy and quality of data, while effectively communicating your insights to non-technical stakeholders.







You will also be responsible for:

Writing and optimizing BigQuery SQL scripts for GA4 analysis, integrating back-end data to segment and analyze customer data.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and regular weekly/monthly reports to track KPIs related to performance, online engagement, A/B testing, traffic, conversion rates, marketing attribution, and campaign effectiveness.
Using data visualization tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio to create clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Engaging in data modeling to effectively map out data structures that support business goals.
Utilizing digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Quantum Metric to deliver data-driven recommendations.
Ensuring the accuracy and quality of data while drawing insightful conclusions and making strategic recommendations.







What You'll Bring







Your passion for detail is matched by your logical thinking and curiosity. You not only obsess over details but also possess the agility to communicate improvements rapidly and clearly. You thrive in an ever-evolving landscape, where driving innovation and continuous improvement is paramount. We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team environment.

We value ambition paired with a logical mindset‚Äîindividuals who are curious, inquisitive, and able to articulate suggestions with precision. You will utilize your strong foundation in BigQuery SQL, particularly in GA4 analysis, coupled with hands-on experience in data visualization using tools like Power BI. Your deep understanding of digital analytics, especially within Ecommerce and Retail, will enable you to provide actionable insights that drive business success. Your proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Quantum Metric will be essential in providing recommendations that optimize performance.







Our ideal candidate will also possess:

Proficiency in Google Analytics, Quantum Metric, or similar digital analytics platforms.
Experience with Google Marketing Platform.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
An eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, A/B testing tools, competitor research using market share tools, setting up data feed APIs, and UX platforms would be advantageous.







While at Sephora, You‚Äôll Enjoy...







The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams ‚Äì people you can be proud to work with.
The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000 stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.

Title: Insights Analyst - ¬£32-35,000 - Excel - Remote
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel - Healthtech - Remote - ¬£32-35,000 + Bonus




Scalexperts are partnered with a Healthtech SaaS business, who partner with a huge proportion of the countries healthcare organisations in helping them to optimise their spend. Due to their continued success & growth, this has led to vast amounts of data being shared by their partners which means there is the opportunity to uncover more insights from data and deliver more value.




They are looking for an inquisitive individual to help uncover opportunities and trends in spend data which will help develop insights for their customers. The role will involve engaging proactively with the customers, sharing new opportunities and a new approach to their data. What will make someone successful in this role is the drive to deliver value through data, and a real knack for problem solving. Anyone who has experience of working with large and complex datasets will be at an advantage, as will those who have experience of working with data sets to analyse spending.




Experience in an analytical role, dealing with large, unstructured and complex data sets
Excellent at problem solving
Good Excel skills - knowledge of vlookups and pivot tables is essential
Previous experience in a role with client engagement and stakeholder management would be high beneficial
Able to work as part of a wider team, whilst also being self-motivated




The team works primarily remote and tend to meet up in London once a month

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Moor√©)

About the Company - This team focuses on safeguarding the billions of users across our clients family of apps from harmful content, malicious actors, and detrimental behaviors. By leveraging cutting-edge technology and collaborating with cross-functional teams worldwide, the team plays a crucial role in creating and upholding a secure and positive environment for the global community. In this organization, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by promoting integrity and fostering trust among users, businesses, and partners alike.







About the Role - As a member of this team, your role will involve responding to real-time crises while also proactively recognizing and assessing emerging risks. You will perform risk-related investigations and consider ways to better support our communities through improved strategies and practices. Leveraging your comprehensive knowledge of our clients systems, including tools, products, policies, and processes, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to implement tailored mitigation plans addressing various operational risks across platforms, domains, policies, and regions. This role places you at the center of managing crises, elections, and unconventional issues arising on our platforms, ensuring the continued safety and well-being of our user communities.




Responsibilities




Serve as an expert to interpret and enforce our clients‚Äô terms of service. (including but not limited to Community Standards, Advertiser & Commerce Policies and Product specific guidelines)
Investigate and resolve emerging risks that are reported on our clients‚Äô products, such as requests for account support and potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images, videos and writings, offensive or derogatory language, and other objectionable material across organic, ads and commerce.
Gather, analyze and utilize data from escalations and content/ad reviews to develop improvements for the overall escalation process, policies, products, and generate operational insights for the supported community
Showcase grace under pressure and ensure effective and timely collaboration with multiple internal stakeholders including but not limited to Public Policy, Core Policy, Legal, Sales, Product and Engineering
Adapt to changing requirements and prioritize escalation requests effectively
Liaise closely with our our clients‚Äô vendor teams to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions.
Work as part of a 24/7 global team, including the potential for on-call shifts during weekends/after-hours when needed.
Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Moor√©) requirement to use a combination of language and market specific geopolitical knowledge, deep understanding of cultural, language nuances and minority communities, to capture signals and insights to enforce and solve complex risk and operational issues within the region.




Qualifications




2 to 4 years of experience in Trust & Safety or Online Operations for a tech company, consulting, operations or similar roles
Strategic thinking with a proven track record of enhancing customer experience through innovation and continuous improvement
Strong communication skills and ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across functional boundaries and globally
Ability to work with graphic and objectionable content coupled with a broad understanding of our clients‚Äô Community Standards
Ability to make judgments under tight deadlines and competing priorities
Proficiency/ Basic knowledge in analytical tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) for driving analytics, reporting and operational decision-making







Pay range and compensation package - Approx. ¬£70,000 (Plus Benefits) | London (Hybrid)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Power BI & Azure Analyst - Bedford (Hybrid)




I am currently seeking a Power BI & Azure Analyst to join my client's growing team. Your main responsibility will be to transform data into insights that drive business value using Power BI. You will be involved in data engineering and creating data reports that will be presented to business stakeholders. As this role involves regular interaction with stakeholders, you must be knowledgeable and skilled in analysing data, delivering report solutions, and making recommendations.




Although this role prioritizes Power BI data analysis, you will also need a solid understanding of Azure SQL. You will be responsible for analysing data from multiple sources and consolidating it into data lakes. Your core responsibilities will include collecting and managing data, developing visually appealing data reports, providing insights and recommendations based on data analytics, and maintaining and updating existing reports and dashboards.







Key Skills:




Power BI: Creating data-rich dashboards
Power BI Desktop
Azure SQL
Azure Data bricks
Data Visualization & Data Analysis
SQL Queries
Python Programming for data extraction and analysis
Understanding of MS Azure
Data Modelling
Database Management







Benefits Package:




Hybrid Working Arrangement (2 Days WFH)
Competitive Base Salary
34.5 Hour Work Weeks
25 Days Annual Leave + Bank Holidays (Increasing to 28 with length of service)
Private Healthcare Scheme
Pension Scheme (6% Employer Contribution)
Christmas Shutdown
Opportunities for Development and Growth







If you're an experienced Power BI Data Analyst with Azure experience, this could be a great opportunity for you to progress your career at an incredible company with a lucrative benefits package.




If you are interested, please apply or submit your CV to elliot.twist@senitor.com.




Kind regards,

Elliot

Title: Data Analyst (Middle Office) ‚Äì Global Hedge Fund ‚Äì ¬£100-125k total comp + amazing benefits!
Description:
A market leading, global hedge fund, are looking to hire a data analyst into its London operations / middle office function.




The role that we are looking to hire has a hybrid remit split across project management / data analyst (tech) responsibilities + BAU operations tasks.




The core project management component of the role (roughly 50%, albeit even more so initially whilst the hire is being trained on the subject matter) will heavily focus on process improvements / infrastructure development for the BAU remit that you‚Äôll have coverage of ‚Äì as the work is tech focused, the hire will use Python, SQL and VBA to a very strong standard in the role. Additionally, the hire will take on a large volume of ad-hoc project work for specific investment desks, focused on data analytics / fund performance metrics. The BAU component will focus on oversight of the reconciliations and settlements processes, analyzing large volumes of data to produce reports / presenting analysis to the relevant investment desks. This is a highly quantitative role.




We are looking to hire a junior that is ambitious and would like to progress within the firm ‚Äì our client is one of the most progressive firms on the street. From this role, internal moves into other areas of technology, trading assistant, risk, quant or COO function roles are plausible, as are internal international transfers.




Candidates will ideally have 1-2yrs experience in a data analyst / data management role, that has had a strong focus on process improvement and automation work. Coding skills are a pre-requisite (python and/or SQL preferred). Candidates must have a top tier STEM degree.




Whilst this is a junior level role, our client are an industry leader for compensation ‚Äì the hire can expect a year one total comp package of ¬£100-125k if they perform to a strong standard. In addition, the firm offer a very large pension, top of the range healthcare, fully subsidised gym membership, an annual allowance to use on personal development / qualifications and a restaurant serving fully subsidised breakfast & lunch daily.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE ‚ÄìData Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You‚Äôll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you‚Äôll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You‚Äôll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you‚Äôre thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let‚Äôs work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background.
