HTML:
JOB TITLE ‚ÄìData Analyst - Marketing

Location - London


Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.


Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.



Responsibilities

  • Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
  • Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
  • Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
  • Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
  • Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.



Skills and Competencies

  • Good understanding of Marketing Principles
  • Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
  • Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
  • Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
  • MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines


Essential

  • Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
  • Experience with complex DAX queries
  • Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
  • Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
  • Logical mindset and strong attention to details
  • Project management skills


Desirable:

  • Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
  • Experience with SFMC automations
  • Knowledge of Python
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
  • Proficiency in PowerPoint
  • Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio


What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You‚Äôll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you‚Äôll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You‚Äôll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.


  • Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
  • Flexible hybrid working patterns
  • Opportunity to take your career globally
  • Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
  • Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
  • Referral bonus scheme
  • Community of internal support networks.
  • Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.


Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you‚Äôre thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let‚Äôs work together to create it!


At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. üåü




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ‚ú®




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.üíº




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst




Location: Coventry (on-site)




Salary: ¬£31,000







A rare opportunity to join a growing IT Team located in Coventry as a Business Systems Technician. In this new and exciting role, you will help support the development and delivery of diverse IT systems across the organisation.




Experience working with Applications, SQL and data knowledge is essential to be successful in this opportunity as you will be involved in the management of business systems.




The work that you do will have a meaningful impact on the business. You will also play a vital role in the management and administration of IT Business Systems; this includes identifying improvements, development, support, and assistance to the business.




To be successful in this role our ideal person will have:

An eye for understanding complex design (manufacturing, traceability, integration)
The drive to understand large volumes of data and system patterns.
The confidence to present your products to non-technical audiences.
The ability to adapt your communication style to account for varying levels of seniority and your audiences' requirements
Be able to define requirements, create and maintain documentation and conduct thorough testing of various systems

We will be looking for someone who:




Support design of test script, participating in full regression testing for the key business systems and other associated IT systems ‚Äì ensuring operational impacts are identified and communicated.
Will develop knowledge of the main business systems ‚Äì ERP, MES and be able to support day-today activities, including administration and basic development.
Supporting Business System division to monitor end-user system performance, report issues and maintain communications to ensure appropriate resolution.




Essential skills & experience:

Good IT skills
Ability to prioritise
Experience in supporting business applications
Knowledge of MS SQL Server would be advantageous
Ability to analyse data with attention to detail, identify associated trends and root cause of issues, implementing corrective action, as and when required.
Writing complex SQL queries
Ability to deploy hardware and software configuration
Proven analytical and problem solving ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills




Applying for the opportunity:







If you feel you have the required skills identified for this opportunity and wish to be considered, please forward an up-to-date version of your CV, and someone from Digital Waffle will contact you back within 48 hours if we feel you fit the criteria.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst | 100% Remote |¬£40,000-¬£55,000

KDR is excited to be partnering with a leading Commodities Data Analytics company who are on the lookout for their next Business Data Analyst.




The Company

Our client, a global software company providing innovative solutions in data management, data analysis, and business automation within the energy/commodity trading space. Due to ongoing success, they‚Äôre seeking a talented and experienced Business Data Analyst to join their dynamic Consulting team focusing on their bluechip clients within energy/commodity trade or risk management operations.




The Role

As a Business Data Analyst you will play a pivotal role in driving the successful delivery of high-quality data projects. Here's what you'll be doing:

Become an expert in our client‚Äôs data management/analytics platform, in support of clients that are active in the global energy and commodities markets (oil, gas, power, metals, agriculture etc).
Identify prospect/client requirements, design/implement data-driven workflows that leverage our client‚Äôs products and services.
Advise on / design integrations between our clients products and complimentary systems/applications e.g. Power BI, Python, ETRM systems, data lakes etc.
Support clients on data feeds - sources, structure, industry standards, publication conventions, deployments, testing
Support clients on analytics/transformations on time series / futures / options data




Ideal Candidate

Degree in quantitative/mathematics/statistics field
Ideally have familiarity with data/analytics specific to energy, finance, insurance, commodities, FX or interest rates i.e. derivative contracts (futures/options), historical settlements etc.
Strong technical skills in SQL
Foundation skills in IT/coding e.g. Python, VBA, APIs or others
Have experience engaging external stakeholders
Ability to integrate, connect, and thrive in a predominantly WFH arrangement




Why Join?

Role is 100% remote with flexible working
Working on cutting-edge project within Data and Software
Collaborative environment with world-class companies
Global presence
Opportunity to work on high-impact projects in trade and risk management




Next Steps

This Business Data Analyst role is in high demand and won't be available for long. If you're interested in joining our client's innovative team, hit the apply button now

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Training Programme




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies.




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you‚Äôll be choosing to work with an organisation that‚Äôs passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications. Consultants will get the opportunity to work with our interesting clients in the Financial Services, on projects that have a genuine impact from day one. We‚Äôll ensure that you get to work within a stimulating environment, where you‚Äôll have infinite opportunities to challenge yourself, grow with us and carve out the future you desire.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

An 8 week training course on Data and Business Analytics, including SDLC, SQL and BI Tools
CV workshop, interview training, career coaching, soft skill mentoring and project management principles and tools.
Deployment to a mainstream firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time




What You‚Äôll Get

Fully funded training through in-person classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
Financial industry experience with one of the top global organisations
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Python
Description:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.




Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.




Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.




We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.




Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.




This is where you come in‚Ä¶




The role‚Ä¶




We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.




The Data Science team‚Äôs main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.




The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the group‚Äôs head office in Crewe.




Your responsibilities will include‚Ä¶




Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radius‚Äô business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.




What do we expect of you?




Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
Good organisation and time-management skills




What can you expect of us?




Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.




You‚Äôll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:




Performance-related bonus scheme
Pension
Life assurance
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‚ÄòHelp@Hand‚Äô by Unum
‚ÄòCycle to work‚Äô scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office




And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, caf√©, games areas, and more!




Still curious?




If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!




If you‚Äôd like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.




Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.







Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst with a balanced mix of technical skills and strong soft skills? Do you have a knack for cleaning and organising raw data and can communicate your insights effectively to a diverse audience?




We are looking for a talented and dynamic individual who is eager to learn and grow, pays meticulous attention to detail, takes responsibility for the accuracy of their work, and communicates their findings clearly. This role offers a unique opportunity to play a significant part in our team's success.




Responsibilities




Cleaning and organising raw data

Mapping data from various sources

Maintaining data attribute tables

Conducting preliminary data investigation and analysis

Building automated workflows

Presenting information using BI tools

Validating automated reporting and uploading reports

Communicating findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders

Ensuring accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks

Specialist/Technical Skills




Strong data analysis and reporting skills

Proficient in using tools like SQL, Alteryx, and Excel for data manipulation

Experience with BI tools to present insights

Comfortable working with large data sets

Interest in or knowledge of finance function is advantageous

Strong problem-solving abilities

Soft Skills and Attributes




Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information clearly

High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

Strong business acumen and understanding of how data insights drive business decisions

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Proactive and self-motivated with a desire to learn and grow

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data analysis, strong communication skills, and a desire to develop in the field, we want to hear from you!

HTML:
Are you a Data Analyst with a balanced mix of technical skills and strong soft skills? Do you have a knack for cleaning and organising raw data and can communicate your insights effectively to a diverse audience?


We are looking for a talented and dynamic individual who is eager to learn and grow, pays meticulous attention to detail, takes responsibility for the accuracy of their work, and communicates their findings clearly. This role offers a unique opportunity to play a significant part in our team's success.


Responsibilities


Cleaning and organising raw data

Mapping data from various sources

Maintaining data attribute tables

Conducting preliminary data investigation and analysis

Building automated workflows

Presenting information using BI tools

Validating automated reporting and uploading reports

Communicating findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders

Ensuring accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks

Specialist/Technical Skills


Strong data analysis and reporting skills

Proficient in using tools like SQL, Alteryx, and Excel for data manipulation

Experience with BI tools to present insights

Comfortable working with large data sets

Interest in or knowledge of finance function is advantageous

Strong problem-solving abilities

Soft Skills and Attributes


Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information clearly

High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

Strong business acumen and understanding of how data insights drive business decisions

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Proactive and self-motivated with a desire to learn and grow

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data analysis, strong communication skills, and a desire to develop in the field, we want to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üî•üî•Data Insight Analystüî•üî•

üí´ Social & Customer üí´







üí∞¬£50k & benefits

üè† Hybrid / London Office 2-3 days







üìåWork across a range of clients in retail, FMCG and charity industries

üìå Act as 'right hand person' to Head of Data to lead on projects

üìå Strong skills with SQL, social media listening tools and Google Analytics

üìå Basic (or more advanced) skills with Python coupled with base understanding of analytical modelling

üìå Business or client facing skills required to liaise with, and nurture client relationships







I have partnered with an award winning global Marketing & Advertising agency to hire for a Data Analyst to join their growing Data Science team.







A chance to diversify your experience by working across multiple clients in various industries, delivering data science solutions to support improved omnichannel customer experience and campaign performance.







You will use a variety of analytical techniques and tools, such as Python, Google Analytics and BrandWatch, to deliver insights and measurement around web, search and social data, working with API's (like TikTok and Spotify) to segment and analyse audience and customer data.







There is strong ambition and scope and deliver more advanced machine learning projects, so it's important your skills can span a range of analytics and more advanced data science projects, helping to win work in this space.







Responsibilities:




Build and maintain robust statistical algorithms and predictive models to support data analytics projects around customer, digital marketing and product performance.
Pull data from various API's to bridge gaps in traditional data sources and tools.
Translate complex data findings into compelling presentation for non-technical audiences ,through building beautiful data visualisations
Work in partnership with creative teams to support data driven thinking, content creation and web builds.







Experience:




Educated to degree level in relevant subject such as Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Chemistry, Engineering etc.
Strong coding skills with SQL, working with large and complex data sets to extract insights and identify trends
Ideally experience in programming and modelling with Python, to support analytics projects
Strong technical skills with Google Analytics (GA) or Adobe Analytics for digital analytics, as well as social media listening tools such as BrandWatch or TalkWalker
Ideally experience working with multiple API data flows

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Trainee Data Analyst
Description:
e-Careers is a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business decisions.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who may not have any prior experience, but has the hunger to start a career in data analysis.

We will provide any necessary training and support to help you do your job and build the foundational knowledge to launch a career as a data analyst.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights.
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems and strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and present findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data quality checks.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.


Requirements


No prior experience or qualifications required. We will provide all the training necessary.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills.
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


Full training provided.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

¬£35,000 - ¬£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.

Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***This role requires 3 days in the office in Bournemouth - close to the train station***




Your new company

Join a dynamic and innovative company that values data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement. Our team is dedicated to leveraging data to drive commercial value and business growth. We foster a collaborative and supportive environment where your skills and expertise will be highly valued.




Your new role

As a Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of transforming large and complex data sets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work directly with C-Level executives to define and execute a portfolio of data analysis projects. Your responsibilities will include:




- Gathering and preparing data from multiple sources.

- Building analytical solutions to identify growth opportunities.

- Interpreting and analysing data to deliver business improvement opportunities.

- Leveraging third-party data to enhance analytical outputs.

- Communicating findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What you'll need to succeed

- Strong analytical skills to interpret large datasets and identify trends.

- Experience in designing data analysis solutions that drive commercial value.

- Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.

- Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.

- Ability to work effectively in a team and lead in a diverse technical environment.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills.

- A proactive approach to learning new technologies.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to maintain strong working relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.




What you'll get in return

- A competitive salary and benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

- The chance to work on impactful projects that drive business growth.

- The opportunity to act as a professional ambassador for the company at external events, conferences, and presentations.




If you are passionate about data analysis and eager to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and take your career to the next level.




What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.




If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK‚Äôs fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers




Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Lending and management.




We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.




You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights and managing stakeholder interactions to support ongoing data needs




Principal Accountabilities

Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate requests).
Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business
Helping us implement a data-driven mindset in the company by promoting a metrics-based approach to new initiatives (opportunity sizing prior and success metrics post deployment)




Personal Attributes & Experience

Previous experience working as a data analyst
You prefer to think through how to build an interesting analytics function at a company (rather than fit into existing conventions)
The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
You work well with stakeholders across the business.
You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn
Prior experience working in Google Cloud Platform and using Looker is desirable (but not at all necessary)




Don‚Äôt tick every box?

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you‚Äôll be a good fit, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you!




Flexible working

We know the ‚Äò9-to-5‚Äô isn‚Äôt right for everyone. That‚Äôs why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.




Diversity

We‚Äôre a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.




Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.

Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
Options for flexible working
Regular social activities
25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
Pension contributions
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
Life assurance
Income Protection
Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
Season ticket loans

  • Regular social activities
  • 25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
  • Pension contributions
  • Discretionary bonus scheme
  • Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
  • Life assurance
  • Income Protection
  • Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
  • Season ticket loans

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to be responsible for the collection and analysis of data from various sources in order to provide insights and solutions for various business problems using various tools and techniques, such as statistics, programming, databases, visualisation and machine learning.




The role will support all areas of the business to support the integration and ongoing transformation of our sales, support and operational functions.




Overview of duties:




Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks
Work closely with senior leadership, international data team members, and project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers
Proactively analyse data to answer key questions for stakeholders, with an eye on what drives business performance, and investigate and communicate which areas need improvement in efficiency and productivity
Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across datasets
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets
Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data




Person specification:




Knowledge, skills and abilities:




Proven analytics skills, including mining, evaluation, and visualisation
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment




Education / and or Experience:




Minimum of three years‚Äô experience mining data as a Data Analyst
Insurance or financial services experience preferred
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, PowerBI, SPSS, and SAS
Strong programming experience with frameworks, including XML, JavaScript, and ETL




Key information:




Hours: Monday ‚Äì Friday, 35 Hours

Location: Bromsgrove, Hybrid




If this sounds like something you are interested in please apply, or contact Paige Hughes or Lucy Reed for further information.

Show more

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
Social Data Analyst role at a fast-growing independent performance / paid social agency.







Salary to ¬£38,000 + bonus. Based Central London (2 days required in office per week).







Summary

This role has huge growth potential ‚Äì potentially to grow the team and manage a small department in years to come
Across a range of clients with a big B2C brand focus
You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics







As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.







The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social‚Äôs.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.

Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.

Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.

Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.

Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.







What We Need from You:




3+ years‚Äô experience within a social / data analyst role
Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
B2C client experience
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance) - UK
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren't kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They're some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We're looking for a superstar Data Analyst with a strong understanding of finance who doesn't believe there's a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨

From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge
Previous experience in the financial/banking industry


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
Experience in Accounting


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Global Product Master Data Analyst
Description:
McDermott Laboratories Limited

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access ‚Äì Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership ‚Äì Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership ‚Äì Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

The Global Product Master Data Analyst will be responsible for managing key aspects the company‚Äôs product master data on a global scale. This position is part of the Global Master Data Management Team which is responsible for creating, maintaining, and publishing standardized, high quality master data in order to support global operations, global processes and global reporting initiatives.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here‚Äôs how the Global Product Master Data Analyst role will make an impact:


Creation and maintenance of product and material master data according to established standards.
Work collaboratively with other functions (e.g. Global Quality, Regulatory, Finance, Sourcing, affiliates & manufacturing sites) to ensure master data related issues are resolved and objectives are met.
Contribute to the definition of Viatris-wide data definitions, terminology, data quality and business rules.
Manage relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring requirements are identified and met in a timely fashion.
Serve as the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for all matters related to product master data.
Write, revise, and verify standard operating procedures and other documentation for process design & evaluation, training, etc.
Analyze and solve master data problems and provide support for efficient daily operations.
Support various SAP implementation projects by representing the Global Product Master Data function to ensure continued alignment between global and local master data teams. Support project teams during data cleansing and migration activities.
Provide training to other business units on Global Product Master Data processes and concepts.
Support system development activities by assisting in requirements gathering, the drafting of test scripts, test execution, etc.
Lead data cleansing and harmonization activities and develop effective data cleansing rules and procedures in coordination with internal stakeholders.
Perform data quality audits of product and material master data to ensure it remains current and adheres to data quality standards.
Identify and manage the escalation and resolution of data quality issues, as needed.



About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we‚Äôre looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:


3+ years of experience in a master data management related role, preferably managing product or material master data.
SAP experience preferred but experience with other ERP systems and/or master data systems is acceptable.
Highly detail oriented and the ability to consistently achieve high levels of accuracy.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, a must.
Strong analytical skills, in terms of both data and process management.
High level of proficiency with MS Office programs.
Experience with SQL is a plus, but not required.
Ability to cope with ambiguity and implement structure and clarity.
Proactive and able to follow through on tasks.
Strong organizational skills a must.
Ability to act in a complex and rapidly changing environment.
Ability to work well with people at various levels and with different cultural backgrounds.
Bachelor level degree in relevant discipline or equivalent experience.
Strong customer service skills and the ability to work collaboratively with others.



At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Benefits At Viatris

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. Some of our benefits include the following on top of a competitive salary:


Excellent career progression opportunities
Work-life balance initiatives
Bonus scheme
Health insurance
Pension



Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Azure Virtual Desktop Engineer
Description:
Azure Virtual Desktop Engineer, AVD, PowerShell, Agile, Intune.

A great role has landed with a key customer who is looking for a talented AVD Engineer who can help support, implement, and maintain a high level of service across the business.

Operating in an exciting environment with the opportunity to work across not only AVD but the wider Azure technology stack, you'll be working closely with senior Engineers to identify and deliver opportunities for service improvements. At the same time, I will support my colleagues around the company.
Skills required:
Knowledge of Azure infrastructure like Virtual Machines, Azure Active Directory, Azure Storage, Security, Network Components.
Knowledge of securing virtualized environments, including threat detection, incident response, and compliance frameworks.
Working experience of AVD, its architecture, deployment options & management tools
A basic understanding of FSlogix for profile & application management
Familiarity with application packaging and delivery techniques for AVD
Proven experience in the use of PowerShell and KQL.
Experience in client management (compliance, configuration, application delivery) using Intune
A working understanding of delivery frameworks such as Agile
A consistent record of solving complex issues in a distributed cloud environment.
Communication and teamwork skills: Collaboration and communication with users, customers, and other IT teams are essential.
This role does come with an on-call required, and 2 days are requested in the office each week.

Azure Virtual Desktop Engineer, AVD, PowerShell, Agile, Intune.





McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We have an exciting new opportunity for a Digital Analyst to provide analytical support to meet the business requirements across FGH.

Utilising Adobe Analytics & the FGH database to provide customer insight & trading performance across web channels, publication groups, product categories etc. Focusing resource on improving online sales through greater understanding of onsite journeys.

This is a hybrid role, working at least 2 days in the office and the remainder from home.

Role Responsibilities


Understand and appreciate the commercial strategy of the Freemans Grattan Holdings business.
Work directly with the brand units to map business requirements to data analysis.
Develop and maintain clear and concise reports to influence website developments.
Provide status reports to management.
Have an in-depth understanding of existing and emerging digital marketing channels.
Develop working relationships with all business owners of digital marketing strategy to support and assist with the business transition to an online driven community.
Work closely with the other areas of the business on cross team initiatives to drive return on investment opportunities.
Provide insight to the web development team to prioritise customer journey and functional developments for the Freemans Grattan Holdings websites


About You


1-2 years experience in an Analytical Role or recent Graduate
Experience in Web Analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe or Similar) preferred.
Experience of A/B or multivariate testing.
Must be able to think creatively about issues and find a resolution.
Educated to degree level or equivalent business-related qualifications
Ability to work with high level of accuracy, and attention to detail to time critical deadlines.
Organised with great time management skills.
Enthusiastic, problem solving and interpersonal skills with ability to put your ideas across verbally and in presentations.
Great attention to detail.
The ability to multi-task and willingness to take on new responsibilities
Enthusiastic about what you do and work as part of a team to excel
Excellent presentation and writing skills.
Able to commute to Bradford City Centre


Why FGH?

Our staff enjoy competitive benefits including staff discount, generous annual leave, healthcare cash plan together with a vibrant, colourful, creative and flexible working atmosphere. With our competitive benefits, and supportive teams our staff enjoy helping us on our mission and benefit greatly from the challenges that come with working for a successful retailer.

About Us

Freemans Grattan Holdings (FGH) is based in West Yorkshire and is part of the OTTO Group ‚Äì one of the world's largest online retailers.

Home to familiar brands such as Freemans, Grattan and Kaleidoscope, we have over 100 years of experience.

We're on a mission to help our customers live their best lives through a choice of quality basics, the brands they love and credible exclusive product supported by easy and rewarding ways to pay.

We offer excellent service and delivery seven days a week, with so much going for us - why not be part of the story.

We have over 600 UK employees working for us in various functions, including Marketing and Creative, Customer Experience, Warehousing and Logistics, Financial Services, Transformation, Buying and Merchandising, IT and Support Services.

Our values of Resilience, Empathy, Ambition, Commitment, and Honesty underpin our vibrant and dynamic culture.

We're heading for some exciting and challenging places, so why not join us and be part of our vision to create a modern, digital retailer with powerful customer brands, exciting product and compelling financial services.

Apply
Show more
HTML:
About The Role

We have an exciting new opportunity for a Digital Analyst to provide analytical support to meet the business requirements across FGH.

Utilising Adobe Analytics & the FGH database to provide customer insight & trading performance across web channels, publication groups, product categories etc. Focusing resource on improving online sales through greater understanding of onsite journeys.

This is a hybrid role, working at least 2 days in the office and the remainder from home.

Role Responsibilities

  • Understand and appreciate the commercial strategy of the Freemans Grattan Holdings business.
  • Work directly with the brand units to map business requirements to data analysis.
  • Develop and maintain clear and concise reports to influence website developments.
  • Provide status reports to management.
  • Have an in-depth understanding of existing and emerging digital marketing channels.
  • Develop working relationships with all business owners of digital marketing strategy to support and assist with the business transition to an online driven community.
  • Work closely with the other areas of the business on cross team initiatives to drive return on investment opportunities.
  • Provide insight to the web development team to prioritise customer journey and functional developments for the Freemans Grattan Holdings websites

About You

  • 1-2 years experience in an Analytical Role or recent Graduate
  • Experience in Web Analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe or Similar) preferred.
  • Experience of A/B or multivariate testing.
  • Must be able to think creatively about issues and find a resolution.
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent business-related qualifications
  • Ability to work with high level of accuracy, and attention to detail to time critical deadlines.
  • Organised with great time management skills.
  • Enthusiastic, problem solving and interpersonal skills with ability to put your ideas across verbally and in presentations.
  • Great attention to detail.
  • The ability to multi-task and willingness to take on new responsibilities
  • Enthusiastic about what you do and work as part of a team to excel
  • Excellent presentation and writing skills.
  • Able to commute to Bradford City Centre

Why FGH?

Our staff enjoy competitive benefits including staff discount, generous annual leave, healthcare cash plan together with a vibrant, colourful, creative and flexible working atmosphere. With our competitive benefits, and supportive teams our staff enjoy helping us on our mission and benefit greatly from the challenges that come with working for a successful retailer.

About Us

Freemans Grattan Holdings (FGH) is based in West Yorkshire and is part of the OTTO Group ‚Äì one of the world's largest online retailers.

Home to familiar brands such as Freemans, Grattan and Kaleidoscope, we have over 100 years of experience.

We're on a mission to help our customers live their best lives through a choice of quality basics, the brands they love and credible exclusive product supported by easy and rewarding ways to pay.

We offer excellent service and delivery seven days a week, with so much going for us - why not be part of the story.

We have over 600 UK employees working for us in various functions, including Marketing and Creative, Customer Experience, Warehousing and Logistics, Financial Services, Transformation, Buying and Merchandising, IT and Support Services.

Our values of Resilience, Empathy, Ambition, Commitment, and Honesty underpin our vibrant and dynamic culture.

We're heading for some exciting and challenging places, so why not join us and be part of our vision to create a modern, digital retailer with powerful customer brands, exciting product and compelling financial services.

Apply

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Engineer
Description:
At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays we‚Äôre working together to deliver an amazing journey, literally! We work together to really drive forward a ‚ÄòCustomer First‚Äô ethos, creating unforgettable package holidays and flights. We couldn‚Äôt do it without our wonderful people.

As our new Senior Data and Analytics Engineer, you‚Äôll have a major impact on helping us achieve our goal. You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, agile, data delivery team focused on the delivery of innovative, robust, and efficient data solutions to complex business problems. You will work alongside a team of passionate data professionals including other data and analytics engineers, test engineers, data scientists and data visualisation specialists

You‚Äôre probably now asking: What‚Äôs in it for me? As our Senior Data and Analytics Engineer, you‚Äôll have access to a wide range of benefits including:


Remote working
Annual pay reviews
Access to a generous discretionary profit share scheme



Don‚Äôt just take our word for it check our reviews on Glassdoor!

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


You‚Äôll be responsible for delivery of complex data solutions including the ingest of data from a wide variety of data sources into our analytics platforms (typically cloud-based but some work on our on-premise data analytics platforms)
You‚Äôll drive a data-first culture both within the data team and across the business by supporting continual learning and development within your team and data enablement activity across the wider business.
You will demonstrate a passion for data and encourage a similar passion within your team. As part of a data-first culture you may also be involved in supporting production data assets (not on a first-line basis).
Cleansing of data and modelling of data into our enterprise data warehouse for consumption by both technical users and non-technical business users



What You‚Äôll Have


You‚Äôll have a strong understanding of SQL and be comfortable reading and writing complex SQL queries
Ideally, you‚Äôll have experience working on the design and data modelling stages of data warehouse projects and be comfortable with conceptual, logical and physical data modelling techniques as well as dimensional modelling techniques
Experience using cloud data warehouse technology would be beneficial - Snowflake (preferred), Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift or Azure Synapse
You‚Äôll have experience working with data from a wide variety of data sources including different database platforms, flat files, API‚Äôs and event-driven data feeds



Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!

Title: Management Information Analyst
Description:
Primary Details

Time Type: Full time



Worker Type: Employee

The opportunity

QBE European Operations (EO) are looking for a talented Management Information (MI) Analyst to join our Finance Performance Reporting team in our London office. As an MI Analyst, you will play a crucial role in providing insightful financial analysis and data-driven recommendations to support strategic decision-making. This position requires a keen analytical mind, attention to detail, and a passion for leveraging data to drive business performance.

Your new role

As our MI Analyst you will provide technical expertise to assist the design and implementation of our reporting strategy and use reporting tools to develop and support activity across the business

Your primary responsibilities will include:



Assist in the implementation of the team plans to ensure these are in line with wider business strategy and reflect key priorities.
Support the development of a fit-for-purpose reporting tool strategy in order to provide customers with standard reports and analytical tools which meet and anticipate user needs.
Support the development of reporting and data requirements included in projects, in order to achieve business goals and priorities.
Review MI/Reporting, seeking areas for improvements and/or rationalization to enhance effectiveness
Use expertise to support delivery of MI small changes e.g. addition of new data fields, calculated values etc in order to support users and minimize disruption to applications and tools.
Ensure that the needs of business clients/users are fully understood and proactively resolve issues and queries in order to facilitate effective reporting
Responsible for the production of our monthly pricing metrics and quarterly performance management data submission to Lloyds




About You

In order to thrive in the role of an MI Analyst here at QBE, we would expect you to have working experience in most of the following areas:



Excellent communication and effective stakeholder management abilities
Significant experience in the insurance industry, financial services or a regulated environment
Extensive MI experience in a business facing, client support role with technical BI/MI skills to support the role
Problem solving and negotiation skills with excellent planning and organising abilities
Networking skills and influencing skills
Excellent MS Excel capabilities
Experience using visualisation tools e.g. Power BI




Why QBE? At My Best



At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, that‚Äôs why we have created ‚ÄúAt My Best‚Äù. It‚Äôs our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. It‚Äôs in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters, it‚Äôs how we do it that makes the difference. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.



At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation (https://qbeeurope.com/careers/flex-qbe/).

Some of the award‚Äôs QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;

5-star Diversity, Equity and inclusion (DEI) awards, 2023 Winner - Insurance Business Canada

Employer of the Year 2022 Winner ‚Äì Insurance Insider

British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award

Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response

Insurance Post British Insurance Awards 2022 Shortlisted for: Best Customer Care, Diversity & Inclusion Initiative of the Year 2022, Specialist Insurer of the Year (for Construction), General Insurer of the Year

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women‚Äôs Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent

Inclusion of Diversity

We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.

We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.

ESG & Sustainability



At QBE, we believe that integrating sustainability into our business helps us deliver on our purpose of enabling a more resilient future. Our three key focus areas include fostering an orderly and inclusive transition to a net-zero economy, enabling a sustainable and resilient workforce and partnering for growth through innovative, sustainable and impactful solutions. For further information regarding QBE‚Äôs sustainability targets, including our net-zero pledges and inclusion of diversity targets, and our award-winning impact investment initiative ‚ÄòPremiums4Good‚Äô, please visit our Sustainability homepage and read our latest Sustainability Report (Link).

About QBE

We can never really predict what‚Äôs around the corner, but at QBE we‚Äôre asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future ‚Äì helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.

We‚Äôre an international insurer that‚Äôs building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.

And our people will be at the centre of our success. We‚Äôre proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities.

With more than more than 13,000 people working across 27 countries, we‚Äôre big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.

We believe this is our moment ‚Äì what if it was yours too?

To find out more about why you should work for QBE, visit our careers website.

What next?

If you have a passion to contribute to QBE‚Äôs vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to apply! Simply click the ‚Äúapply‚Äù button to submit your CV and other relevant documents, and a member of our friendly Talent Acquisition team will be in contact to discuss your interest further if you meet the requirements of the role.

Please make the Talent Acquisition aware should there be any reasonable adjustments that may need to be made for the interview and the remainder of the recruitment process.

APPLY NOW and let‚Äôs make it happen!

How to Apply:

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer - Leeds/Hybrid/Flexible

Answer Digital is looking to recruit a Senior Data Engineer to play a vital role in supporting the digital transformation journeys of our clients.




What you‚Äôll be doing

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has experience guiding teams and supporting clients to use data to make better decision making. We have some exciting plans for our Data Capability in 2024/25, so if you‚Äôve got a passion for building great teams and supporting our Data Engineer Academy then that would be great. Healthcare experience, or a passion for wanting to work across healthcare data projects is a bonus!




What you‚Äôll bring to Answer

Designing and implementing complex data pipelines, leveraging both NoSQL and relational databases.
Develop and manage cloud-based data solutions, ensuring scalability and security.
Lead and mentor junior data engineers, promoting knowledge sharing and professional growth.
Implement and oversee CI/CD pipelines, ensuring efficient deployment of data services.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and other relevant backend languages.
Utilise backend programming languages effectively for data processing and manipulation.




It would be great if you also had experience in some of these, but if not we‚Äôll help you with them:

Actively participate in the organisation and delivery of our Data Engineer Academy.
Apply advanced scripting skills to automate data processes and integrate ETL workflows.
Engage with business intelligence (BI) tools and techniques to deliver actionable insights.
Advocate and apply best practices in software design patterns, principles, and architecture patterns.
Stay abreast of the latest trends in data engineering, with a focus on healthcare data standards (SNOMED, FHIR, HL7).
Understanding the role of a consultancy and sharing a passion for helping solve our customers problems




The perks of being @ Answer

We‚Äôre an Employee-Owned Company. After 12 months ‚Äì through the Employee Ownership Trust you will be part of the ownership of Answer; a major factor in driving engagement, retention and growth for our people

Competitive salary
Flexible annual leave (buy/sell and carry forward)
Twice a year tax free bonus
Continuous training and development - if you want to learn, we‚Äôll provide all the support you need
Flexible Pension - we match your on contributions up to 5%
Regular tech catch ups/hack events - we also encourage external tech events!
A packed social calendar including; Christmas party (partners invited) and Summer away days, monthly and quarterly company team socials.
Free parking at Head Offices in central Leeds, plus Cycle2Work & Green Car Lease schemes to help get you here
The chance to give back ‚Äì get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from different backgrounds into tech, as well as lots of charity and community events
Hybrid and flexible working ‚Äì you can vary your working when and where you work, to allow you to collaborate better, feed your creativity, and take the time and space to focus when you need to




Diversity and Inclusion

At Answer we proudly embrace diversity and inclusion - we want to create a safe environment for everyone to bring their true selves to work. We will do everything we can to support your application; if you require any adjustments to be made to your application or interview process please speak to our recruitment team.




A bit more about us.

Answer Digital is a highly successful digital transformation consultancy headquartered in Leeds. We‚Äôre a company on a fast growth trajectory with a reputation of delivering large-scale, operational critical solutions.




People are at the heart of everything we do - so much so we‚Äôre owned by our people. It sets us apart from most digital businesses you‚Äôll meet and defines our culture and values. Our people are invested in everything we do, because we are invested in them.




Don't believe us? Well check out our Glassdoor and here what our people have to say!
