Title: Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Infrastructure Engineer

Location: Ripponden with occasional visits to client sites (in the UK)

Salary: up to ¬£50,000




We develop world-leading intelligence solutions. We are a disruptive force in the industry who are at the forefront of redefining the future of intelligence technology. Our expertise encompasses research and development, strategic consulting, precise delivery, and unwavering support for clients.




What sets us apart is our relentless pursuit of the extraordinary. We thrive on challenges deemed impossible, crafting state-of-the-art solutions and groundbreaking technologies that pushes boundaries of what‚Äôs possible. Our work is specialised, but genuinely different. It‚Äôs not just a job; it's a passion, a journey.




We‚Äôre a small team of curious, hard-working and friendly people, who are experts in our sector. As a team, we pride ourselves on delivering high quality work whilst also being committed to creating a collaborative and fun place to work.




Within this role you will be working on cutting-edge technology pushing the boundaries of innovation. You will get the opportunity to work on meaningful, creative and diverse problems that will give you a sense of purpose.




We are interested in speaking with you if you have experience in:

Deploying infrastructure as code using ansible or terraform.
Managing virtualisation platforms, such as KVM or VMWare or Hyper-V.
Experience managing Windows and Linux servers.
Understanding of TCP/IP, VPN, PKI, DNS, and DHCP, among others.
Application deployment using containers.
Analysing, troubleshooting, and resolving system hardware, software, and networking issues.
Configuring, optimising, fine-tuning, and monitoring operating system software and servers.
Conducting server builds.
Experience in configuring network devices (such as firewalls and switches).




What we can offer:

Salary dependent on experience, up to ¬£50,000 per annum.
Employer's pension contribution of 6% of base salary.
25 days holiday + bank holidays.
Can buy up to 5 additional days annual leave.
Life Insurance and critical illness cover.
24 hour virtual access to GP services.
Snacks & drinks provided in the office.
A relaxed dress code.




We want to make sure that our recruitment process is as inclusive as possible. If you require reasonable adjustments please reach out to the recruitment manager hannah.n@xewli.com




Security Clearance statement

Please note that all applicants for this role must hold or be eligible for UK security clearance and willingness to apply for a DV in due course. To qualify, you should be a British Citizen and have lived in the UK for the last 10 years.




Successful applicants who already have DV will be eligible for a sign on bonus.

Title: Quality Control Analyst
Description:
Grow a Better Tomorrow with Nufarm.

We know that growing is about more than just crops and cultivation. It‚Äôs about sunshine and rain, early mornings, and hard work. It can be frustratingly unpredictable but also wonderfully uplifting. More than anything, it‚Äôs about people. Nufarm is the dependable partner behind thousands of agricultural success stories. Every day, growers around the world turn to our products and our people to help with the challenges of fighting disease, weeds and pests, and to increase crop yields.

Quality Control Shift Analyst

How can you unearth the possibilities with Nufarm?

Join us at our growing manufacturing site in Wyke, West Yorkshire as our new Quality Control Shift Analyst. Working as part of a team you will be responsible for ensuring the provision of a comprehensive analytical service primarily supporting manufacturing and sales operations.

What‚Äôs possible?


Ensure that all required analyses are carried out in line with appropriate methods, in a timely manner.
Prioritise activities to make best use of available resources and to maximise the throughput of the laboratory.
Maintain accuracy of information within the various business systems such as LIMS, Chromeleon and Oracle.
Carry out a comprehensive hand-over operation with fellow shift analysts at shift change and alert the QC Laboratory Manager of any problems or delays.
Maintain copies of analytical methods needed to perform necessary analysis.
Ensure all laboratory operations are conducted in compliance with Health and Safety and associated regulations and standards.
Provide analytical facilities for production at all times and advise of potential problems.
Become acquainted with new analytical procedures/products as they come on stream.
Inform production personnel when material outside specification and requires further processing.
Ensure that supplies of consumables and chemicals are maintained suitable to support laboratory and satellite laboratory operations; ensure that the laboratory budget is achieved.
Alter shift pattern, overtime, etc. to cover for colleagues when on holiday or when sick through the QC Laboratory Manager.
Undertake analytical based project work as and when required in support of Nufarm‚Äôs manufacturing plants and wider commercial operation.
Undertake MCERTS training program at the earliest opportunity, and thereafter provide resource into the Wyke sites MCERTS monitoring program to acquire and/or to work up environmental test samples as required by the business. If required, you are also expected to undertake a training and development program in order to gain and maintain MCERTS Level II if the business need should arise.


What do you bring?

As our QC Shift Analyst, you will have experience in working in a busy QC laboratory supporting chemical manufacture. Ideally you will be a graduate chemist and have experience in the operation and use of HPLC, GC, IR, UV, wet methods, and experience of analytical method development in these techniques.

Personality wise you will have excellent time keeping, able to prioritise a busy workload and be resilient with your time and workload. Communication skills across cross functional teams is essential and you will be used to working in a fast-paced environment.

What‚Äôs in it for you?


Growth and development opportunities across our global organisation
Enhanced holiday entitlement of 28 days per year (plus bank holidays)
A boosted pension scheme ‚Äì we‚Äôll match 1.25% to every 1% you pay (up to 8%)
Health Cash Plan
Global Share Plan scheme
Shopping discounts
Long service awards
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
A friendly and supportive team where you‚Äôre encouraged to be yourself and come as you are!


That‚Äôs just what we think, we‚Äôd love to hear from you what you think is possible. #unearththepossibilities

If you want to be a part of a thriving, supportive environment and are inspired by the prospect of being a part of something bigger, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. All employment decisions are decided based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We are committed to building an inclusive environment for all Nufarm employees.

Title: BI Developer - Leeds - ¬£60K
Company: YourCode - Award Winning IT & Digital Consultancy
Description:
Bi Developer

Hybrid - 3 days in office

Leeds

¬£60K

We are looking for a BI Developer to join our clients team in Leeds. The ideal candidate will have experience in PowerBI, Data Engineering, and have a strong understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence.

The role will involve working with a team of data engineers to design, develop, and maintain data pipelines. You will also be responsible for creating and managing data models, and developing reports and dashboards using PowerBI.

The successful candidate will be a highly motivated and self-directed individual with excellent communication and teamwork skills. They will also have a strong understanding of data analysis and visualization techniques.

Responsibilities


Create and manage data models
Designing, developing, testing, and implementing robust data applications powered by cutting-edge technologies like Azure DataFactory, PowerBI, Qlikview, and SSRS.
Develop reports and dashboards using PowerBI
Work with a team of data engineers to improve data quality and performance
Provide technical support to users of PowerBI


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in Data Engineering
Strong SQL expertise
Knowledge of data design and database design principles
Experience in Report building
Proficiency in PowerBI
Strong understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence
Excellent communication and teamwork skills


Benefits


Flexible working - This role does require you to be in the office 3 days a week but you will work in a modern space with excellent engineer
Great work environment.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunities for career growth and development.
Paid vacation and holidays.
Discounted gym membership
Private medical, dental and health plans
Free parking
onsite bistro


We are looking for someone who is a data-driven problem solver, enthusiastic about technology and teamwork. You excel in fast-paced settings and enjoy learning and developing alongside industry experts.

You will be working for a team constructing a new Data platform capability as part of a larger scale operation in a section of their business. This role gives you the opportunity to oversee the entire data process throughout the data life cycle. Collaborating with a Technology Stack, you will work with Visual studio, SSMS, SSIS, SSRS, PowerBI and other parts of the engineering stack, whilst collaborating with engineers, testers, and business professionals in an Agile environment.

If you're ready for a new challenge and would like to find out more then please get in touch to chat with one of our consultants!

Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer

Location: Leeds

Working Model: Remote (required to go in to Leeds office twice a month)

Salary: up to ¬£65,000

Reporting to: Infrastructure Team Lead




NRG is thrilled to announce we are working alongside a leading Utility organization in their search for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer. This is an exciting time to join our client during a dynamic period of growth as they as they enhance their core infrastructure.




Role Overview:




Reporting to the Infrastructure Team Lead, you will support cloud technologies and manage project delivery alongside internal and external support vendors across various technologies.




You will efficiently and professionally resolve incidents and requests in accordance with service level agreements. Your primary responsibility is the delivery of cloud services for our client‚Äôs network and server environments. The ideal candidate should be technically adept, with experience in designing and implementing cloud solutions.




This role provides the freedom to explore and implement optimal solutions for the organisation, while allowing you to enhance your technical skills by working with and configuring complex products and technologies.




Our client offer opportunities for growth and advancement within the company through both internal and external training programs.




Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:




Deliver high-quality IT support and manage project delivery effectively.
Configure and deploy cloud services, third-party tools, and integrations.
Provide technical consultation on existing and proposed cloud services.
Participate in planning and scoping for highly available cloud solutions.
Assist the Service Desk team with the support of existing cloud services and infrastructure as needed.
Maintain and create essential technical documentation.
Embrace a DevOps culture and stay updated with the latest industry cloud offerings.




Job Requirements:




Manage infrastructure and provide third-line support, resolving issues swiftly and efficiently.
Proficiency with core AWS services, including EC2, Storage, IAM, SNS, Lambda, Databases, Route 53, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, API Gateways, and Systems Manager.
Experience in deploying infrastructure as code.
Oversee and sustain the cloud infrastructure to ensure optimal performance and efficiency.
Experience in deploying and maintaining code pipelines.
Capability to understand and manage AWS VPC network roles, such as Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, VPNs, ACLs, NACLs, Peering, and Route Tables.
Knowledge of DevOps principles, including continuous delivery and continuous integration.
Experience in configuring and maintaining server OS systems.
Familiarity with AWS billing and management.
Experience in performing root cause analysis to identify and resolve issues.
Exposure to infrastructure project delivery.
Familiarity of high availability, backup technologies, RTO, and RPO.
Strong understanding of AWS security best practices
Participation in an after-hours on-call rotation (1 in 4 weeks)




Desirables:




ITIL practices and knowledge of change control.
Understanding of networking topologies, such as switching, VLANs, routing, remote access, and various switching layers.
Familiarity with additional AWS services such as IoT, Machine Learning, auto-scaling, and containerization.
Experience with cloud automation tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, and JSON.
Experience with FortiGate routers and firewalls.
Relevant certifications, including:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect ‚Äì Associate Level
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator ‚Äì Associate Level
AWS Certified Developer ‚Äì Associate Level
ITIL certification.




For more information or to apply, click Apply Now and a member of our team will be in touch.

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant
Description:
DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT

¬£55,000-¬£60,000 + BENEFITS

REMOTE

An opportunity for an energetic and dedicated individual looking to take a leading role in complex projects and valuable client engagements.

The Company

This is a digital marketing consultancy aiming to provide technological expertise to their clients. They are seeking to increase trust in data and offer the highest quality service.

The Role

A Digital Analytics Consultant will be key to client engagements and therefore will be:


Translating analytics requirements into actionable roadmaps.
Leading client engagements and working with key stakeholders.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager debugging.
Be able to communicate with a wide variety of people, adjusting language accordingly.


Your Skills And Experience

A successful Digital Analytics Consultant will have the following skills and experience:


Proven commercial experience in Google Analytics/GA4
Advanced use of Google Tag Manager.
Big Query desirable.
Famililarity with Google Consent Mode
Proven experience with Data Studio.
Ability and experience interacting with key stakeholders


The Benefits

You will receive a salary, dependent on experience. Salary is up to ¬£60,000 On top of the salary there are some fantastic extra benefits.

How To Apply

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Molly Bird via the apply link on this page.

Title: Senior CRM Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Senior CRM Analyst to join our global client, where you'll play a key role in supporting the execution of marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including direct mail, email, push notifications, and SMS. You will also provide analysis and insights to enhance customer targeting strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Execute multi-channel campaign selections, including direct mail, email, push notifications, and SMS, in line with customer and marketing strategies.
Design and manage customer journeys across various channels using our CRM platform.
Ensure the accurate setup of promotional offer codes before they reach customers.
Maintain and improve data integrations between marketing automation tools.
Deliver timely and precise analytics to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns across all direct customer communication channels.
Identify opportunities to enhance customer targeting through data-driven insights.
Work closely with marketing teams to improve customer experience and boost customer lifetime value.
Effectively manage your workload to meet deadlines.




Experience:

Hands-on experience with CRM or marketing automation platforms‚Äîexperience with Adobe Campaign is preferred.
Strong SQL skills and experience managing a marketing database.

Title: IT Developer Remote Working
Description:
Job Purpose

We are looking for a software developer to join our small team. The Developer will demonstrate all the skills, experience and attributes required of this role. This role is hands-on and has a key requirement to work closely not only with the IT team, but also with the Operations, Commercial and Financial Managers, as well as their wider teams.

Key Responsibilities

Create, test and maintain programs across the businesses; writing code, repairing code, identifying areas for software modification and monitoring analytics efficiently.

Work closely with the business stakeholders to ensure systems meet current requirements and future business needs.

Support with software development projects across a range of businesses.

Accountable for performing trials, testing and quality checks to ensure strong functionality and optimisation.

Maintaining and supporting systems andimproving the performance of existing software.

Support with designing databases, ensuring that these are accurate and that anomalies are rectified within an appropriate time period.

Support the prioritisation and documentation around change requests.

Prepare and maintain detailed records regarding development processes.

Systems admin, support and problem-solving involving the companys operational systems and harnessing technology to ensure the business efficiency.

Clearly and regularly communicating with stakeholders and technical colleagues.

Ensure that standards of service are at an exceptional level.

Support compliance with all legal & regulatory requirements regarding business activity and reporting thereof.

Adhoc duties as requested by the Chief Financial Officer and Senior IT Developer.

Skills And Qualifications

A minimum of 1 years experience in a similar programming role operating within a commercial organization. Strong analytical and critical thinking capability, comfortable writing and analysing SQL queries; solid communication skills, both written and verbal; superior attention to detail; organisational skills; planning skills; analytical skills; honesty.

Personal Attributes

You will be confident, pro-active and have solid exposure to programming, with a focus on meeting the business needs and a granular attention to detail. You will have good time management skills and be able to meet tight deadlines.

Apply Now.

Title: Systems Engineer
Description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Systems Engineer in our Fire & Security Systems business team. You will be based remotely and cover areas of Leeds and surrounding territory. The job holder will be required to work 40 hrs per week.

What You Will Be Doing


Attend to calls for maintenance (on site and or by telephone) as directed by team co-ordinators
Rectify all faults on the first visit where rectification is within your control.
Carry out rolling programme of preventative maintenance visits.
Collection/recording of site configuration information.
Maintain accurate and timely records.
Provide cover on an out of hour‚Äôs basis on a rotating basis.
Commission small projects when required.
Ensure that audits are carried out of quality procedures.
Provide training to customers and colleagues as required.
Carry out any additional tasks that may be required.



What We Are Looking For


Previous experience installing & servicing a wide product base of access control systems, CCTV systems and intruder alarm systems.
Experience of installing and servicing fire alarm systems, ideally GENT based.
An IT qualification and or Electrical/Electronic qualification
A broad technical IT knowledge, i.e. Installing various Windows Operating Systems; networking etc
Knowledge of basic electrical principals such as measuring voltage and current drain
Good attention to detail in order to ensure that all paperwork is correctly completed, and procedures are followed within the allotted timescales.
An enthusiastic team player who is able to work well under pressure and maintain a professional approach at all times.
Comfortable working irregular hours and being on a 24/7 call rota



The Benefits Of Working For G4S


Salary up to ¬£34,000
Company Car
25 days holiday
Pension/Life assurance



You will just need to complete the following application form and one of our Recruiters will be in touch to discuss the next steps. Our recruitment and selection process will include an interview and screening to BS7858 standards.

Given the nature of the industry, we do need to ask some questions for security and compliance purposes, but don‚Äôt worry - you will only need to complete them once.

In 2021, G4S, a London-based global security company, was acquired by Allied Universal¬Æ, a leading security and facility services company that provides proactive security services and cutting-edge smart technology to deliver tailored, integrated security solutions. This acquisition expanded Allied Universal‚Äôs footprint and infrastructure on a global and local level. Through a global workforce of approximately 800,000 people*, we leverage best practices in communities all over the world. With revenue of approximately $20 billion, we have the resources to deploy efficient processes and systems to help deliver our promise locally: keeping people safe so our communities can thrive. In Europe, we have an extensive network of offices and more than 46,500 employees to support our local communities and customers. We believe there is no greater purpose than serving and safeguarding customers, communities and people in today‚Äôs world. Allied Universal is There for you‚Ñ¢. For more information, please visit www.g4s.com or www.aus.com .


Total workforce includes employees and subcontractors

Title: Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst Jet2holidays
Description:
As our new Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst Jet2holidays, you‚Äôll create and maintain long-term growth plans for destinations, resorts, and hotel chains. Making sure all plans are maintained with the latest insight from Airline Planning, Revenue, Product and Contracting.

As our Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst Jet2holidays, you‚Äôll have access to a wide range of benefits including:


Hybrid working (we‚Äôre in the office 2 days per week)
Colleague discounts on Jet2holidays and Jet2.com flights
26 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)



What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Provide and maintain detailed reviews and analysis of bed capacity capability, current and future, by specific destinations.
Undertake analysis for long-term strategies for key hotel chains and suppliers.
Provide suggestions for improvement on data and outputs.
Carry out the analysis of new destination opportunities, keeping this up to date as priorities and world events change.
Provide reviews of customer data to identify portfolio gaps.
Continually review competitor positions identifying changes.



What You‚Äôll Have


You‚Äôll be highly analytical with the initiative and the ability to make informed, fact-based decisions with the confidence to explain the reasoning behind these.
You‚Äôll have a degree in a numerate focused subject or relevant work experience.
You‚Äôll be confident using Microsoft office products, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
You‚Äôll ideally have some experience in creating data visualisations and presenting your findings.
You‚Äôll be able to work under tight deadlines and on different projects simultaneously.



What Would Be Desirable


Experienced Strategic Planning Analyst / Graduate in distilling large sets of complex data into simple insights for non-data experts.
Experience using SQL (or another coding language) and / or Tableau (or another data visualisation tool) would be advantageous.
Experience within a tour operator, airline, or travel business would be advantageous.



Some travel overseas may be required from time to time

Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Senior BI Developer




Home based role ‚Äì 1 day a week (Tuesday) at Wakefield




ABOUT THE ROLE:




The Senior BI Developer will be responsible for managing circa 3-5 projects at a time of various sizes. This position will focus on a wide range of departmental projects across the entire business including HR, Finance, Technical & Operations etc.




The successful candidate will also be responsible for developing value added solutions within the Group and identifying any potential design gaps and to provide insight into closing these.




You‚Äôll also help mentor and develop the technical skills of junior team members. The team has a strong track record of developing people and internal promotions, so if you‚Äôre looking for an opportunity to grow your career this is a great position.




Some responsibilities include:

Responsible to review and evaluate existing systems for possible enhancement or upgrade.
Routinely search for innovative ways to improve existing systems or procedures.
Responsible for maintaining and improving existing BI Content concentrating on the efficiency and stability.
Responsible for undertaking and leading work involved in large- and small-scale Delivery projects, such as Tableau report development.
Communicate well and build relationships with key users within the business.
Mentor and develop the skills of more junior members of the team.
Lead training sessions on self-service Tableau reporting with the business




ABOUT YOU:




Ideally educated to bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field.
Technical Knowledge ‚Äì T-SQL., BI Reporting Tools ‚Äì Tableau, ETL Tools, Extracting data from API‚Äôs and Data Warehousing principles.




An eye for detail
Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical approach
Well organised, good communication and reporting skills.
Ability to successfully work under tight project deadlines.
Strong mentoring/ technical training skills
Leadership skills on a project level




WHO ARE WE AND WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?




2 Sisters Food Group is one of the UK‚Äôs biggest food manufacturers providing great tasting products to the nation, from chicken to cookies and pizza to pies!




With 18 sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland. We employ over 13,500 staff, all of whom have the opportunity to progress as we focus on promoting from within and you can be part of that too.




Knowing that our business is only as good as the people we employ, we ensure that we invest in people like you to enhance skills and professional development

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst - Leeds / Hybrid

¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000 + bonus, 35-hour work week and great benefits

This profitable and growing organisation require an experienced Business Analyst, who has a proven track record of success as part of an agile delivery teams. You will be joining an organisation that operate within the professional services sector but have a unique tech offering that sets them apart from competitors.

As Business Analyst, you will support the business through the implementation and management of change, working with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and the Digital/IT team to gather and document business process requirements.

For this role, you will be expected to be in their central Leeds office two days per week.

Package:

35-hour work week with flexible working opportunities

Private Pension, medical insurance, income protection

MIP scheme / bonus opportunities

Death in service benefit 4x salary, EAP scheme

25 holidays per year plus bank holidays + buy/sell options.

Experience / Responsibilities:

Extensive experience in a business analyst or change role.

Experience implementing change.

Experience of end-to-end change delivery and customer journey mapping.

Business Process mapping, requirements gathering and capture, experience of writing user stories.

Strong stakeholder engagement.

Third Party Supplier relationship building.

Project management skills.

Strong academics, including undergraduate degree level qualification or equivalent.

Experience of working within Agile and Scrum practices.

The company have an excellent reputation within their sector, and have experienced consecutive years of growth, posting record revenues for the last financial year. They promote a healthy work-life balance and will give you the opportunity to develop your technical knowledge.

Click APPLY to be considered for the role as my client is aiming to interview as soon as possible. All interviews are to be conducted virtually, with the process requiring two stages.

Title: Biostatistician II
Description:
Biostatistician II - Great Britain

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organization. We‚Äôre proud to foster an inclusive environment driving innovation and excellence, and we welcome you to join us on our mission to shape the future of clinical development.

We are currently seeking a Biostatistician I to join our diverse and dynamic team. As a Biostatistician II at ICON, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing clinical trial data, interpreting statistical results, and contributing to the advancement of innovative treatments and therapies through rigorous biostatistical analysis.

What You Will Be Doing


Assist senior biostatisticians in clinical study support, including study design, sample size calculations, patient randomization, data analysis, and results reporting.
Support the statistical aspects of case report form design.
Help in writing statistical analysis plans, defining derived data, and designing statistical tables and figures for clinical summary reports.
Write data quality control specifications, utilize relevant computer languages and software.
Develop and execute data manipulation and analysis programs.
Assist in conducting statistical analyses and interpreting results.
Prepare statistical summary reports and contribute to the statistical methods sections of integrated study reports.
Review and document analysis and programming work for audit trail purposes.
Contribute to project document standards and maintain project-specific biostatistics files.
Collaborate effectively with ICON project team members, including data management, statistical programming, and clinical research personnel.
Embrace ICON's values, culture of process improvement, and commitment to client needs.


Your Profile:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics or a related field.
Experience in a biostatistics role in the pharmaceutical, clinical research, or healthcare industry is preferred.
Proficiency in statistical concepts, study design, sample size calculations, and patient randomization.
Familiarity with statistical analysis plans and the design of statistical tables, figures, and data listings for clinical reports.
Strong data analysis skills, including data manipulation, retrieval, and interpretation.
Proficiency in relevant computer languages and statistical software packages.
Ability to write and implement programs to select, retrieve, manipulate, edit, and analyze data.
Competency in assisting with statistical analyses and result interpretation.
Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams, including data management personnel, statistical programmers, and clinical research colleagues.


What ICON can offer you:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.

Our Benefits Examples Include


Various annual leave entitlements
A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family‚Äôs needs.
Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximize savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
Global Employee Assistance Programme, LifeWorks, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialized professionals who are there to support you and your family‚Äôs well-being.
Life assurance
Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidized travel passes, health assessments, among others.


Visit our careers site to read more about the benefits ICON offers.

ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know or submit a request here

Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless - there‚Äôs every chance you‚Äôre exactly what we‚Äôre looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

Are you a current ICON Employee? Please click here to apply

As a Biostatistician II at ICON, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing clinical trial data, interpreting statistical results, and contributing to the advancement of innovative treatments and therapies through rigorous biostatistical analysis.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Assist senior biostatisticians in clinical study support, including study design, sample size calculations, patient randomization, data analysis, and results reporting.
  • Support the statistical aspects of case report form design.
  • Help in writing statistical analysis plans, defining derived data, and designing statistical tables and figures for clinical summary reports.
  • Write data quality control specifications, utilize relevant computer languages and software.
  • Develop and execute data manipulation and analysis programs.
  • Assist in conducting statistical analyses and interpreting results.
  • Prepare statistical summary reports and contribute to the statistical methods sections of integrated study reports.
  • Review and document analysis and programming work for audit trail purposes.
  • Contribute to project document standards and maintain project-specific biostatistics files.
  • Collaborate effectively with ICON project team members, including data management, statistical programming, and clinical research personnel.
  • Embrace ICON's values, culture of process improvement, and commitment to client needs.

Your Profile:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics or a related field.
  • Experience in a biostatistics role in the pharmaceutical, clinical research, or healthcare industry is preferred.
  • Proficiency in statistical concepts, study design, sample size calculations, and patient randomization.
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis plans and the design of statistical tables, figures, and data listings for clinical reports.
  • Strong data analysis skills, including data manipulation, retrieval, and interpretation.
  • Proficiency in relevant computer languages and statistical software packages.
  • Ability to write and implement programs to select, retrieve, manipulate, edit, and analyze data.
  • Competency in assisting with statistical analyses and result interpretation.
  • Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams, including data management personnel, statistical programmers, and clinical research colleagues.

What ICON can offer you:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.

Our Benefits Examples Include

  • Various annual leave entitlements
  • A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family‚Äôs needs.
  • Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximize savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
  • Global Employee Assistance Programme, LifeWorks, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialized professionals who are there to support you and your family‚Äôs well-being.
  • Life assurance
  • Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidized travel passes, health assessments, among others.

Visit our careers site to read more about the benefits ICON offers.

ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know or submit a request here

Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless - there‚Äôs every chance you‚Äôre exactly what we‚Äôre looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

Are you a current ICON Employee? Please click here to apply

Title: IT Engineer
Description:
IT Engineer - Leeds

3 Days On Site / Hybrid + Company Car

If you are looking for a new challenge in your IT career, you might be interested in this opportunity.

We are recruiting for a European organisation with a newly established site just outside of Leeds to join as their lead IT Engineer upto ¬£35k.

As an IT support specialist, you will be responsible for providing technical assistance/troubleshooting to their staff, using various Microsoft technologies such as 365, Azure, Windows, AD, and Server OS.

This is a rare role as it is the first tech engineer in the UK and you will be heavily involved in shaping the tech landscape for them in the future.

To be successful in this role, you need to have at least 3 years of experience in a similar IT support role, preferably in a multi-location business environment. You also need to have excellent communication and problem-solving skills, as well as a customer-oriented attitude. You should be able to work independently and as part of a team, and be willing to learn new skills and technologies.

If this sounds like you, please apply now. On offer is a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as a friendly and supportive work culture. Don't miss this chance to advance your IT career!

Title: Senior Analyst, Reconciliations
Description:
Senior Reconciliation Analyst, Operational Finance- 6 month FTC- ASAP Start

Working at our iconic office in Morely, Leeds, and virtually via Microsoft Teams.

Your new role at NewDay

NewDay is seeking a skilled and experienced Analyst to join our Finance/Insurance team in Leeds As a Senior Analyst, Reconciliation, you will play a key role in ensuring the flawless execution of our financial reconciliation processes. This is a rare opportunity to join a world-class organisation that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

0-6 months you‚Äôll deliver


Perform daily reconciliation of financial data, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in a timely manner, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Create and update comprehensive documentation of reconciliation processes and procedures.
Actively seek out areas for improvement and take the lead in implementing changes to enhance processes.
Provide support to the finance team at all times including during internal and external audits.
Keep informed about the latest industry standards and regulations pertaining to financial reconciliation.
Act as deputy to the Reconciliation Manager and provide cover where required.


What You‚Äôll Bring

We need knowledge, experience + expertise in:


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience in financial reconciliation, ideally within the Finance/Insurance industry.
Accounting environments, with a basic understanding of accounting principles.
Relevant regulations and company policies.
Understanding, analysing, and presenting large volumes of numerical data.
Exceptional attention to detail and strong analytical skills.
Ambitious and self-motivated, with a track record of successfully meeting deadlines.
Strong problem-solving abilities, able to determine root causes and implement solutions.


And would love you to know or learn:


How to build and maintain excellent working relationships with a wide group in the business, building a level of mutual trust and respect.
To take accountability for actions and remains responsible for assigned GL reconciliations.
How to use role specific programmes and systems.


About NewDay

We help people move forward with credit and help our colleagues to move their careers forward too.

We use our highly flexible, scalable, and multi-product digital credit engine to power over 120 million transactions every year. Our brands include Aqua, marbles, fluid and Bip. We partner with leading brands such as John Lewis, AO, Argos and DEKO.

Over 5 million UK customers are supported by our award-winning customer service.

At NewDay, we value all types of diversity. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer and believe that our differences create a vibrant, authentic working culture. We want all our colleagues to feel able to bring their whole selves to work. We don‚Äôt discriminate on the basis of age, physical or mental disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and carer status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, sex, and sexual orientation. We make sure that every job is crafted to be inclusive and that people with disabilities or caring responsibilities can take part in the application and interview process. Tell us if you need accommodations: we‚Äôll put reasonable adjustments in place to support you.

Our dynamic NewDay culture

We‚Äôre focused on what will drive impact in helping people move forward with credit. Our distinctive culture is geared to spark innovation and team working ‚Äì with lots of open doors for development. Our customers can rely on us because we aim high, support each other, do the right thing, and build for the future.

We invest in our colleagues. On top of a strong market competitive salary, you get a bonus opportunity that matches the impact (delivery + values) you drive in your role. We also help you retire better with market leading pensions.

At NewDay, #yourwellbeing matters: You get 26 days holiday and can buy up to 5 more after probation. Then you‚Äôll get extra days as you build your career with us.

NewWork, our flexible, hybrid working approach, helps you to manage your work/life balance - and even bolt on work time in other countries before or after your holiday. And when you‚Äôre in the office, you get free healthy breakfast, fresh juices, lunch, barista coffee etc.

Our tax efficient green car and cycle to work schemes save you money (and help the planet).

Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to tell you more about any of our perks.

We work with Textio to make our job design and hiring inclusive.

Title: Cloud Security Engineer
Description:
JOB TITLE: Cloud Security Engineer

SALARY: ¬£45,954 - ¬£51,060

LOCATION(S): Edinburgh, Halifax, Leeds or Manchester

HOURS: Full-time

WORKING PATTERN: Our work style is hybrid, which involves spending at least two days per week currently, or 40% of our time at the office locations noted above.




About this opportunity

At Lloyds Banking Group, we're all driven by our purpose, to Help Britain Prosper. It's why we exist - it's our reason to get out of bed in the morning. The choices we make, our success and our future really matter. But the world is changing, fast. And we're changing too. It's never been a more exciting time to join us as we transform our business to shape finance as a force for good.




The Cloud team is on the journey to create the next generation technical platform for Lloyds Banking Group that will be at the core of one of the UK's biggest financial service transformations. We're looking for a motivated individual to work within the Cloud Security Lab as an Engineer. The role will require you to be hands-on, to collaborate with peers to engineer new or enhance infrastructure level capabilities.




The role will involve:

Understanding Bank Security policies and standards applicable to Cloud environments
Building knowledge and experience of operating in Cloud environments and Engineering teams
PoCs of new products / use-cases
Contributing to and helping create an inclusive and collaborative environment working with other platform teams to grow develop and deliver the bank's strategic outcome of becoming the largest UK Fintech.
Working with a Lead Engineer to identify a domain area to focus on development and upskilling.
Supporting SMEs with fulfilling core processes and tasks within a Product Team: fulfilling run tasks, delivering enhancements to existing capabilities / processes
Working with mentor to develop and enhance onboarding and upskilling processes for new joiners to the team
Self-managing and proactive attitude and approach to tasks assigned




Why Lloyds Banking Group

Like the modern Britain we serve, we're evolving. Investing billions in our people, data, and tech to transform the way we meet the ever-changing needs of our 26 million customers. We're growing with purpose. Join us on our journey and you will too.




What you'll need

Working knowledge and hands-on experience of working on Cloud Environments
Working knowledge and hands-on experience of key DevOps concepts, tools and languages: Source Control (GitHub), IDE / Interactive Development Environments (IDE), Command Line Interface (CLI); Terraform, Python, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Azure DevOps, GitHub, CI/CD, IaC, PaaS
Passionate about technology - wanting to commit to building skills to advance a career in Cloud Engineering and Cyber Security
Readiness to take on challenges and willingness to learn - identifying areas requiring support to fulfil tasks, confidence to engage experienced team members to help with upskilling when needed
Growth / resilient mindset: ability to take on challenges and develop an approach to overcome knowledge gaps / areas requiring upskilling
Able to be work with other engineers, understand tasks, manage stakeholders with progress updates / support needed as tasks are delivered
Awareness of the objectives of the Bank with its cloud vision, appreciation of the scope, pressures and demands of the role and dedication to put in the required effort to upskill to become a skilled and effective engineer in the team.
Able to demonstrate completion of technical, hands-on tasks (writing code, interacting with APIs, deploying / managing infrastructure, Cloud / Security focused qualifications).




And any experience of these would be really useful

Previous experience of working in Financial Services organisations
Excellent Problem-Solving skills
Cloud and/or Security certifications
Worked within a Technical / Engineering team




About working for us

Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms. We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity, or culture. We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative. And it's why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups. We're disability confident. So, if you'd like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.




We also offer a wide-ranging benefits package, which includes:

A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
An annual performance-related bonus
Share schemes including free shares.
Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping.
Generous holiday allowance, with bank holidays on top
A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies




Want to do amazing work, that's interesting and makes a difference to millions of people? Join our journey.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Leeds

3 year contract - ¬£42,821 + Training + Progression + Company Benefits + Company Bonus

Are you a Business Analyst looking for an autonomous role within a forward thinking organisation that offer on the job training, progression and opportunity for personal development?

On offer is the chance to work for a dynamic and forward-thinking organisation, committed to driving economic growth and improving the quality of life in the region. They offer competitive salaries, as well as hybrid working and flexible hours to meet the needs of their staff.

In this autonomous and varied role, you will be working closely with stakeholders to understand the needs of each department and the wider organisation. The role will involve collating and scrutinising data, and presenting your findings to allow senior figures within the business to make informed decisions based on business performance.

This role would suit a Business Analyst who is looking to join a forward thinking organisation that offer on the job training and opportunities for personal career development.

The Role:

Work with stakeholders to understand the needs of the organisation

Analyse and digitally document existing business processes

Collate data from all departments, identifying requirements

Lead responsibility for the development and implementation of business processesThe Person:

Business Analyst

Commutable to LeedsBusiness Analyst, Training, Progression, Contract, Data, Communications, IT, Projects, Information, Leeds

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates. The salary advertised is a guideline for this position.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Junior Software Engineer

Leeds - 2x a week

Salary: Up to ¬£35,000

Fruition IT are working with a well-established tech-first business who are embarking on a complete technical transformation. This client is looking to bring in a team of Software Engineers to work on a bespoke software platform as part of the business growth.

As a Junior Software Engineer, you will be surrounded by a team of talented software engineers, putting yourself in a great position to be mentored by professionals in the field, and increasing your technical skills using the latest tech. This is a great opportunity to hone your development skills and sees great opportunity for career progression.

What will I be doing?

Developing web applications and systems using JavaScript, React and Typescript, alongside senior engineers.
Support continuous improvement and integrations to enhance deployment.
Collaborate with senior engineers, architects and tested to develop unit code.
Working in an AWS environment.

Key Requirements:

1 year experience in a software development environment
Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as TypeScript and React.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a team and to your own initiative.

Desirable experience:

Knowledge of NodeJS
Knowledge of terraform as infrastructure as code.

If this role sounds of interest, please apply and someone will be in touch regarding the role.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
